original: @237a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @237a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: s'a ra sa mutstsha ya n'a ma aa bhi dharmma aa ba t'a ra t'i k'a /
analyzed: s'a ra sa mutstsha ya n'a ma aa bhi dharmma aa ba t'a ra t'i k'a /
translated: Sarvasamuccayārtha-nāma-abhidharma-avatāraṭīkā

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: chos mngon pa la 'jug pa rgya cher 'grel pa snying po kun las btus pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: chos mngon pa la 'jug pa rgya cher 'grel pa snying po kun las btus pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Essence of the Entire Collection, Called the Commentary on the Abhidharma-avatāra

original: bam po dang po ;
analyzed: bam po dang po ;
translated: Volume One

original: /'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: /'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to youthful Mañjuśrī.

original: chos mngon pa'i 'brel pa dang / dgos pa brjod par bya'o //🔽'brel pa gang gi rab tu byed pa 'di brtsams /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i 'brel pa dang / dgos pa brjod par bya'o // 'brel pa gang gi rab tu byed pa 'di brtsams /
translated: The connection and purpose of the Abhidharma should be stated.🔽What is the connection of this treatise?

original: rtsom pa 'di'i dgos pa ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtsom pa 'di'i dgos pa ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose of this composition?

original: de brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de brjod par bya ste /
translated: That should be stated.

original: 'di'i 'brel pa ni rab tu byed pa nyid las bstan te /
analyzed: 'di'i 'brel pa ni rab tu byed pa nyid las bstan te /
translated: Its connection is taught in the treatise itself.

original: ji skad du shes rab can dag ni 'phral gyi bya ba la thogs pas ma thob pa'i nyams pas kyang skrag par 'gyur zhes 'byung ba'i 'brel pa 'dis rab tu byed pa 'di brtsams so //
analyzed: ji skad du shes rab can dag ni 'phral gyi bya ba la thogs pas ma thob pa'i nyams pas kyang skrag par 'gyur zhes 'byung ba'i 'brel pa 'dis rab tu byed pa 'di brtsams so //
translated: As it says, The wise are afraid of the loss of what has not been attained due to obstacles in immediate action. This connection is the reason for composing this treatise.

original: 'brel pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'brel pa bshad zin to //
translated: The connection has been explained.

original: dgos pa ni shes rab zhan pa dang / yid mi gzhungs pa'i sems can rnams ci nas tshig gi tshogs nyung zhing gsal bas chos mngon pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgos pa ni shes rab zhan pa dang / yid mi gzhungs pa'i sems can rnams ci nas tshig gi tshogs nyung zhing gsal bas chos mngon pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The purpose is to cause those sentient beings who are of weak intelligence and dull faculties to enter into the Abhidharma by means of a collection of words that is brief and clear.

original: phyag bya ba yang dgos pa yin te /
analyzed: phyag bya ba yang dgos pa yin te /
translated: The purpose of paying homage is

original: bgegs zhi bar bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba dang / gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bgegs zhi bar bya ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba dang / gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: to serve as a cause for pacifying obstacles and to generate respect.

original: gang du gnas pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dpyad pa de ni bstan bcos so //
analyzed: gang du gnas pa dang / 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa dpyad pa de ni bstan bcos so //
translated: The treatise is that which analyzes the abiding, origination, and destruction of the world.

original: de'i phyogs gcig tu gyur pa ni rab tu byed pa ste de gang zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig tu gyur pa ni rab tu byed pa ste de gang zhe na smras pa /
translated: A chapter is a part of that treatise. What is that?

original: snying gi mun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snying gi mun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is called the darkness of the heart and so on.

original: de la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni spyir snying zhes brjod du zin kyang sems las byung ba'i chos mtha' dag sems la gnas pas gnas pa rnams ni gtso bo ma yin gyi gnas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir sems nyid la snying zhes bya bar 'dogs
analyzed: de la sems dang sems las byung ba rnams ni spyir snying zhes brjod du zin kyang sems las byung ba'i chos mtha' dag sems la gnas pas gnas pa rnams ni gtso bo ma yin gyi gnas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir sems nyid la snying zhes bya bar 'dogs
translated: Although the mind and mental factors are generally called the heart, since all mental factors abide in the mind, they are not the primary abode, but the mind itself is designated as the heart because it is the primary abode.

original: so // de la yod pas snying gi ste /
analyzed: so // de la yod pas snying gi ste /
translated: The darkness is in the heart.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: mun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: darkness.

original: de la mun pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de la mun pa zhes bya ba ni mi shes pa la bya'o //
translated: There, darkness is to be understood as ignorance.

original: ji ltar mun pa zhes bya ba mi shes pa la bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mun pa zhes bya ba mi shes pa la bya zhe na /
translated: How is darkness to be understood as ignorance?

original: chos mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of similarity.

original: dper na mun pa ni ma nor @237b bar mthong ba la phyir 'jil ba'o //
analyzed: dper na mun pa ni ma nor @237b bar mthong ba la phyir 'jil ba'o //
translated: For example, darkness is the obscuration of unmistaken seeing.

original: mi shes pa yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: mi shes pa yang de bzhin te /
translated: Ignorance is also like that.

original: de dang chos mthun pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Because of similarity with that, it is said.

original: mun nga ci 'dra ba la bya zhe na /
analyzed: mun nga ci 'dra ba la bya zhe na /
translated: What is darkness like?

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: ngan song rtsa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngan song rtsa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the root of the lower realms.

original: ngan par 'gro bas ngan song ste /
analyzed: ngan par 'gro bas ngan song ste /
translated: The lower realms are so called because of going to the lower realms.

original: ngan song ni sems can dmyal ba ngang dud 'gro dang yi dags la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: ngan song ni sems can dmyal ba ngang dud 'gro dang yi dags la sogs pa'o//
translated: The lower realms are the hells, animals, hungry ghosts, and so on.

original: mi 'dod pa'i las skyes pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi bar chad byed pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa'i las skyes pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi bar chad byed pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: They are suffering because of being born from undesirable actions and obstructing the noble path.

original: de dag gi rtsa ba ni byed rgyu ste rgyur gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gi rtsa ba ni byed rgyu ste rgyur gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Their root is the active cause, which is to say, the cause.

original: de dag tu gang 'gro ba de ni ngan par 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de dag tu gang 'gro ba de ni ngan par 'gro ba ste /
translated: That which goes to them is the bad destiny.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams las ngan par 'gro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams las ngan par 'gro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the bad destiny because it is the bad destiny of the wholesome dharmas.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba na 'dir 'phags pa'i lam dang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba na 'dir 'phags pa'i lam dang so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la bya'o //
translated: Here, the wholesome refers to the noble path and the cessation due to deliberation.

original: de dag ni dge ba yang yin la chos kyang yin pas dge ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni dge ba yang yin la chos kyang yin pas dge ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: Since they are wholesome and dharmas, they are the wholesome dharmas.

original: de la sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan 'gro log par ltung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir 'di ni ngan song gi rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: de la sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan 'gro log par ltung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir 'di ni ngan song gi rtsa ba'o //
translated: The root of the bad destinies is the cause of the suffering of the bad destinies, such as the hells.

original: 'dis de'i phyi rol gyi mun pa dang mtshungs par ston te /
analyzed: 'dis de'i phyi rol gyi mun pa dang mtshungs par ston te /
translated: This is like the darkness outside.

original: de ni tsher ma la sogs par rdeg 'cha' ba la sogs pa ngan par song ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni tsher ma la sogs par rdeg 'cha' ba la sogs pa ngan par song ba'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: The root of the bad destinies is the striking with thorns, etc.

original: gsung nyid 'od zer yin pas gsung gi 'od zer te /
analyzed: gsung nyid 'od zer yin pas gsung gi 'od zer te /
translated: The light rays of speech are the light rays of speech because speech itself is the light rays.

original: mi shes pa'i mun pa drungs nas 'byin pa'i mthu'i khyad par gyis 'od zer dang 'dra bas 'od zer dag go //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i mun pa drungs nas 'byin pa'i mthu'i khyad par gyis 'od zer dang 'dra bas 'od zer dag go //
translated: They are like light rays because of the special power of their light rays, which completely eliminate the darkness of ignorance.

original: gsung zhes bya ba ni gang gis bya ba dang yon tan dang dus dang 'brel pa can gyi khyad par rnams khong du chud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsung zhes bya ba ni gang gis bya ba dang yon tan dang dus dang 'brel pa can gyi khyad par rnams khong du chud par byed pa'o //
translated: Speech is that which causes one to understand the distinctions of action, quality, and time.

original: de ni sgra las don gzhan du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de ni sgra las don gzhan du gyur pa ste /
translated: It is different from sound.

original: ji skad du tshig ni yan lag med pa don go bar byed nus pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du tshig ni yan lag med pa don go bar byed nus pa'o //
translated: As it is said, “A word is that which is able to convey meaning without parts.”

original: sgra ni rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pas yan lag med par mi 'thad do zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgra ni rdul phra rab bsags pa yin pas yan lag med par mi 'thad do zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
translated: Sound is an aggregation of subtle particles, so it is not tenable that it is without parts.

original: gsung gi 'od zer dag gis zhes bya ba ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsung gi 'od zer dag gis zhes bya ba ni byed pa'o //
translated: By the light rays of speech, which is the agent.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni mdzad pa po'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni mdzad pa po'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: By whom is the characteristic of the agent.

original: mdzad pa po gang gis gsung gi 'od zer byed par gyur pa rnams kyis mun pa bcom ste bcad pa'o //
analyzed: mdzad pa po gang gis gsung gi 'od zer byed par gyur pa rnams kyis mun pa bcom ste bcad pa'o //
translated: By which agent, the light rays of speech are produced, darkness is destroyed, that is, cut off.

original: su ngag gi zhe na /
analyzed: su ngag gi zhe na /
translated: Whose speech?

original: lha mi rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: lha mi rnams kyi'o //
translated: The speech of gods and humans.

original: lha zhes bya ba ni mi 'chi ba la bya ste /🔽de dag phal cher gzhan gyi gnod pa'i rgyus 'chi ba med pas mi 'chi ba zhes bya ba mi 'chi ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba ni mi 'chi ba la bya ste / de dag phal cher gzhan gyi gnod pa'i rgyus 'chi ba med pas mi 'chi ba zhes bya ba mi 'chi ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: The term “god” refers to one who is immortal.🔽Since they are not subject to death by the harm of others, they are called “immortal.”

original: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag go zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad mi rtag go zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not because they are immortal, since it is said that all conditioned things are impermanent.

original: 'dis ni lha dang mi rnams 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la 'jug nus par ston to //🔽tshigs @238a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni lha dang mi rnams 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la 'jug nus par ston to // tshigs @238a * //
translated: This shows that gods and humans are able to enter the four noble truths.

original: su bcad pa phyed po 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan gyi don sgrub pa phun sum tshogs par brjod do //
analyzed: su bcad pa phyed po 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan gyi don sgrub pa phun sum tshogs par brjod do //
translated: This half-verse shows the perfection of the Blessed One’s accomplishment of the aims of others.

original: phyed 'og mas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyed 'og mas rang gi don phun sum tshogs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The second half shows the perfection of his own aim.

original: thams cad mkhyen nyid dkyil 'khor dri med pa //🔽zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen nyid dkyil 'khor dri med pa // zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The stainless mandala of omniscience🔽is the basis of the light rays of the Dharma, which remove the pain of the mental afflictions.

original: shes par bya ba dngos po thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: shes par bya ba dngos po thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One is omniscient because he has completely understood all aspects of all things that can be known.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i dngos po ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i dngos po ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //
translated: The state of omniscience is omniscience.

original: de yang bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa ste /
analyzed: de yang bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir dri ma med pa ste /
translated: And that is stainless because it is free from the stain of the afflictions together with their traces.

original: gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dri ma med pa'i dkyil 'khor du gyur pa de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dkyil 'khor dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dri ma med pa'i dkyil 'khor du gyur pa de thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dkyil 'khor dri ma med pa'o //
translated: That which is the stainless sphere of omniscience is the stainless sphere of omniscience.

original: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dkyil 'khor dri ma med pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi dkyil 'khor dri ma med pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Therefore, homage to that stainless sphere of omniscience.

original: 'di ni gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i thabs su yang ston te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i thabs su yang ston te /
translated: This is also taught as the means of accomplishing the welfare of others.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas ni gzhan gyi mi shes pa'i mun pa mang po thog ma med pa'i dus nas bsags pa dbral bar dka' bsel bar mi nus so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pas ni gzhan gyi mi shes pa'i mun pa mang po thog ma med pa'i dus nas bsags pa dbral bar dka' bsel bar mi nus so //
translated: For one who is not omniscient cannot dispel the thick darkness of others' ignorance, which has been accumulating since beginningless time.

original: mi shes pa'i gnyid dang bral ba'i phyir skyes bu sad pa dang 'dra bas sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i gnyid dang bral ba'i phyir skyes bu sad pa dang 'dra bas sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Buddha is like a person who is awake because he is free from the sleep of ignorance.

original: yang na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang dus rnam par grol ba shes bya rnam pa bzhi ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: yang na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba dang dus rnam par grol ba shes bya rnam pa bzhi ji lta ba bzhin du phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas so //
translated: Or else, he is the Buddha because he has penetrated the four kinds of knowable objects, the past, future, present, and the liberated from time, without error, just as they are.

original: mun pa sel ba la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir nyi ma dang 'dra bas nyi ma'o //
analyzed: mun pa sel ba la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir nyi ma dang 'dra bas nyi ma'o //
translated: He is the sun because he is like the sun, since he is like a lamp, etc.

original: sangs rgyas nyid nyi ma yin pas sangs rgyas nyi ma ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid nyi ma yin pas sangs rgyas nyi ma ste /
translated: The Buddha is the sun, therefore he is the sun-Buddha.

original: nang dang phyi'i mun pa sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i mun pa sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he removes the darkness of self and other.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di las bdag dang gzhan la phan par bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa la phyag bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di las bdag dang gzhan la phan par bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa la phyag bya bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: In this verse, one should understand that homage is paid to the perfection of the accomplishment of benefit for self and other.

original: phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang sems btud pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag dang sems btud pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Homage is the characteristic of the bowing of body, speech, and mind.

original: bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal bas bsod nams kyi tshogs bskyed kyi rog tu des gsungs pa'i gsung gi lam gyi rjes su 'gro ba slob ma dam pa rnams la gus pa dang / dga' ba skyes nas ri mo byed par 'dod pas tshigs su bcad pa gzhan /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la phyag 'tshal bas bsod nams kyi tshogs bskyed kyi rog tu des gsungs pa'i gsung gi lam gyi rjes su 'gro ba slob ma dam pa rnams la gus pa dang / dga' ba skyes nas ri mo byed par 'dod pas tshigs su bcad pa gzhan /
translated: By paying homage to the Bhagavat, the accumulation of merit is generated. In order to generate respect and joy in the excellent disciples who follow the path of speech taught by him, with the desire to make an image, he composed another verse:

original: gang dag chos mngon tshul gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: gang dag chos mngon tshul gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nye bar bkod do //
translated: “Those who, by the method of Abhidharma…” and so on.

original: de la don dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du gyur pas shes rab 'khor dang bcas pa ni chos mngon pa'o //
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa mngon du gyur pas shes rab 'khor dang bcas pa ni chos mngon pa'o //
translated: There, the Abhidharma is the wisdom together with its retinue that manifests the ultimate Dharma, nirvana.

original: de'i tshul @238b ni lam mo //
analyzed: de'i tshul @238b ni lam mo //
translated: Its method is the path.

original: chos ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Dharma is form and so on.

original: mtshan nyid ni rang dang spyi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni rang dang spyi la sogs pa'o //
translated: Its characteristics are its own characteristics, general characteristics, and so on.

original: chos mngon pa nyid tshul yin pas chos mngon pa'i tshul te chos mngon pa'i lugs so //
analyzed: chos mngon pa nyid tshul yin pas chos mngon pa'i tshul te chos mngon pa'i lugs so //
translated: Since the Abhidharma itself is the method, it is the method of Abhidharma, the system of Abhidharma.

original: tshul dang lugs dang rigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul dang lugs dang rigs pa zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: “Method,” “system,” and “reasoning” belong to the same category.

original: rmongs pa ni mgo myos pa ste /
analyzed: rmongs pa ni mgo myos pa ste /
translated: Delusion is a state of mental confusion.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du ma chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du ma chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means not understanding the specific and general characteristics of phenomena.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la rmongs pa de gang dag gis dang gang gi yin pa chos mngon pa'i tshul gyis drungs nas phyung zhing bton pa de dag chos mngon pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi mtshan nyid la rmongs pa drungs nas phyung ba yin te /🔽rnam pa de lta bu de dag la bdag phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la rmongs pa de gang dag gis dang gang gi yin pa chos mngon pa'i tshul gyis drungs nas phyung zhing bton pa de dag chos mngon pa'i tshul gyis chos kyi mtshan nyid la rmongs pa drungs nas phyung ba yin te / rnam pa de lta bu de dag la bdag phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Those who have completely uprooted and removed the delusion regarding the characteristics of phenomena by means of the method of the Abhidharma have completely uprooted the delusion regarding the characteristics of phenomena by means of the method of the Abhidharma.🔽I pay homage to those who are of that kind.

original: rab tu phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: I pay homage to them.

original: mgo pos zhes bya ba ni spyi bos so //
analyzed: mgo pos zhes bya ba ni spyi bos so //
translated: With my head means with my crown.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de dag lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos de'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos de'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the basis of the Dharma, which has the nature of scripture and realization.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka' yi gnas gyur pa //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka' yi gnas gyur pa //
translated: The abode of the speech of the Omniscient One

original: zhes bya ba de nyid gnas kyi dngos por ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de nyid gnas kyi dngos por ston to //
translated: shows that they are the actual abode.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ni bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ni bde bar gshegs pa ste /
translated: The Omniscient One is the Sugata.

original: de'i bka' ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka'o //
analyzed: de'i bka' ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka'o //
translated: His word is the word of the Omniscient One.

original: gnas ni gzhi'o //
analyzed: gnas ni gzhi'o //
translated: The basis is the foundation.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka'i gnas ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka'i rten du gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka'i gnas ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i bka'i rten du gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The basis of the word of the Omniscient One is the foundation of the word of the Omniscient One.

original: chos mngon pa'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol du phyin pa mtha' dag la bye brag med par phyag bya ba sngar bya ste yon tan rnams brjod nas /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i rgya mtsho'i pha rol du phyin pa mtha' dag la bye brag med par phyag bya ba sngar bya ste yon tan rnams brjod nas /
translated: Having praised the qualities of the entire ocean of Abhidharma, which is the basis of the word of the Omniscient One, one should first pay homage to the entire Abhidharma, without distinction.

original: rang gi bla ma la phyag bya ba spyod pa bzang po bya bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: rang gi bla ma la phyag bya ba spyod pa bzang po bya bar 'dod pas /
translated: Then, wishing to perform the good conduct of paying homage to one's own guru,

original: blo zhan rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di rtsom mo //
analyzed: blo zhan rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di rtsom mo //
translated: one composes this [text] beginning with for those of little intelligence and so on.

original: blo zhan pa gang yin pa de dag blo zhan pa rnams te shes rab zhan pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: blo zhan pa gang yin pa de dag blo zhan pa rnams te shes rab zhan pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those who are of little intelligence are those of little intelligence, which is a synonym for those of little wisdom.

original: shes rab zhan pa de dag gis bshad ma legs pa ni ma legs bshad pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab zhan pa de dag gis bshad ma legs pa ni ma legs bshad pa'o //
translated: The bad explanation by those of little wisdom is bad explanation.

original: ma legs par bshad pa nyid mun pa yin pas ma legs par bshad pa'i mun pa'o //
analyzed: ma legs par bshad pa nyid mun pa yin pas ma legs par bshad pa'i mun pa'o //
translated: Since bad explanation itself is darkness, it is the darkness of bad explanation.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs thub pa dang ldan pas thub pa ste /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs thub pa dang ldan pas thub pa ste /
translated: Muni is one who possesses the body, speech, and mind of an ascetic.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung ngo //
translated: It is the speech of the Blessed One, the Buddha.

original: ma legs par bshad pa'i mun pas khebs pa ni phyin ci log tu bshad pa'i mun pas khebs pa ste /
analyzed: ma legs par bshad pa'i mun pas khebs pa ni phyin ci log tu bshad pa'i mun pas khebs pa ste /
translated: The darkness of bad explanations is the darkness of mistaken explanations.

original: bsgribs pa'o / gang gis legs par bshad pa sgron mas snang bar mdzad pa ni gsal bar mdzad pa kun du bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bsgribs pa'o / gang gis legs par bshad pa sgron mas snang bar mdzad pa ni gsal bar mdzad pa kun du bstan pa'o //
translated: The one who illuminates with the lamp of good explanations is the one who illuminates, who teaches.

original: bstan bcos gang gis mi shes pa bsal ba dang / bden pa yang dag pa'i dngos po brjod pa'i phyir bstan @239a * //🔽bcos la sgron ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos gang gis mi shes pa bsal ba dang / bden pa yang dag pa'i dngos po brjod pa'i phyir bstan @239a * // bcos la sgron ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The treatise is called a lamp because it removes ignorance and expresses the truth of reality.

original: yang na chos mngon pa'i sgron ma mdzad pa la sgron ma mdzad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na chos mngon pa'i sgron ma mdzad pa la sgron ma mdzad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, the one who makes the lamp of Abhidharma is called the lamp-maker.

original: sgron ma mdzad pas sgron ma mdzad de /
analyzed: sgron ma mdzad pas sgron ma mdzad de /
translated: The lamp-maker makes the lamp.

original: de'i phyir sgron ma mdzad pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgron ma mdzad pa de la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Therefore, I pay homage to that lamp-maker.

original: des log par bshad pa'i mun pa bsal bas sgron ma dang 'dra ba'i phyir sgron ma zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des log par bshad pa'i mun pa bsal bas sgron ma dang 'dra ba'i phyir sgron ma zhes bya ste /
translated: Since it is like a lamp because it dispels the darkness of wrong explanation, it is called a lamp.

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid ma nor bar bstan pa bstan bcos mdzad pa de la shin tu gus par gyur nas bstod do //
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid ma nor bar bstan pa bstan bcos mdzad pa de la shin tu gus par gyur nas bstod do //
translated: Having become very respectful toward the author of the treatise, who unerringly teaches the nature of reality, he praises him.

original: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ji ltar 'dod pa rnams la phyag 'tshal nas /
analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ji ltar 'dod pa rnams la phyag 'tshal nas /
translated: Thus, having paid homage to the three objects of desire with three verses,

original: la la dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu byed pa rtsom mo //
analyzed: la la dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu byed pa rtsom mo //
translated: he composes the treatise beginning with “Some say…”

original: blo chung ba dang 'bring dang chen po tha dad pa'i phyir ming ma smos so //
analyzed: blo chung ba dang 'bring dang chen po tha dad pa'i phyir ming ma smos so //
translated: He does not mention their names because they are of different levels of intelligence, low, middling, and high.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Indeed” means “for what reason.”

original: thub pa'i dbang po ni thub pa rnams kya dbang po yin pas thub pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: thub pa'i dbang po ni thub pa rnams kya dbang po yin pas thub pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: The Lord of Sages is the lord of sages, thus he is the Lord of Sages.

original: zag pa med pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid thub pa yod pa'i phyir nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni thub pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go//
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid thub pa yod pa'i phyir nyan thos rnams dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams ni thub pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go//
translated: The Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas are called Muni because they have the power of body, speech and mind that is free from impurity.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni chos thams cad la mnga' brnyes pa'i phyir de dag gi rje dang rgyal po yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni chos thams cad la mnga' brnyes pa'i phyir de dag gi rje dang rgyal po yin no //
translated: The Lord is their lord and king because he has attained mastery over all dharmas.

original: ji ste thub pa dag gi rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa bstan kyang gang gis thub pa de dag rnam par gzhag pa de mi shes so zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste thub pa dag gi rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa bstan kyang gang gis thub pa de dag rnam par gzhag pa de mi shes so zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Why is it that even though the Muni’s arrangement is taught, one does not know what the Muni’s arrangement is? ”

original: chos nyid kyis so //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis so //
translated: It is by means of the dharmata.

original: 'dir ni chos nyid ces bya ba 'phags pa'i lam la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni chos nyid ces bya ba 'phags pa'i lam la bya'o //
translated: Here, the dharmata refers to the noble path.

original: 'di ni thub pa'i dbang po'i yin pas thub pa'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thub pa'i dbang po'i yin pas thub pa'i dbang po'o //
translated: It is the Muni’s lord, therefore it is the Muni’s lord.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gsung rab ste gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: gsung rab ste gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: It is the scriptures, the twelve branches of the scriptures.

original: mtha' dag ni ma lus pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' dag ni ma lus pa'o //
translated: The entirety is the totality.

original: don dang tshig ces bya ba la gong mas ni bshad pa bzung ba ston to //
analyzed: don dang tshig ces bya ba la gong mas ni bshad pa bzung ba ston to //
translated: The words “meaning and words” show that the explanation is taken from above.

original: 'og mas ni yi ge'o //
analyzed: 'og mas ni yi ge'o //
translated: The next line refers to the letters.

original: yang na don gyis ni nges par legs pa bsgrub pa'o //🔽tshig gis ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: yang na don gyis ni nges par legs pa bsgrub pa'o // tshig gis ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa'o //
translated: Or else, the meaning is the attainment of definite excellence.

original: skal pa yod pa'i ngang tshul can //
analyzed: skal pa yod pa'i ngang tshul can //
translated: The words are the comprehension of the characteristics of the individual and universal natures.🔽Those who are capable

original: zhes bya ba ni nus par ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nus par ston to //
translated: This shows the capacity.

original: skal ba nyid skal pa yod pa'i ngang tshul can te /
analyzed: skal ba nyid skal pa yod pa'i ngang tshul can te /
translated: Those who are capable are those who have the capacity.

original: len pa dang 'dzin pa dang khong du chud par byed nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: len pa dang 'dzin pa dang khong du chud par byed nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they are able to receive, retain, and comprehend.🔽The virtuous

original: dge ba dag ces bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa ste tshul bzang po la mngon par dga' ba so so'i skye bo dge ba dag go //
analyzed: dge ba dag ces bya ba ni skyes bu dam pa ste tshul bzang po la mngon par dga' ba so so'i skye bo dge ba dag go //
translated: The virtuous are ordinary beings who are good people, who delight in the good way.🔽Are

original: yin zhes bya ba ni de ltar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yin zhes bya ba ni de ltar gyur pa'o //
translated: This is the state of being such as has been described.🔽Even though they have received

original: zin kyang zhes bya ba ni srid pa ste phyi rol gyi rkyen gyi spyod pa ston to //
analyzed: zin kyang zhes bya ba ni srid pa ste phyi rol gyi rkyen gyi spyod pa ston to //
translated: This shows the external conditions of practice.

original: ji skad du 'jig rten gyi mgon pos yang dag pa'i lta ba skye @239b ba'i rgyu gnyis rkyen gnyis te /
analyzed: ji skad du 'jig rten gyi mgon pos yang dag pa'i lta ba skye @239b ba'i rgyu gnyis rkyen gnyis te /
translated: As the Lord of the World has said, “There are two causes and two conditions for the arising of right view.

original: gzhan gyi sgra dang nang du tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra dang nang du tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: and the inner proper mental attention.

original: de'i phyir skal pa yod ces bya ba ni nang gi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skal pa yod ces bya ba ni nang gi rgyu'o //
translated: Thus, the statement “one who has the fortune” refers to the inner cause.

original: yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi man ngag go //
analyzed: yin zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi man ngag go //
translated: The statement “is” refers to the instruction of another.

original: gang la zhe na thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab mtha' dag la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhe na thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung rab mtha' dag la'o //
translated: With regard to what? With regard to the entire teaching of the Lord of Sages.

original: de ltar nus pa thob pa dag ci'i phyir yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhe na /🔽smras pa / 'phral gyi bya ba la thogs pas //
analyzed: de ltar nus pa thob pa dag ci'i phyir yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhe na / smras pa / 'phral gyi bya ba la thogs pas //
translated: How is it that those who have attained the ability to do this retrogress?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The root text states, “because of being occupied with immediate activities.”

original: bya bas brel ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bya bas brel ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means being busy with activities.

original: ma thob pa'i nyams pa'i ni ma thob pa yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: ma thob pa'i nyams pa'i ni ma thob pa yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: The retrogressing of nonacquisition is the retrogressing of the nonacquisition of the āryadharm as.

original: de la yongs su nyams pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la yongs su nyams pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of retrogressing:

original: thob pa yongs su nyams pa dang / ma thob pa yongs su nyams pa dang / longs spyod pa yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa yongs su nyams pa dang / ma thob pa yongs su nyams pa dang / longs spyod pa yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: retrogressing from acquisition, retrogressing from nonacquisition, and retrogressing from enjoyment.

original: de la bsam gtan la sogs pa thob pa'i yon tan dag las nyams pa ni thob pa yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan la sogs pa thob pa'i yon tan dag las nyams pa ni thob pa yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: The degeneration of the qualities obtained through the attainment of the meditative states and so on is the complete degeneration of obtainment.

original: nus pa la ma thob pa ni ma thob pa yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa la ma thob pa ni ma thob pa yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: The nonobtainment of ability is the complete degeneration of nonobtainment.

original: thob pa mngon du mi byed pa ni longs spyod pa yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa mngon du mi byed pa ni longs spyod pa yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: The nonmanifestation of obtainment is the complete degeneration of enjoyment.

original: ci'i phyir ma thob pa yongs su nyams pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba dag ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma thob pa yongs su nyams pa yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba dag ste /
translated: Why is the complete degeneration of nonobtainment called complete degeneration?

original: len pa dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i skal pa med par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: len pa dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i skal pa med par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that one becomes unfit to take up and hold and so on.

original: shes rab zhan pa la la dag ni blo zhan pa la dag go //
analyzed: shes rab zhan pa la la dag ni blo zhan pa la dag go //
translated: Some with weak wisdom are of weak mind.

original: tshig dang don dka' ste thibs po dang 'dra bas glag glag pa ste /
analyzed: tshig dang don dka' ste thibs po dang 'dra bas glag glag pa ste /
translated: The words and meanings are difficult and resemble a thicket.

original: chos mngon pa nyid glag glag pas chos mngon pa glag glag pa'o //
analyzed: chos mngon pa nyid glag glag pas chos mngon pa glag glag pa'o //
translated: The Abhidharma is a thicket because it is difficult to penetrate.

original: glag glag pa dang stug po zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs su gtags pa'o //
analyzed: glag glag pa dang stug po zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs su gtags pa'o //
translated: The terms thicket and dense forest are synonyms.

original: chos mngon pa glag glag pa ming thos pa tsam gyis kyang skrag par 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos mngon pa glag glag pa ming thos pa tsam gyis kyang skrag par 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
translated: The Abhidharma is like a great ocean, and just hearing its name causes fear.

original: skrag pa ni sgyid lug pa dang khong dngangs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste //
analyzed: skrag pa ni sgyid lug pa dang khong dngangs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste //
translated: Fear means discouragement and terror.

original: khong du chud par mi nus pas rgya mtsho skems pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: khong du chud par mi nus pas rgya mtsho skems pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is like trying to dry up the ocean.

original: khong du chud par 'dod pa yang yod de zhes bya ba ni shes par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: khong du chud par 'dod pa yang yod de zhes bya ba ni shes par 'dod pa'o //
translated: There are those who wish to understand means those who wish to know.

original: de bas na de dag dga' bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na de dag dga' bar bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, in order to delight them, I will explain the characteristics of the Abhidharma.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, therefore means for that reason.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni 'dir gnyis ka dang sbyar te skal pa yod pa'i ngang tshul can dang / skal pa med pa'i dang tshul can rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni 'dir gnyis ka dang sbyar te skal pa yod pa'i ngang tshul can dang / skal pa med pa'i dang tshul can rnams so //
translated: The word them refers to both those who are suitable and those who are not suitable.

original: de dag dga' bar bya ba'i don ni de dag dga' bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dga' bar bya ba'i don ni de dag dga' bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to delight them means for the purpose of delighting them.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag gi bya ba ston to //
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba ni bdag gi bya ba ston to //
translated: The phrase I will explain shows the activity of the self.

original: chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgya mtsho ni /
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgya mtsho ni /
translated: The ocean of the characteristics of the Abhidharma is like a great ocean.

original: chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid nyid rgya mtsho'o //
analyzed: chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid nyid rgya mtsho'o //
translated: The characteristic of the Abhidharma is the ocean.

original: 'jug pa ni 'jug par @240a * //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni 'jug par @240a * //
translated: The entrance is the entrance.

original: byed pa'o // tsam ni de tsam mo //
analyzed: byed pa'o // tsam ni de tsam mo //
translated: The mere is just that.

original: gong du bshad pa'i slob ma phan gdags par bya ba gnyis la phan gdags pa'i phyir chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid de la 'jug pa tsam 'di'o //
analyzed: gong du bshad pa'i slob ma phan gdags par bya ba gnyis la phan gdags pa'i phyir chos mngon pa'i mtshan nyid de la 'jug pa tsam 'di'o //
translated: This is the mere entrance into the characteristic of the Abhidharma for the sake of benefiting the two disciples mentioned above.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba rab tu byed pa blo la gzhag pas mngon sum dang 'dra bar ston te //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni brjod par bya ba rab tu byed pa blo la gzhag pas mngon sum dang 'dra bar ston te //
translated: The word this indicates the topic to be discussed, as if it were present, by placing it in the mind.

original: brtsam mo zhes bya ba ni bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brtsam mo zhes bya ba ni bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word shall compose means will make.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni nang gi de kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni nang gi de kho na'o //
translated: The word this refers to the inner reality.

original: brtsam mo zhes bya ba ni phyi'i de lo na'o //
analyzed: brtsam mo zhes bya ba ni phyi'i de lo na'o //
translated: The word shall compose refers to the outer reality.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: smras pa / 'di lta ste bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di lta ste bde bar gshegs pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said: Thus, of the Sugatas, etc.

original: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di lta ste zhes bya ba ni nye bar bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The word thus has the meaning of indication.

original: 'di dag bde bar gshegs pa'i yin pas bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag bde bar gshegs pa'i yin pas bde bar gshegs pa ste /
translated: Since these are of the Sugatas, they are Sugata-s.

original: de dag gi bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The Sugata has taught these in the Abhidharma.

original: 'di la slob dpon gyis grangs dang ming dang rab tu dbye ba dang mtshan nyid dang rnam pa 'di bzhis dngos po brgyad bkod de /
analyzed: 'di la slob dpon gyis grangs dang ming dang rab tu dbye ba dang mtshan nyid dang rnam pa 'di bzhis dngos po brgyad bkod de /
translated: Here, the Master has set forth the eight entities by way of the four: number, name, classification, and characteristic.

original: de la grangs ni dngos po brgyad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la grangs ni dngos po brgyad ces bya ba'o //
translated: Among them, the number is called “eight entities.”

original: ming ni gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ming ni gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The name is called “form,” etc.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni de la gzugs ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni de la gzugs ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The classification is called “form is twofold,” etc.

original: mtshan nyid ni sra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni sra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristic is called “the solid,” etc.

original: de la tshig ha cang mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa la mi dga' ba rnams kyi ched du bde bar gshegs pa pa'i dngos po bsdu ba'i phyir ha cang mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa yang ma yin pa'i rnam pa brgyad ces grangs bstan to //
analyzed: de la tshig ha cang mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa la mi dga' ba rnams kyi ched du bde bar gshegs pa pa'i dngos po bsdu ba'i phyir ha cang mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa yang ma yin pa'i rnam pa brgyad ces grangs bstan to //
translated: For the sake of collecting the entities of the Sugata, the number is taught as “eight entities” in order to avoid being too concise or too extensive for those who do not like conciseness or extensiveness.

original: grangs bstan pa rnams kyi bgrang bar bya ba rnams yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir gzugs dang / tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //🔽ming smos pa rnams kyi ming can dag gi tshad yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: grangs bstan pa rnams kyi bgrang bar bya ba rnams yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir gzugs dang / tshor ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so // ming smos pa rnams kyi ming can dag gi tshad yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The words form, feeling, etc. are stated in order to make known the things that are enumerated in the teaching of the enumeration.

original: gzugs ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gzugs ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The words form is twofold are stated in order to make known the measure of those things that are referred to by names.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni ma bye ba'i phyogs la tshig nye bar dgod pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni ma bye ba'i phyogs la tshig nye bar dgod pa'i don to //
translated: Therein, the word therein has the sense of a locative case in the uncompounded sense.

original: phye ba'i phyogs la ni dgar ba'i don to //
analyzed: phye ba'i phyogs la ni dgar ba'i don to //
translated: In the compounded sense, it has the sense of a genitive case.

original: rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis so //🔽rnam pa gnyis po de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis so // rnam pa gnyis po de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The words it is twofold mean it is of two kinds.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to make known precisely those two kinds, he says, elemental and derivative form.

original: de la 'byung ba rnams kyis ni rgyu'i gzugs te gnas kyi gzugs ston to //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba rnams kyis ni rgyu'i gzugs te gnas kyi gzugs ston to //
translated: Therein, the elemental forms are the cause of form, i.e., the form that is the basis.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'bras bu'i gzugs te gnas pa'i gzugs ston to //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'bras bu'i gzugs te gnas pa'i gzugs ston to //
translated: The phrase “derived from the elements” indicates the resultant form, that is, the form that is present.

original: 'byung ba dag ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni grangs nges pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba dag ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni grangs nges pa ste /
translated: The phrase “there are four great elements” indicates the number of the elements.

original: nam mkha' ni 'byung ba chen @240b po ma yin no zhes dgag pa'i don to //🔽rang gi mtshan nyid ni de rang yang yin la mtshan nyid kyang yin pas rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni 'byung ba chen @240b po ma yin no zhes dgag pa'i don to // rang gi mtshan nyid ni de rang yang yin la mtshan nyid kyang yin pas rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The phrase “there are no more than four” indicates that there is no fifth great element, such as space.🔽The phrase “each of which has its own intrinsic nature” indicates the specific characteristic of each of the elements.

original: dngos po gzhan thams cad las bzlog pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan thams cad las bzlog pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The intrinsic nature of each element is its own individual essence, which is not shared with any other entity.

original: dper na sa ni sra ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa ni sra ba'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the earth element has the intrinsic nature of solidity.

original: gang mang po dag la tha mi dad par yod pa'i ngo bo de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid de dper na mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang mang po dag la tha mi dad par yod pa'i ngo bo de ni spyi'i mtshan nyid de dper na mi rtag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The general characteristic of all entities is that they are impermanent, painful, empty, and insubstantial.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba smos pa la rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba smos pa la rgyur byas pa'i gzugs kyi don gang yin zhe na /
translated: The phrase “form that is derived” indicates the form that is derived from the elements.

original: rgyu'i don ni rgyur byas pa'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu'i don ni rgyur byas pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the term “derived” is that of a cause.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'i gzugs ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgyu las byung ba'i gzugs ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs te /
translated: Form derived from the four great elements is derivative form.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is also called form derived from the elements.

original: sra ba dang gsher ba dang tsha ba dang g-yo ba nyid dag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sra ba dang gsher ba dang tsha ba dang g-yo ba nyid dag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four great elements are earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: nyid ni de'i dngos po'o //🔽de la sra ba nyid ni brtan pa dang / mkhrang ba zhes bya ba dang don gcig go //🔽gsher ba nyid ni 'dzeg pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽tsha ba nyid ni bsreg pa tshig par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyid ni de'i dngos po'o // de la sra ba nyid ni brtan pa dang / mkhrang ba zhes bya ba dang don gcig go // gsher ba nyid ni 'dzeg pa'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // tsha ba nyid ni bsreg pa tshig par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The nature of each is its essence.

original: g-yo ba nyid ni 'gro bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽las ni brten pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: g-yo ba nyid ni 'gro bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // las ni brten pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Earth has the essence of solidity, water has the essence of fluidity, fire has the essence of heat, and wind has the essence of motion.

original: de la 'dzin pa ni sa'i las so //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa ni sa'i las so //
translated: The function of earth is support,

original: sbyor ba ni chu'i las so //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni chu'i las so //
translated: The function of water is cohesion,

original: smin par byed pa ni me'i las so //
analyzed: smin par byed pa ni me'i las so //
translated: The function of fire is maturation,

original: bskyod pa ni rlung gi las so //
analyzed: bskyod pa ni rlung gi las so //
translated: And the function of wind is expansion.🔽The function of earth is support, because it is the basis for all that grows.🔽The function of water is cohesion, because it holds together.🔽The function of fire is maturation, because it ripens.🔽The function of wind is expansion, because it increases.

original: de la bskyod pa ni 'phel ba dang 'gro bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la bskyod pa ni 'phel ba dang 'gro bar byed pa'o //
translated: Movement is that which increases and moves.

original: 'di ni 'dir grangs ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir grangs ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, the order is as stated.

original: skyed pa dang rten pa dang gnas pa dang rton pa dang 'phel bar byed pa'i don gyis rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad 'dzin pa'i phyir byed pa'i rgyu 'di ni rnam pa lngar dbye'o //
analyzed: skyed pa dang rten pa dang gnas pa dang rton pa dang 'phel bar byed pa'i don gyis rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad 'dzin pa'i phyir byed pa'i rgyu 'di ni rnam pa lngar dbye'o //
translated: The causal condition is divided into five types because it holds all derivative form in the sense of generating, supporting, maintaining, sustaining, and increasing.🔽The great elements are also elements.

original: de dag ni chen po yang yin la 'byung bar yang 'gyur bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha' la chen po yod kyang 'byung ba med pa ston to //
analyzed: de dag ni chen po yang yin la 'byung bar yang 'gyur bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha' la chen po yod kyang 'byung ba med pa ston to //
translated: This shows that space exists as a great element but not as an element.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nam mkha' ni ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because space is not a product.

original: gang dag gi lta ba las gang khong stong de ni nam mkha'o zhes zer ba nam mkha'i khams mi shes par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gi lta ba las gang khong stong de ni nam mkha'o zhes zer ba nam mkha'i khams mi shes par smras pa yin no //
translated: Those who say that space is the mere absence of form do not understand the element of space.

original: nam mkha' ni yul la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni yul la gnas pa yin te /
translated: Space is a location.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang nam mkha' dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang gzugs med pa'i chos rnams ni yul la mi gnas pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang nam mkha' dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang gzugs med pa'i chos rnams ni yul la mi gnas pa'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Past, future, space, non-revealing form, and unconditioned things are not located in a place.

original: de bas nam mkha' ni 'byung ba chen po ma yin @241a * //
analyzed: de bas nam mkha' ni 'byung ba chen po ma yin @241a * //
translated: Therefore space is not a great element.

original: no // 'di dag ni che ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: no // 'di dag ni che ba ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are great because they pervade all derivative form.

original: khyab pa ni gnas kyi dngos po yin gyi gzhan gyi dngos po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khyab pa ni gnas kyi dngos po yin gyi gzhan gyi dngos po ni ma yin te /
translated: Pervasion is the state of being a location, not the state of being located.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su yang 'phags pa'i gang zag gis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i zag pa med pa'i sdom pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su yang 'phags pa'i gang zag gis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i zag pa med pa'i sdom pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, in the formless realm, noble beings obtain past and future uncontaminated vows.

original: yang na 'byung ba rnams kyi gnas pa'i khyad par che ba'i phyir shas che ba ste /🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: yang na 'byung ba rnams kyi gnas pa'i khyad par che ba'i phyir shas che ba ste / ji skad du /
translated: Or they are great because the state of the great elements is predominant.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: As the Bhagavān said:

original: kun dga' bos chen po 'di ni chu la brten to //
analyzed: kun dga' bos chen po 'di ni chu la brten to //
translated: Ānanda, this great earth rests on water.🔽Water rests on wind.

original: chu ni rlung la'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chu ni rlung la'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Water is destroyed by wind.

original: 'di ltar yang me'i khams kyi shas chen tshangs pa'i 'jig rten man chad tshig pa'i phyir ro //🔽chu'i khams kyi shas chen 'od gsal man chad la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang me'i khams kyi shas chen tshangs pa'i 'jig rten man chad tshig pa'i phyir ro // chu'i khams kyi shas chen 'od gsal man chad la gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, the realm of fire is predominant in the destruction of the world up to the heaven of the first absorption.🔽The realm of water is predominant in the destruction of the world up to the heaven of the Abhasvara gods.

original: rlung gi khams kyi shas chen dge rgyas man chad rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi shas chen dge rgyas man chad rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The realm of wind is predominant in the destruction of the world up to the heaven of the Vrhatphala gods.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: sa'i khams rab tu 'khrugs na rgyun rnams 'gag go //
analyzed: sa'i khams rab tu 'khrugs na rgyun rnams 'gag go //
translated: When the earth element is disturbed, the streams cease.

original: rgyun rnams 'gag na rlung mi rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyun rnams 'gag na rlung mi rgyu'o //
translated: When the streams cease, the winds do not blow.

original: rlung de dag mi rgyun gnas rnams skam mo //
analyzed: rlung de dag mi rgyun gnas rnams skam mo //
translated: When the winds do not blow, the abodes dry up.

original: skam pa dang chus rul bar byed do //
analyzed: skam pa dang chus rul bar byed do //
translated: When they dry up, they are destroyed by water.

original: mes tshig par byed do zhe'o //
analyzed: mes tshig par byed do zhe'o //
translated: When they are destroyed by water, they are destroyed by fire.

original: de ltar khyab par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khyab par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the destruction is universal.

original: mi dgos pa dang mi nus pa'i phyir bzhi kho na te khri'i rkang pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni lngar ni mi dgos so //
analyzed: mi dgos pa dang mi nus pa'i phyir bzhi kho na te khri'i rkang pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni lngar ni mi dgos so //
translated: Only four are mentioned because they are not necessary and because they are not possible, like the legs of a chair.

original: gsum gyis ni mi nus so //
analyzed: gsum gyis ni mi nus so //
translated: Three are not possible.

original: khri'i rkang pa smos pa ni go sla bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khri'i rkang pa smos pa ni go sla bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the legs of the bed is for the sake of ease of understanding.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag 'dus na rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba las 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag dang de dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba'i rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag 'dus na rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba las 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag dang de dag rgyur byas pa zhes bya ba'i rigs so zhe na /
translated: If the four great elements are combined, it is called derived form. It is reasonable that the four great elements and that which is derived from them are combined.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi smos pa ni tshogs nas bya ba byed par bstan pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi smos pa ni tshogs nas bya ba byed par bstan pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu gzhan yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of the four great elements is to show that they function as a collection and to show that cause and effect are different.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag 'dus na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs mngon par 'grub po //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag 'dus na rgyur byas pa'i gzugs mngon par 'grub po //
translated: When the four great elements are combined, derived form is actualized.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag 'dus nas mngon par 'grub pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag 'dus nas mngon par 'grub pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The four great elements are not actualized when the four great elements are combined.

original: re re yang 'byung ba chen po gzhan gsum po dag la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: re re yang 'byung ba chen po gzhan gsum po dag la ltos pa ste /
translated: Each one depends on the other three great elements.

original: gcig gi rgyu gcig ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gi rgyu gcig ces gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the cause of one is one.

original: mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las rang bzhin la ltos pa ma yin pa dang / cha 'dra ba'i rdzas la ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin dang cha 'dra ba'i rdzas la mi ltos pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las rang bzhin la ltos pa ma yin pa dang / cha 'dra ba'i rdzas la ltos pa ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin dang cha 'dra ba'i rdzas la mi ltos pa'o zhe'o //
translated: It is not dependent on a natural cause, nor is it dependent on a material cause that resembles it.

original: 'byung ba chen po dag ni tshogs @241b pa me 'bral ba dag go //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dag ni tshogs @241b pa me 'bral ba dag go //
translated: The great elements are the collection of the four great elements that are not separated.

original: ci mngon zhe na /🔽mdo las mngon te /
analyzed: ci mngon zhe na / mdo las mngon te /
translated: What is the evidence?🔽It is stated in the sūtras.

original: mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo las gsungs pa /
translated: The Garbhāvakrāntisūtra says,

original: dga' bo de la pha ma'i mi gtsang ba las mer mer por gyur pa'i lus la sra ba nyid ni sa'i khams nye bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: dga' bo de la pha ma'i mi gtsang ba las mer mer por gyur pa'i lus la sra ba nyid ni sa'i khams nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: Nanda, in the body of the kalala that arises from the impure substances of the father and mother, the earth element is the solidity.

original: gsher ba nyid ni chu'i khams so //
analyzed: gsher ba nyid ni chu'i khams so //
translated: The water element is the fluidity.

original: tsha ba nyid ni me'i khams so //
analyzed: tsha ba nyid ni me'i khams so //
translated: The fire element is the heat.

original: yang zhing g-yo ba nyid ni rlung gi khams so //
analyzed: yang zhing g-yo ba nyid ni rlung gi khams so //
translated: The wind element is the lightness and movement.

original: dga' bo gal te de la sa'i khams yod la chu'i khams med par gyur na skam pa'am 'gyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' bo gal te de la sa'i khams yod la chu'i khams med par gyur na skam pa'am 'gyes par 'gyur te /
translated: Nanda, if the earth element exists but the water element does not exist, it would dry up and dissipate.

original: dga' bo dper na phye 'am thal ba bcangs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dga' bo dper na phye 'am thal ba bcangs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Nanda, it is like, for example, flour or ashes that are held together.

original: dga' bo de ni chu'i khams kyis gzung bas mi 'gyes so //
analyzed: dga' bo de ni chu'i khams kyis gzung bas mi 'gyes so //
translated: Nanda, it is held together by the water element, so it does not disperse.

original: dga' bo gal te de la chu'i khams yod la sa'i khams med par gyur na sla bas zags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' bo gal te de la chu'i khams yod la sa'i khams med par gyur na sla bas zags par 'gyur te /
translated: Nanda, if there were only the water element in it, and no earth element, it would flow down.

original: dga' bo dper na 'bru mar ram chu lta bu'o //
analyzed: dga' bo dper na 'bru mar ram chu lta bu'o //
translated: Nanda, it would be like oil or water.

original: dga' bo de ltar na chu'i khams kyis sa'i khams bzung na mi 'gyes so //
analyzed: dga' bo de ltar na chu'i khams kyis sa'i khams bzung na mi 'gyes so //
translated: Nanda, in this way the water element holds the earth element together, so it does not disperse.

original: sa'i khams kyis chu'i khams gzung na mi 'dzag go //
analyzed: sa'i khams kyis chu'i khams gzung na mi 'dzag go //
translated: The earth element holds the water element together, so it does not flow down.

original: dga' bo gal te de la sa'i khams dang chu'i khams yod la me'i khams med par gyur na 'drul zhing 'jig la 'dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dga' bo gal te de la sa'i khams dang chu'i khams yod la me'i khams med par gyur na 'drul zhing 'jig la 'dag par 'gyur te /
translated: Nanda, if there were only the earth element and the water element in it, and no fire element, it would rot.

original: dga' bo dper na dbyar gyi dus na sha rnag tu 'drul zhing 'jig la 'dag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dga' bo dper na dbyar gyi dus na sha rnag tu 'drul zhing 'jig la 'dag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Nanda, it would be like meat in the rainy season.

original: dga' bo gal te de la sa'i khams dang chu'i khams yod la me'i khams med na 'drul zhing 'jig la 'dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga' bo gal te de la sa'i khams dang chu'i khams yod la me'i khams med na 'drul zhing 'jig la 'dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nanda, in this way, if there were only the earth element and the water element in it, and no fire element, it would rot.

original: dga' bo gal te de la sa'i khams dang chu'i khams dang me'i khams yod la rlung gi khams med par gyur na de tsam du 'dug ste /
analyzed: dga' bo gal te de la sa'i khams dang chu'i khams dang me'i khams yod la rlung gi khams med par gyur na de tsam du 'dug ste /
translated: Nanda, if there is the earth element, the water element, and the fire element, but there is no wind element, then it would remain just as it is.

original: skye ba dang 'phel ba dang rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'phel ba dang rgyas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not grow, increase, and develop.

original: nang gi 'byung ba chen po sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba gcig gi rgyu gcig yin pa ldan ba zin pa 'di dag sa'i khams kyis brtan /
analyzed: nang gi 'byung ba chen po sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba gcig gi rgyu gcig yin pa ldan ba zin pa 'di dag sa'i khams kyis brtan /
translated: The internal great elements that arise from the ripening of past karma have a single cause, and these appropriated elements are supported by the earth element,

original: chu'i khams kyis bsdus /
analyzed: chu'i khams kyis bsdus /
translated: held together by the water element,

original: me'i khams kyis smin par byas /
analyzed: me'i khams kyis smin par byas /
translated: ripened by the fire element,

original: rlung gi khams kyis bskyod na skye ba dang 'phel ba dang rgyas par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyis bskyod na skye ba dang 'phel ba dang rgyas par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: and expanded by the wind element.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po dag ni 'dus pa tshogs pa mi 'bral ba'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba chen po dag ni 'dus pa tshogs pa mi 'bral ba'o zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the great elements are said to be an inseparable collection.

original: de ltar re zhig 'byung ba'i gzugs ji bshad nas 'byung ba las gyur pa brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig 'byung ba'i gzugs ji bshad nas 'byung ba las gyur pa brjod do //
translated: Thus, having explained the form of the elements, the form derived from the elements is now discussed.

original: reg bya'i phyogs gcig dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: reg bya'i phyogs gcig dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: One part of tactility and nonindicative form.

original: reg bya'i phyogs gcig tu gyur ba ni reg bya'i phyogs gcig go //🔽reg par bya ba yin pas reg bya'o //
analyzed: reg bya'i phyogs gcig tu gyur ba ni reg bya'i phyogs gcig go // reg par bya ba yin pas reg bya'o //
translated: The part of the tangible is the part of the tangible.

original: de ni @242a * //
analyzed: de ni @242a * //
translated: The tangible is that which is to be touched.

original: bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: bcu gcig ste /
translated: It is elevenfold.

original: rdzas su bcu gcig gi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rdzas su bcu gcig gi rang bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is the nature of eleven real entities.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang 'jam pa la sogs pa bdun no //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang 'jam pa la sogs pa bdun no //
translated: The four great elements and the seven types of tangibles, such as softness.

original: de la 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs bshad pa na 'byung ba chen po bton te reg bya'i phyogs gcig smos so //
analyzed: de la 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs bshad pa na 'byung ba chen po bton te reg bya'i phyogs gcig smos so //
translated: When derivative form is explained, the great elements are mentioned and the part of the tangible is mentioned.

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni mig la sogs pa nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la thug pa'i bar dag go //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni mig la sogs pa nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la thug pa'i bar dag go //
translated: Derivative form is from the eye faculty up to non-revealing form.

original: 'byung ba dag las byung bas na 'byung ba las gyur pa ste zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i dngos por ston to //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag las byung bas na 'byung ba las gyur pa ste zhes bya ba ni gnas pa'i dngos por ston to //
translated: It is called derivative because it arises from the great elements. This shows its nature as a state of abiding.🔽Among those, the eye faculty, etc.

original: de la mig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la zhes bya ba ni dgar ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la mig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de la zhes bya ba ni dgar ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “among those” has the meaning of a restrictive particle.

original: mig ni 'dir rna ba la sogs pa gzhan dag las bzlog pa ste mngon su ma nyid do //
analyzed: mig ni 'dir rna ba la sogs pa gzhan dag las bzlog pa ste mngon su ma nyid do //
translated: The eye is the opposite of the others, the ear, etc. It is the most preeminent.

original: sngon ma byung ba dang lha dang mtho ris la sogs pa'i yul yongs su gcod pa'i phyir de rna ba'i dbang po la sogs pa las sngar smos so //
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba dang lha dang mtho ris la sogs pa'i yul yongs su gcod pa'i phyir de rna ba'i dbang po la sogs pa las sngar smos so //
translated: It is mentioned first because it determines the object, such as a god, heaven, etc., which is not previously known.🔽It is mentioned first because it functions at a distance.

original: de ltar de rgyang ring du 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ni yang dag pa'i sha dang lha'i dang 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig dang gsum gyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar de rgyang ring du 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ni yang dag pa'i sha dang lha'i dang 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig dang gsum gyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eye is the domain of the three eyes: the eye of flesh, the divine eye, and the noble wisdom eye.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten lta bu zhes bya ba ni rten dang 'dra bas rten lta bu'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten lta bu zhes bya ba ni rten dang 'dra bas rten lta bu'o //
translated: The eye is like the basis of the visual consciousness. It is like a basis because it is similar to a basis.

original: don gyi dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa'i rten byed pas nang gi yan lag gi rtog pa nyid do //
analyzed: don gyi dngos po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa'i rten byed pas nang gi yan lag gi rtog pa nyid do //
translated: It is an internal factor because it is the basis for the understanding of the real nature of the object.

original: rnam par shes pa'i gnas kyi dngos po ni 'dir mig gi 'gyur ba gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pas rjes su 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i gnas kyi dngos po ni 'dir mig gi 'gyur ba gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pas rjes su 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: The state of being the basis of consciousness is here the eye’s clarity and unclarity, etc., because it is the cause of the consciousness’ clarity and unclarity, etc.

original: shing 'gyur bas grib ma 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: shing 'gyur bas grib ma 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as the shadow’s movement is caused by the tree’s movement.

original: dngos po gang dag dbang po las 'das pa de dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos yod par rjes su dpag tu rung ste dbang po las 'das pa dag ni mig la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: dngos po gang dag dbang po las 'das pa de dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos yod par rjes su dpag tu rung ste dbang po las 'das pa dag ni mig la sogs pa ste ;
translated: Those things that are beyond the senses can be inferred to exist by the fact that they are causes and effects. Those things that are beyond the senses are the eye, etc.

original: de dag ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu'i dmigs pa'i phyir yod do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu'i dmigs pa'i phyir yod do zhes brjod do //
translated: They exist because they are the objects of the effects, the eye consciousness, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba gnyis la rag las su zin kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mig la sogs pas bstan gyi gzugs la sogs pas ma yin pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rnga'i sgra bzhin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba gnyis la rag las su zin kyang mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa mig la sogs pas bstan gyi gzugs la sogs pas ma yin pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rnga'i sgra bzhin no //
translated: Even though the arising of the eye consciousness, etc., depends on two things, the eye consciousness, etc., are indicated by the eye, etc., and not by form, etc., because they are not common to all. It is like the sound of a drum.

original: dper na lag pa la sogs pa ni rnga pa ta ha la sogs pa'i sgra'i thun mong gi rgyu yin gyi rnga ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na lag pa la sogs pa ni rnga pa ta ha la sogs pa'i sgra'i thun mong gi rgyu yin gyi rnga ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: For example, hands and so on are common causes of sounds such as the sound of a tabor, but a tabor is not like that.🔽

original: rnga nyid kyi sgra'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rnga nyid kyi sgra'i rgyu yin no //
translated: For example, the hand, etc. are the common cause of the sound of a tabor, etc. but the tabor is not so, for the sound of the tabor is the cause of the tabor itself.

original: de bas na rnga'i sgra'o zhes de nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na rnga'i sgra'o zhes de nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is indicated by the very sound of the tabor.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i thun mong @242b gi rgyu yin gyi mig la sogs pa ni thun mong gi rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i thun mong @242b gi rgyu yin gyi mig la sogs pa ni thun mong gi rgyu ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, form, etc. are the common cause of the visual consciousness, etc. but the eye, etc. are not the common cause.

original: de bas na de dag nyid kyis bstan to //🔽mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten lta bu gzugs la lta ba'i bya ba can gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bus rgyu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dag nyid kyis bstan to // mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten lta bu gzugs la lta ba'i bya ba can gzugs dang ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'bras bus rgyu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they are indicated by the very same.🔽The form that is the basis of the visual consciousness, which has the function of seeing form, is clarified by its effect.

original: gzugs la lta ba'i bya ba can zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar mig gis gzugs rnams mthong gi rnam par shes pas ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la lta ba'i bya ba can zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar mig gis gzugs rnams mthong gi rnam par shes pas ma yin te /
translated: The function of seeing form is as follows: it is said that the eye sees forms, not the consciousness.

original: de yod na yod pas mig dang ldan pas mthong ba dang / long bas mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na yod pas mig dang ldan pas mthong ba dang / long bas mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it exists, it exists because one who has eyes sees, and one who is blind does not see.

original: gzugs la lta ba ni gzugs snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la lta ba ni gzugs snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: To see visible form is to have visible form as an object.

original: bya ba ni las so //
analyzed: bya ba ni las so //
translated: Action is activity.

original: gzugs la lta ba'i bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs la lta ba'i bya ba ste /
translated: The activity of seeing visible form is the activity of seeing visible form.

original: las gang gi yin pa de gzugs la lta ba'i bya ba can no //
analyzed: las gang gi yin pa de gzugs la lta ba'i bya ba can no //
translated: That which has that as its activity is one who has the activity of seeing visible form.

original: gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba la gzugs kyi bdag nyid dang ba ni gzugs dang ba ste rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba la gzugs kyi bdag nyid dang ba ni gzugs dang ba ste rdul phra rab rnams bsags pa'o //
translated: The eye is clear form, that is, clear form that is the accumulation of atoms.

original: mig ni smra bas na mig ste yul brjod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig ni smra bas na mig ste yul brjod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The eye is the speaker, that is, the one who expresses the object.

original: mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni gnag bkra dang nye bar gnas pa yul mngon du phyogs pa shel ltar dang ba gzugs la 'dzin par nus pa ste snod chus gang ba'i nang du phye gtor ba lta bu'o zhes kha cig 'dzer to //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni gnag bkra dang nye bar gnas pa yul mngon du phyogs pa shel ltar dang ba gzugs la 'dzin par nus pa ste snod chus gang ba'i nang du phye gtor ba lta bu'o zhes kha cig 'dzer to //
translated: Some say that the atoms of the eye sense faculty are like a sesame seed cake, located in the black circle of the eye, facing the object, clear like crystal, and capable of apprehending visible form, like flour poured into a container filled with water.

original: kha cig na re go snyod kyi me tog ltar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re go snyod kyi me tog ltar gnas pa ste /
translated: Some say: It is like the flower of the thorn tree kṣīrikā.

original: 'byung ba chen po mdog gsal bas khebs pa'i phyir mi 'gyes she'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po mdog gsal bas khebs pa'i phyir mi 'gyes she'o //
translated: Because it is covered by the clear color of the great elements, it does not disperse.

original: kha cig na re dgongs pa ltar gnas la dang ba'i phyir gcig la gcig gis mi sgrib ste ston ka'i chu dang ba 'dus pa bzhin no zhe'o //
