analyzed: kha cig na re dgongs pa ltar gnas la dang ba'i phyir gcig la gcig gis mi sgrib ste ston ka'i chu dang ba 'dus pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: Some say: It is like pure autumn water that is not covered by one another because it is clear.

original: 'dis sgra rnam pa mang po nyan pas rna ba'o //
analyzed: 'dis sgra rnam pa mang po nyan pas rna ba'o //
translated: The ear is so called because it hears many different sounds.

original: rna ba'i dbang po rdul phra rab rnams ni shel ltar dang ba sgra la 'dzin par nus pa gro ga'i 'dzer bu ltar gnas pa dag go //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po rdul phra rab rnams ni shel ltar dang ba sgra la 'dzin par nus pa gro ga'i 'dzer bu ltar gnas pa dag go //
translated: The subtle particles of the ear sense faculty are clear like crystal, capable of apprehending sound and situated like the bristles of a porcupine.

original: 'dis dri bsung rnam pa mang po snom pas sna ste snom zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dis dri bsung rnam pa mang po snom pas sna ste snom zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The nose is so called because it smells many different scents.

original: sna'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni shel ltar dang ba'o //
analyzed: sna'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni shel ltar dang ba'o //
translated: The subtle particles of the nose sense faculty are clear like crystal.

original: ro la 'dzin par nus pa 'tsho byed 'bod pas lce'o //
analyzed: ro la 'dzin par nus pa 'tsho byed 'bod pas lce'o //
translated: The tongue is so called because it is capable of apprehending taste.

original: lce'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni shel ltar dang po ro myang bar nus pa zla ba kham pa ltar gnas pa dag ste /
analyzed: lce'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni shel ltar dang po ro myang bar nus pa zla ba kham pa ltar gnas pa dag ste /
translated: The atoms of the tongue sense faculty are like a half moon, and are situated on the upper surface of the tongue, like a drum skin.

original: lce'i dbus ni skra'i rtse mo'i khyon tsam zhig la lce'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab dag gis ma khyab ste mtha' lhag ma rnams ni khyab po //
analyzed: lce'i dbus ni skra'i rtse mo'i khyon tsam zhig la lce'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab dag gis ma khyab ste mtha' lhag ma rnams ni khyab po //
translated: The middle of the tongue is not covered by the atoms of the tongue sense faculty, but is the size of the tip of a hair.

original: de lta ma yin na glad pa 'dzag pa'i ro myang bar 'gyur ro //🔽bsags pa dang sogs par 'gyur ba dang sogs pas na lus te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na glad pa 'dzag pa'i ro myang bar 'gyur ro // bsags pa dang sogs par 'gyur ba dang sogs pas na lus te /
translated: Otherwise, one would experience the taste of brain.🔽The body is that which is accumulated, that which is accumulated in the sense of being a collection, and that which is accumulated in the sense of being a continuum.

original: bcos ma dang bya ba dang byed du gzhug pa zhes nges pa'i tshig go //🔽bstan bcos @243a * //
analyzed: bcos ma dang bya ba dang byed du gzhug pa zhes nges pa'i tshig go // bstan bcos @243a * //
translated: The body is so called because it is a compound, because it is an action, and because it is that which is to be used.

original: las ni de'i rgyu smad pa yin pas na lus so zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: las ni de'i rgyu smad pa yin pas na lus so zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In the Abhidharma it is said that the body is so called because it is the cause of the body.

original: sa bon dang gnas dang rton pa dang 'dzag pa dang 'chi ba yid du mi 'ong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon dang gnas dang rton pa dang 'dzag pa dang 'chi ba yid du mi 'ong ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the seed, the abode, the support, the discharge, and the unpleasant nature of death.

original: mi gtsang ba'i rdzas rnam pa sna tshogs 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir rnag gi tshogs bzhin no zhes kha cig 'dzer te /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i rdzas rnam pa sna tshogs 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir rnag gi tshogs bzhin no zhes kha cig 'dzer te /
translated: Some say: Because it is characterized as a collection of various impure substances, it is like a collection of pus.

original: lus kyi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni rim gyis mngon par grub pas lus bzhin du gnas pa dag go //🔽mo'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni rnga'i khog pa'i sgrubs ltar gnas pa dag go //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni rim gyis mngon par grub pas lus bzhin du gnas pa dag go // mo'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni rnga'i khog pa'i sgrubs ltar gnas pa dag go //
translated: The subtle particles of the body sense faculty are arranged like the body.🔽The subtle particles of the female organ are arranged like the opening of a goats’ teat.

original: pho'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni mthe bo ngos kyi tshul ltar gnas pa dag go //
analyzed: pho'i dbang po'i rdul phra rab rnams ni mthe bo ngos kyi tshul ltar gnas pa dag go //
translated: The subtle particles of the male organ are arranged like the head of a thumb.

original: yul reg bya thun mong ba'i phyir de dag ni lus kyi dbang po la gnas pas logs shig tu ma smos so //
analyzed: yul reg bya thun mong ba'i phyir de dag ni lus kyi dbang po la gnas pas logs shig tu ma smos so //
translated: Since they are the object of the body sense faculty, they are not mentioned separately.

original: dbang po gong ma gsum ni phreng ba'i rgyud bzhin du gnas pa dag go //
analyzed: dbang po gong ma gsum ni phreng ba'i rgyud bzhin du gnas pa dag go //
translated: The three higher faculties are arranged like a garland.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin la gzugs dang ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten yin la gzugs dang ba ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is something that is the basis of eye consciousness but is not clear form.

original: 'gags ma thag pa'i yid do //
analyzed: 'gags ma thag pa'i yid do //
translated: It is the mind that has just ceased.

original: gzugs dang ba yin la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gzugs dang ba yin la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: There is a clear form that is not the basis of eye consciousness.

original: rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po bzhi'o //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po bzhi'o //
translated: The four faculties of ear, etc.

original: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten ces bya ba 'dis ni rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po dgag par byed do //
analyzed: de la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten ces bya ba 'dis ni rna ba la sogs pa'i dbang po dgag par byed do //
translated: Here, the phrase “the basis of eye consciousness” excludes the faculties of ear, etc.

original: gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'gags ma thag pa'i yid dgag par byed do //
analyzed: gzugs dang ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'gags ma thag pa'i yid dgag par byed do //
translated: The phrase “clear form” excludes the mind that has just ceased.

original: yang na gzugs smos pas ni dad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa sel to //
analyzed: yang na gzugs smos pas ni dad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa sel to //
translated: Or else, the word “form” excludes the faculty of faith, etc.

original: dang ba smos pas ni 'byung ba chen po'i gzugs sel to //
analyzed: dang ba smos pas ni 'byung ba chen po'i gzugs sel to //
translated: The word “clear” excludes the form of the great elements.

original: de ni 'di skad du gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten lta bu gzugs la lta ba'i bya ba can gzugs dang ba de ni mig gi dbang po'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gang mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rten lta bu gzugs la lta ba'i bya ba can gzugs dang ba de ni mig gi dbang po'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the above passage is this: The eye faculty is that which, like the basis of eye consciousness, is clear form that has the function of seeing.

original: dbang po'i don gang zhe na //
analyzed: dbang po'i don gang zhe na //
translated: What is the meaning of “faculty”?

original: dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don to //
analyzed: dbang byed pa'i don ni dbang po'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “ruling” is the meaning of “faculty.”

original: yul so sor nges pa'i dbang po rnams ni rang gi don la lhag par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa'i dbang po rnams ni rang gi don la lhag par byed pa ste /
translated: The faculties that are determined in relation to specific objects are dominant in their own objects.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the cause for generating uncommon consciousness.

original: de ltar dbang po dag bstan nas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs yul du gyur pa rnams brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar dbang po dag bstan nas rgyur byas pa'i gzugs yul du gyur pa rnams brjod do //
translated: Having thus explained the faculties, the author now discusses the derivative form that is the object.

original: de la gzugs ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni rnam gnyis so //
analyzed: de la gzugs ni rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni rnam gnyis so //
translated: Form is of two types.

original: kha dog gi bdag nyid ni kha dog gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: kha dog gi bdag nyid ni kha dog gi rang bzhin no //
translated: Color is the nature of color.

original: dbyibs kyi bdag nyid ni dbyibs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi bdag nyid ni dbyibs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: Shape is the nature of shape.

original: 'di la kha cig kha dog dang dbyibs gnyis tha mi dad do zhes rtog pa de dag gi log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir tshad mar gyur ba'i lung gis tha dad par rab tu bsgrub ste /
analyzed: 'di la kha cig kha dog dang dbyibs gnyis tha mi dad do zhes rtog pa de dag gi log par rtogs pa bsal ba'i phyir tshad mar gyur ba'i lung gis tha dad par rab tu bsgrub ste /
translated: Some think that color and shape are not different. To eliminate their misconception, the author establishes their difference through valid scripture.

original: kha dog ngan pa dang dbyibs ngan @243b par 'gyur ro zhes gang smos pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog ngan pa dang dbyibs ngan @243b par 'gyur ro zhes gang smos pa'o //
translated: It says, “bad color and bad shape.”

original: gzugs kyi skye mched bstan pa rnam pa nyi shu po 'di yang mig gi rnam par shes pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid rig go //
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched bstan pa rnam pa nyi shu po 'di yang mig gi rnam par shes pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid rig go //
translated: These twenty aspects of the form base are known by the eye consciousness in terms of their specific characteristics.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rig go //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rig go //
translated: The mental consciousness knows them in terms of their specific and general characteristics.

original: des drangs pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas drangs pa ste /
analyzed: des drangs pa zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pas drangs pa ste /
translated: “Induced by that” means induced by the eye consciousness.

original: drangs pa ni 'dir de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por gnas pa'o //
analyzed: drangs pa ni 'dir de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyi dngos por gnas pa'o //
translated: “Induced” here means to be present as the condition of immediate antecedent.

original: sgra ni zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: sgra ni zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Sound is of two types, due to the distinction of the great elements that are conjoined and not conjoined.

original: sgrar 'byin cing 'dis dngos po 'bod pas na sgra'o //
analyzed: sgrar 'byin cing 'dis dngos po 'bod pas na sgra'o //
translated: It is sound because it is emitted as sound and it calls out things.

original: zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i bye brag 'dis rgyu rnam pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: zin pa dang ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i bye brag 'dis rgyu rnam pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: This distinction of the great elements that are conjoined and not conjoined indicates its two types of causes.

original: zin pa'i zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: zin pa'i zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “conjoined”?

original: gang sha dang khrag dang tshil dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang sha dang khrag dang tshil dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is that which possesses flesh, blood, and fat.

original: de lta na ni gzugs kyi khams kyi zin pa ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni gzugs kyi khams kyi zin pa ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the error would arise that the form element is not conjoined.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gis phan pa dang gnod pa gnyis kyis bzung ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dag gis phan pa dang gnod pa gnyis kyis bzung ba'o zhe na /
translated: They are conjoined by the benefit and harm of mind and mental factors.

original: de ltar na yang 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyi zin pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams kyi zin pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, those who have entered the meditative attainment of cessation and nonperception would not be conjoined.

original: de'i phyir gang dbang po dang ma bral bar gyur pa de zin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang dbang po dang ma bral bar gyur pa de zin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that which is not separated from the faculties is conjoined.

original: de la ma gtogs pa ni ma zin pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma gtogs pa ni ma zin pa'o //
translated: That which is not included in that is not conjoined.

original: de ltar byas nas lus su gtogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas lus su gtogs pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Having done it that way, he says, “that which is included in the body.”

original: bdag gi lus la lus zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdag gi lus la lus zhes bya ste /
translated: The body is called the body.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for self.

original: de la 'dir ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la bdag ces bya bar gdags so //
analyzed: de la 'dir ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la bdag ces bya bar gdags so //
translated: Here, the five appropriated aggregates are designated as the self.

original: lus su gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni lus su gyur pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus su gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni lus su gyur pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which is included in the body means that which has become the body.

original: de dag kyang da ltar byung ba'i lus kyi dbang po dang ma bral ba rnams la zin pa dag ces bya ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang da ltar byung ba'i lus kyi dbang po dang ma bral ba rnams la zin pa dag ces bya ste /
translated: Those that are not separated from the present body faculty are called “conjoined”.

original: de dag ni byis pa rnams kyis bde ba'i don du ched du bzung bas zin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag ni byis pa rnams kyis bde ba'i don du ched du bzung bas zin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called “conjoined” because fools grasp them for the purpose of pleasure.

original: gang snga mas bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gang snga mas bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa'o //
translated: That which is generated by the former is established.

original: de ni zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de ni zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from the cause of conjoined primary elements.

original: 'di lta ste lag pa dang ngag gi sgra'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste lag pa dang ngag gi sgra'o //
translated: For example, the sound of hands and speech.

original: phyi ma ste ma zin pas gang skyed pa ni /
analyzed: phyi ma ste ma zin pas gang skyed pa ni /
translated: That which is generated by the latter, that is, by unconjoined primary elements,

original: 'di lta ste rlung dang nags tshal dang 'bab chu'i sgra'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rlung dang nags tshal dang 'bab chu'i sgra'o //
translated: is for example, the sound of wind, forest, and waterfall.

original: sems can du ston pa dang sems can du ston pa ma yin pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa dang sems can du ston pa ma yin pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four types: that which is conjoined to sentient beings, that which is not conjoined to sentient beings, that which is both, and that which is neither.

original: sems can ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i rdzas te /🔽de ston pa la sems can du ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can ni bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa'i rdzas te / de ston pa la sems can du ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Sentient beings are substances such as vases and cloth.🔽That which reveals them is called “that which is conjoined to sentient beings”.

original: ci gang sems can du ston pa de sems can du ston pa yin ste /
analyzed: ci gang sems can du ston pa de sems can du ston pa yin ste /
translated: Is that which is conjoined to sentient beings also conjoined to sentient beings?

original: ji ltar gang la aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ge'i 'bru gsal ba @244a * //🔽yod pa sems can du ston pa yin nam /
analyzed: ji ltar gang la aa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yi ge'i 'bru gsal ba @244a * // yod pa sems can du ston pa yin nam /
translated: How is it that the letters a, etc., are indicative of sentient beings?🔽Are they indicative of sentient beings because they are the cause of the arising of the idea of sentient beings?

original: 'on te gang sems can gyi blo skyed par byed pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te gang sems can gyi blo skyed par byed pa yin /
translated: Or are they indicative of sentient beings because they are the cause of the arising of the idea of speech?

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is wrong with these alternatives?

original: gal te de sems can du ston pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de sems can du ston pa yin na ni /
translated: If they are indicative of sentient beings because they are the cause of the arising of the idea of sentient beings,

original: de lta na rta la sogs pa sgra 'byin pa'i sgra sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na rta la sogs pa sgra 'byin pa'i sgra sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the sounds of horses, etc., which are the cause of the arising of the idea of sentient beings, would be indicative of sentient beings.

original: ci ste gang sems can gyi blo skyed pa yin na ni lag pa'i sgra yang sems can du ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste gang sems can gyi blo skyed pa yin na ni lag pa'i sgra yang sems can du ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are indicative of sentient beings because they are the cause of the arising of the idea of speech, then the sounds of hands, etc., would be indicative of sentient beings.

original: de ltar dri ba byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar dri ba byas nas smras pa /
translated: Having asked this question, he says:

original: gang sems can gyi blo skyed pa de sems can du ston pa ste /
analyzed: gang sems can gyi blo skyed pa de sems can du ston pa ste /
translated: That which is the cause of the arising of the idea of sentient beings is indicative of sentient beings.

original: ji ltar smra ba'i sgras mngon sum du rtogs par byed pa de ltar lag pa'i sgras ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar smra ba'i sgras mngon sum du rtogs par byed pa de ltar lag pa'i sgras ni ma yin no //
translated: The sound of speech is the cause of the arising of the idea of sentient beings and the cause of the arising of the idea of speech. The sound of hands is the cause of the arising of the idea of sentient beings, but not the cause of the arising of the idea of speech.

original: gzhan ni ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las 'byung ba'o //
translated: The other is that which arises from a cause consisting of the great elements that are not grasped.

original: bar du chod kyang thams cad kyi ming gi tshul gyis mngon te /
analyzed: bar du chod kyang thams cad kyi ming gi tshul gyis mngon te /
translated: Even if it is obstructed, it is perceived by the mode of name.

original: khyod kyi kha bzhin de ni autpala 'dab 'dra yi //
analyzed: khyod kyi kha bzhin de ni autpala 'dab 'dra yi //
translated: Your face is like a lotus petal,

original: mig dang de yi rngul dang 'dra ba'i bsung dang ldan //🔽zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang de yi rngul dang 'dra ba'i bsung dang ldan // zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: endowed with eyes and the fragrance of its pollen.

original: sprul pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: sprul pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: Emanations are the result of the desire realm up to the fourth absorption.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa ni skye mched bzhi'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa ni skye mched bzhi'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Among them, those of the desire realm are the nature of four bases:

original: gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i rang bzhin no //
translated: form, smell, taste, and tactility.

original: gzugs na spyod pa ni skye mched gnyis kyi bdag nyid de gzugs dang reg bya'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa ni skye mched gnyis kyi bdag nyid de gzugs dang reg bya'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Those of the form realm are the nature of two bases: form and tactility.

original: de na dri dang ro gnyis med de khams kyi za ba'i zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na dri dang ro gnyis med de khams kyi za ba'i zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Smell and taste do not exist there because they are free from attachment to the desire realm of the food of contact.

original: de ni dngos gzhi bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu yin gyi nyer bsdogs kyis thob par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni dngos gzhi bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu yin gyi nyer bsdogs kyis thob par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: That is the result of the actual basis of absorption, but it is not obtained by access concentration.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i dngos po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the substance of supreme joy.🔽The emanations of the Buddha can teach the Dharma even when the Tathagata is silent.🔽The emanations of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas speak together.🔽As it is said:🔽When one speaks, all emanations speak.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa cang mi gsung yang chos ston par nus so //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa cang mi gsung yang chos ston par nus so //
translated: When the Tathagata is silent, all emanations are silent.🔽The emanations of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas speak together.🔽As it is said:🔽When one speaks, all emanations speak.🔽When the Tathagata is silent, all emanations are silent.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi de dag ni lhan cig tu smra ba ste ;
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi de dag ni lhan cig tu smra ba ste ;
translated: The emanations of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas speak together.

original: / ji skad du /
analyzed: / ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽When one speaks, all emanations speak.🔽When the Tathagata is silent, all emanations are silent.

original: gcig po smra na sprul pa thams cad smra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig po smra na sprul pa thams cad smra bar 'gyur //
translated: The emanations of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas speak together.🔽As it is said:🔽When one speaks, all emanations speak.🔽When the Tathagata is silent, all emanations are silent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi gsung sprul pa thams cad smra //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi gsung sprul pa thams cad smra //
translated: The emanations of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas speak together.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said:🔽When one speaks, all emanations speak.🔽When the Tathagata is silent, all emanations are silent.🔽The emanations of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas speak together.🔽As it is said:🔽When one speaks, all emanations speak.🔽When the Tathagata is silent, all emanations are silent.

original: yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba la yid dang mthun pa na yid du 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba la yid dang mthun pa na yid du 'ong ba'o //
translated: The emanations of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas speak together.🔽As it is said:

original: yid dang mi mthun pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: yid dang mi mthun pa ni yid du mi 'ong ba ste /
translated: When one speaks, all emanations speak.🔽When the Tathagata is silent, all emanations are silent.🔽The emanations of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas speak together.🔽As it is said:🔽When one speaks, all emanations speak.🔽When the Tathagata is silent, all emanations are silent.🔽The emanations of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas speak together.🔽As it is said:

original: dper na pha'i yid du 'ong ba ni phar 'dzin pa zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na pha'i yid du 'ong ba ni phar 'dzin pa zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: When one speaks, all emanations speak.

original: de ltar na rgyu'i bye brag dang rdzas kyi bye brag dang yon tan gyi bye brag gis sgra ni rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu'i bye brag dang rdzas kyi bye brag dang yon tan gyi bye brag gis sgra ni rnam pa brgyad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, sound is of eight types, according to the particularities of cause, substance, and quality.

original: rnam pa brgyad po de yang rna ba'i rnam par shes pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid rig go //
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad po de yang rna ba'i rnam par shes pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid rig go //
translated: The auditory consciousness cognizes sound as the particularity of its own sense-object.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas @244b ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rig go //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas @244b ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rig go //
translated: The mental consciousness cognizes sound as the particularity of its own sense-object, and also as a universal.

original: sgra'i skye mched bshad zin to //
analyzed: sgra'i skye mched bshad zin to //
translated: The sense-sphere of sound has been explained.

original: dri ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dri ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Smell is of three types:🔽pleasant, unpleasant, and neutral.

original: dri zhim pa dang / dri nga ba dang / dri mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba la bsung zhim pa ni dri zhim pa'o //
analyzed: dri zhim pa dang / dri nga ba dang / dri mnyam pa'o zhes bya ba la bsung zhim pa ni dri zhim pa'o //
translated: Pleasant smell is a good smell.

original: smad pa'i dri ni dri nga ba'o //
analyzed: smad pa'i dri ni dri nga ba'o //
translated: Unpleasant smell is a bad smell.

original: ngan pa ni sdig pa ste /
analyzed: ngan pa ni sdig pa ste /
translated: Bad means sinful.

original: dper na bram ze ngan pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bram ze ngan pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a bad Brahmin.

original: gnyi ga las bzlog pa ni dri mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga las bzlog pa ni dri mnyam pa ste /
translated: Neutral smell is the opposite of both.

original: dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba la ma gtogs pa ni dri mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: dri zhim pa dang dri nga ba la ma gtogs pa ni dri mnyam pa'o //
translated: Neutral smell is not included in pleasant smell or unpleasant smell.

original: don de nyid gzhung gis ston te /
analyzed: don de nyid gzhung gis ston te /
translated: The meaning is demonstrated by the text.

original: dri zhim pa ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dri zhim pa ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Pleasant smell is that which increases the great elements that are the sense faculties.

original: dbang po rnams kyi 'byung ba chen po dag ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi 'byung ba chen po dag ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po'o //
translated: The great elements that are the sense faculties are the great elements of the sense faculties.

original: de dag rgyas par byed pa ni brtas par byed pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag rgyas par byed pa ni brtas par byed pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: That which increases them is that which causes them to grow.

original: de dang mi mthun pa ni dring ba'o //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa ni dring ba'o //
translated: Unpleasant smell is that which diminishes them.

original: phan par byed pa dang gnod par byed pa'i rgyu las rnam par grol ba ni dri mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: phan par byed pa dang gnod par byed pa'i rgyu las rnam par grol ba ni dri mnyam pa'o //
translated: Neutral smell is that which is neither a cause of increase nor a cause of decrease.

original: rnam pa gsum po 'di yang sna'i rnam par shes pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid rig go //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po 'di yang sna'i rnam par shes pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid rig go //
translated: The nose consciousness knows the specific nature of smell.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rig go //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rig go //
translated: The mental consciousness knows the specific and general natures of smell.🔽Taste is of six types: sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.

original: ro ni mngar ba dang ; skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa drug ste zhes bya ba la ro ni myang bar bya ba myang ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ro ni mngar ba dang ; skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa drug ste zhes bya ba la ro ni myang bar bya ba myang ba zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: Taste is that which is to be tasted. The meaning of “to be tasted” is that which is to be experienced by the tongue sense faculty.

original: de la mngar ba ni bu ram la sogs pa'o //🔽tsha ba ni bca' sga la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la mngar ba ni bu ram la sogs pa'o // tsha ba ni bca' sga la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sweet is molasses, etc.🔽Hot is ginger, etc.

original: skyur ba ni bi tsa pur na la sogs pa'o //🔽kha ba ni nim pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyur ba ni bi tsa pur na la sogs pa'o // kha ba ni nim pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sour is pomegranate, etc.🔽Pungent is neem, etc.

original: lan tshva ni lce tsha la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan tshva ni lce tsha la sogs pa'o //
translated: Saline is salt, etc.

original: bska ba ni aa rur la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bska ba ni aa rur la sogs pa'o //
translated: Astringent is myrobalan, etc.

original: de thams cad ni lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / des drangs pa'i zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de thams cad ni lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / des drangs pa'i zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: All of these are the object-fields of the tongue consciousness and the mental consciousness aroused by that.

original: reg bya'i phyogs gcig ni rnam pa bdun te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: reg bya'i phyogs gcig ni rnam pa bdun te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bdun te /
translated: One part of the tangible is of seven kinds.

original: 'jam pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The seven kinds are smoothness, etc.

original: 'jam pa'i dngos po ni 'jam pa nyid de tha mi dad pa'i dngos po'i rkyen te /
analyzed: 'jam pa'i dngos po ni 'jam pa nyid de tha mi dad pa'i dngos po'i rkyen te /
translated: Smoothness is the quality of the smooth.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dngos po thams cad ni rang gi dngos por 'byung zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni rang gi dngos por 'byung zhes bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “All things arise in their own nature.

original: rtsub pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsub pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Roughness is the quality of the rough.

original: rtsub ces bya ba dag ni 'byung ba chen po dag la bya'o //
analyzed: rtsub ces bya ba dag ni 'byung ba chen po dag la bya'o //
translated: The word “rough” refers to the great elements.

original: de la gnas pa'i rtsub pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i rtsub pa ste /
translated: It is roughness that resides in them.

original: dper na ri la nyal ba la ri nyal ba zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ri la nyal ba la ri nyal ba zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, when one sleeps on a mountain, one says that the mountain sleeps.

original: de lta yin na ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad rtsub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni rgyur byas pa'i gzugs thams cad rtsub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If this is the case, then all derived matter would be rough.

original: 'di la nyes pa med de rang gi yan lag gi chos ston du zin kyang rnam pa gzhan la brjod de /
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa med de rang gi yan lag gi chos ston du zin kyang rnam pa gzhan la brjod de /
translated: There is no fault here, for even though the quality of the member is indicated, the name is expressed in another way.

original: dper na lo ma bdun pa dang / gom pa brgyad pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lo ma bdun pa dang / gom pa brgyad pa zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, one says, “the seven leaves,” or “the eight steps,”

original: de'i dngos @245a * //
analyzed: de'i dngos @245a * //
translated: but the substance of these is not leaves or steps.

original: po ni rtsub pa nyid do //
analyzed: po ni rtsub pa nyid do //
translated: Roughness is the quality of the member.

original: lci ba nyid dang / yang pa nyid dang grang ba rnams ni gzhung las ji skad du 'byung bar zad do //
analyzed: lci ba nyid dang / yang pa nyid dang grang ba rnams ni gzhung las ji skad du 'byung bar zad do //
translated: Weight, lightness, and cold are as they are explained in the treatise.

original: 'byung ba 'dus pa la chu dang me'i shas che ba ni 'jam pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba 'dus pa la chu dang me'i shas che ba ni 'jam pa'o //
translated: In the aggregation of the elements, that which is dominated by water and fire is soft.

original: shas che ba ni lhag pa la bya'o //
analyzed: shas che ba ni lhag pa la bya'o //
translated: Dominated means predominant.

original: lhag ma rnams ni gzhung las ji skad du 'byung bar zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni gzhung las ji skad du 'byung bar zad do //
translated: The rest are as they are explained in the treatise.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams na ni thams cad yod do //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams na ni thams cad yod do //
translated: All of these exist in the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams na ni bkres pa dang skom pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams na ni bkres pa dang skom pa med do //
translated: Hunger and thirst do not exist in the form realm.

original: grang ba yang gnod par 'gyur ba ni med kyi phan par 'gyur ba ni yod do //
analyzed: grang ba yang gnod par 'gyur ba ni med kyi phan par 'gyur ba ni yod do //
translated: Cold is not harmful, but it is beneficial.

original: 'dir kha cig 'di skad du ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs par phan par 'gyur ba'i dngos po gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes rgol lo //
analyzed: 'dir kha cig 'di skad du ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs par phan par 'gyur ba'i dngos po gzhan med pa'i phyir ro zhes rgol lo //
translated: Here, some argue that since there is no other entity that is beneficial except for concentration, it is not necessary to have a celestial mansion.

original: de lta na ni ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs par phan par 'gyur ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir gzhal med khang dgos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni ting nge 'dzin ma gtogs par phan par 'gyur ba'i dngos po med pa'i phyir gzhal med khang dgos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, since there is no entity that is beneficial except for concentration, it would not be necessary to have a celestial mansion.

original: rgyas par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung gi rgyun des lus thams cad rgyas par byed ces kyang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyas par byed pa zhes bya ba'i rlung gi rgyun des lus thams cad rgyas par byed ces kyang 'byung ngo //
translated: The wind called “that which expands” expands the entire body.

original: de bas na ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i reg bya'i khyad par gyis lus la phan 'dogs par zad do //
analyzed: de bas na ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i reg bya'i khyad par gyis lus la phan 'dogs par zad do //
translated: Therefore, the body is benefited by a special tactile object that arises from concentration.

original: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs de las gzhan yod dam ci'i phyir bkres pa dang skom pa med ce na /
analyzed: rgyur byas pa'i gzugs de las gzhan yod dam ci'i phyir bkres pa dang skom pa med ce na /
translated: Does that derived form exist apart from that? Why is there no hunger and thirst?

original: kham gyis za ba'i zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kham gyis za ba'i zas kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are free from attachment to the food of eating morsels.

original: zas 'dod pa'i rgyu'i chos ni bkres pa'o //
analyzed: zas 'dod pa'i rgyu'i chos ni bkres pa'o //
translated: The cause of the desire for food is hunger.

original: rgyu'i sgra ni mi mngon par byas te /
analyzed: rgyu'i sgra ni mi mngon par byas te /
translated: The word cause is not stated,

original: dper na tshod ma gtso bor byed pa'i rgyal po la tshod ma'i rgyal po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na tshod ma gtso bor byed pa'i rgyal po la tshod ma'i rgyal po zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: just as in the expression “king of vegetables” for “king who has vegetables as his main food.”

original: yang na rgyu la 'bras bu gdags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na rgyu la 'bras bu gdags pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or else, the result is figuratively designated as the cause.

original: brjod par bya ba'i gtso bo yin pas des na bkres pa dang skom pa gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i gtso bo yin pas des na bkres pa dang skom pa gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Hunger and thirst are not by nature material form, since they are the principal things to be stated.

original: de la lto kun du rlung gi rdul phra rab rnams kyis reg na bkres par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la lto kun du rlung gi rdul phra rab rnams kyis reg na bkres par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this regard, when the subtle particles of wind in the stomach are contacted, there is hunger.

original: mes reg na skom par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mes reg na skom par 'gyur ro //
translated: When they are contacted by fire, there is thirst.

original: de'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu sgro btags nas bkres pa dang / skom pa'i sgrar brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu sgro btags nas bkres pa dang / skom pa'i sgrar brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the result is figuratively designated as the cause and is called hunger and thirst.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //🔽zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //🔽zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: “The appearance of the buddhas is happiness.”

original: dbang po rnams kyi yul so sor nges pa'i phyir skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yul yin gyi rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni yul ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi yul so sor nges pa'i phyir skye mched kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yul yin gyi rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni yul ma yin no //
translated: The sense-spheres are the specific objects of the sense-faculties. The substance is not the object.

original: de bas na reg bya yang nges par lngar 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bas na reg bya yang nges par lngar 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the tangible is also determined as fivefold.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'jam pa la sogs pa'i nang nas gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang / 'jam pa la sogs pa'i nang nas gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: It is one of the four great elements, or it is softness, hardness, etc.

original: de bzhin du dmag la sogs pa'i tshogs dang / nor bu'i kha dog dang rtags dang dbyibs du mar snang ba rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang yongs su gcod par sbyar bar @245b bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dmag la sogs pa'i tshogs dang / nor bu'i kha dog dang rtags dang dbyibs du mar snang ba rnams kyi gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam pa yang yongs su gcod par sbyar bar @245b bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the various colors, shapes, etc. of an army, etc., and of a jewel, are determined as visible form, etc.

original: de yang lus kyi rnam par shes pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid rig go //
analyzed: de yang lus kyi rnam par shes pas ni rang gi mtshan nyid rig go //
translated: The body consciousness cognizes the specific characteristics.

original: des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rig go //
analyzed: des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rig go //
translated: The mental consciousness, which is induced by it, cognizes the general and specific characteristics.

original: reg bya'i skye mched bshad zin to //
analyzed: reg bya'i skye mched bshad zin to //
translated: The sense-sphere of the tangible has been explained.

original: da ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, the non-informative should be discussed.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'byung ba rnam pa tha dad pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma dag ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'byung ba rnam pa tha dad pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma dag ste /
translated: The different primary elements of mind and mental factors refers to the many different types of primary elements.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba skyes pa rnams kyi zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba skyes pa rnams kyi zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the primary elements of virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral minds and mental factors that have arisen are the cause of the informative form.

original: gzhan la rig par byed pa ni khong du chud par byed shes par byed pa yongs su gcod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la rig par byed pa ni khong du chud par byed shes par byed pa yongs su gcod par byed pa'o //
translated: It causes others to understand means it causes others to comprehend, to know, and to ascertain.

original: ji ltar na 'dir sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba rnams rgyur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dir sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba rnams rgyur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How do the primary elements of mind and mental factors act as a cause here?

original: de dag 'byung ba med par rig byed mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'byung ba med par rig byed mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because informative form does not arise without them.

original: de ni 'di skad du sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'byung ba rnam pa mang pos bslad pa'i lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed rnams kyis gzhan la shes par byed de /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du sems dang sems las byung ba'i 'byung ba rnam pa mang pos bslad pa'i lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed rnams kyis gzhan la shes par byed de /
translated: This passage means that the body and speech of one who is affected by the many different primary elements of mind and mental factors causes others to understand.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig byed do zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig byed do zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is called informative form.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na khu tshur dang thal lcag la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir nang du sbas pa'i sems kyang 'khrugs pa dang ldan no snyam du gzhan dag gi rjes su dpag pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na khu tshur dang thal lcag la sogs pa dmigs pa'i phyir nang du sbas pa'i sems kyang 'khrugs pa dang ldan no snyam du gzhan dag gi rjes su dpag pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, because a fist, a slap, etc., are observed, others infer that the mind hidden within is also disturbed.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig bzhin du gzhan la rig par mi byed pas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig bzhin du gzhan la rig par mi byed pas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: Like that means that, like the indicative, the nonindicative is not made known to another.

original: ji ltar rnam par rig byed gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin mod kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par rig byed gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin pa de bzhin du rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang gzugs kyi rang bzhin dang byed pa'i rang bzhin yin mod kyi /
translated: Just as the indicative is the intrinsic nature of form and the intrinsic nature of action, so too the nonindicative is the intrinsic nature of form and the intrinsic nature of action.

original: 'on kyang 'di la rig par bya ba med pas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di la rig par bya ba med pas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: However, since it is not made known, it is nonindicative.

original: ma yin pa 'di ni med pa la sogs pa don lnga la 'jug par snang ste /
analyzed: ma yin pa 'di ni med pa la sogs pa don lnga la 'jug par snang ste /
translated: This non is seen to engage five objects such as nonexistence.

original: med pa ni phyogs dang mthun pa med pa dang brjod par bya ba med pa'o //
analyzed: med pa ni phyogs dang mthun pa med pa dang brjod par bya ba med pa'o //
translated: Nonexistence is the absence of a homogeneous object and the absence of an object of expression.

original: 'gal ba ni phyogs ma yin pa dang don med pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba ni phyogs ma yin pa dang don med pa'o //
translated: Contradictory is that which is not a part of it and that which is meaningless.

original: smad pa ni bram zer mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: smad pa ni bram zer mi rung ba ste /
translated: Disparaged is that which is not fit to be a Brahmin,

original: gang 'greng zhing gcin gci la 'gro zhing za ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'greng zhing gcin gci la 'gro zhing za ba'o //
translated: such as one who urinates while standing, or one who eats while walking.

original: gzhan la ni bram ze ma yin pa bod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni bram ze ma yin pa bod pa'o //
translated: The other is not fit to be a Brahmin.

original: 'dra ba ni 'dir ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba ni 'dir ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Similar is just as it is.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par rig byed dang 'gal ba'i chos dang rnam par rig byed med pa dang / rnam par rig byed las gzhan pa dang smad pa ni yongs su mi gzung gi / rnam par rig byed dang 'dra ba nyid do //🔽rnam par @246a * //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par rig byed dang 'gal ba'i chos dang rnam par rig byed med pa dang / rnam par rig byed las gzhan pa dang smad pa ni yongs su mi gzung gi / rnam par rig byed dang 'dra ba nyid do // rnam par @246a * //
translated: By this expression “non-informative,” one does not accept that which is contradictory to informative form, that which is devoid of informative form, that which is other than informative form, or that which is disparaged, but rather that which is similar to informative form.

original: rig byed ma yin pa 'di dang 'dra ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rig byed ma yin pa 'di dang 'dra ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is similar to informative form?

original: gzugs nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs nyid de /
translated: It is form itself.

original: des na sems dang / sems las byung ba gzugs can ma yin pa rnams rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid las bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sems dang / sems las byung ba gzugs can ma yin pa rnams rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid las bkag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the non-informative is distinguished from the mind and mental factors that are not form.

original: 'di'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: Its characteristics should be stated.

original: rnam par rig byed kyi bye brag dang / sems kyi bye brag dang / 'byung ba chen po'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed kyi bye brag dang / sems kyi bye brag dang / 'byung ba chen po'i bye brag gis so //
translated: by the specific nature of the informative action, by the specific nature of the mind, and by the specific nature of the great elements.

original: de la nyon mongs pa dang dad pa drag po'i shugs kyis kun nas bslang ba'i rnam par rig byed ni rnam par rig byed kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa dang dad pa drag po'i shugs kyis kun nas bslang ba'i rnam par rig byed ni rnam par rig byed kyi bye brag go //
translated: The specific nature of the informative action is the informative action itself, which is produced by the force of the defilements or of faith.

original: rnam par rig byed kun nas slong ba'i sems ni sems kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed kun nas slong ba'i sems ni sems kyi bye brag go //
translated: The specific nature of the mind is the mind which produces the informative action.

original: yang na bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sems so ;
analyzed: yang na bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sems so ;
translated: Or else, it is the mind of absorption or the pure mind.🔽The specific nature of the great elements is the great elements which are the cause of the informative action, namely, the great elements of accumulation and the great elements of growth.🔽The great elements of accumulation are the great elements which are the cause of the informative action.

original: / rgyu mthun pa'i zin pa'i 'byung ba rnams dang rgyas par 'gyur ba ma zin pa'i 'byung ba rnams ni 'byung ba'i bye brag go //🔽de la 'dra bar 'byung ba ni rgyu mthun pa ste /
analyzed: / rgyu mthun pa'i zin pa'i 'byung ba rnams dang rgyas par 'gyur ba ma zin pa'i 'byung ba rnams ni 'byung ba'i bye brag go // de la 'dra bar 'byung ba ni rgyu mthun pa ste /
translated: The great elements of growth are the great elements which are the cause of the growth of the great elements of accumulation.🔽The great elements of accumulation are the great elements which are the cause of the informative action.🔽The great elements of growth are the great elements which are the cause of the growth of the great elements of accumulation.🔽The great elements of accumulation are the great elements which are the cause of the informative action.🔽The great elements of growth are the great elements which are the cause of the growth of the great elements of accumulation.🔽The great elements of accumulation are the great elements which are the cause of the informative action.🔽The great elements of growth are the great elements which are the cause of the growth of the great elements of accumulation.🔽The great elements of accumulation are the great elements which are the cause of the informative action.🔽The great elements of growth are the great elements which are the cause of the growth of the great elements of accumulation.🔽The great elements of accumulation are the great elements which are the cause of the informative action.🔽The great elements of growth are the great elements which are the cause of the growth of the great elements of accumulation.🔽The great elements of accumulation are the great elements which are the cause of the informative action.🔽The great elements of growth are the great elements which are the cause of the growth of the great elements of accumulation.🔽The great elements of accumulation are the great elements which are the cause of the informative action.🔽The great elements of growth are the great elements which are the cause of the growth of the great elements of accumulation.🔽The great elements of accumulation are the great elements which are the cause of the informative action.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i 'byung ba las gzhan pa snga ma'i dngos po'i rgyun gyi rgyud du 'brang ba dag ni rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i 'byung ba las gzhan pa snga ma'i dngos po'i rgyun gyi rgyud du 'brang ba dag ni rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: The great elements of growth are the great elements which are the cause of the growth of the great elements of accumulation.

original: de dag ni zin pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni zin pa dag go //
translated: The great elements

original: de dag kyang so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang sdom pa yang ma yin mi sdom pa yang ma yin pa skyed pa dag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang sdom pa yang ma yin mi sdom pa yang ma yin pa skyed pa dag go //
translated: They are also called prātimokṣa vows, and vows that are neither vows nor nonvows.

original: zas dang nyal ba dang ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par rnams kyis rgyas par gyur pa dag ni rgyas par 'gyur pa dag go //
analyzed: zas dang nyal ba dang ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par rnams kyis rgyas par gyur pa dag ni rgyas par 'gyur pa dag go //
translated: They are called “developed” because they are developed by the differences of food, sleep, and samādhi.

original: de dag gi rgyas par 'gyur ba yang yin la ma zin pa yang yin pas rgyas par 'gyur ba ma zin pa dag ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyas par 'gyur ba yang yin la ma zin pa yang yin pas rgyas par 'gyur ba ma zin pa dag ste /
translated: They are called “undemonstrable” because they are not grasped by the sense faculties.

original: 'dis ni kha zas dang nyal ba'i rgyas par 'gyur ba sel to //
analyzed: 'dis ni kha zas dang nyal ba'i rgyas par 'gyur ba sel to //
translated: This eliminates the development of food and sleep.

original: 'phangs pa dang rnam par ma g-yengs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la 'phangs pa ni 'phangs par byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'phangs pa dang rnam par ma g-yengs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la 'phangs pa ni 'phangs par byas pa ste /
translated: “Projected” means “projected by action.”

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'byung ba chen po las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'byung ba chen po las 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is derived from the great elements that are the results of evolution.

original: rnam par rig byed de yang lus kyi dbyibs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed de yang lus kyi dbyibs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: This informative action is by nature the shape of the body.

original: ngag gi ni sgra'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ngag gi ni sgra'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That of speech is by nature sound.

original: rnam par ma g-yengs pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i sems zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par ma g-yengs pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i sems zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “undistracted” means “with a virtuous mind.”

original: de ma yin pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems te /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems te /
translated: The term “other mind” means a non-virtuous or indeterminate mind.

original: de las gzhan pa'i sems gang yin pa ni rnam par rig byed kun du slong ba las gang gzhan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems gang yin pa ni rnam par rig byed kun du slong ba las gang gzhan du gyur pa'o //
translated: Any mind other than that is a mind that is other than that which instigates informative form.

original: sems med pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sems med pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The term “without mind” refers to one who is situated in the state of composure without conception or in the state of composure that is a cessation.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni lung du ma bstan pa bkag go //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni lung du ma bstan pa bkag go //
translated: The terms “virtuous” and “non-virtuous” exclude the indeterminate.

original: dge ba ni so sor thar ba'i sdom pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ni so sor thar ba'i sdom pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The virtuous is the restraint of the prātimokṣa, etc.

original: mi dge ba ni sdom pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni sdom pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The non-virtuous is the non-restraint, etc.

original: rgyu ni @246b rgyun du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni @246b rgyun du 'byung ba'o //
translated: The cause is the continuum.

original: gzugs smos pa ni thob pa'i rgyun gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs smos pa ni thob pa'i rgyun gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “form” is mentioned in order to clarify that the continuum is of the nature of attainment.

original: dge slong la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni dge slong la sogs par bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: dge slong la sogs pa'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni dge slong la sogs par bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: The cause of the classification of bhikṣus, etc. is the reason for being called a bhikṣu, etc.

original: de bas na 'bras bus rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yod par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bus rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yod par bsgrub bo //
translated: Therefore, non-informative matter is established as existing by its result.

original: de skad du 'og nas kyang de med du zin kyang dge slong la sogs par gzhag pa med par 'gyur te zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de skad du 'og nas kyang de med du zin kyang dge slong la sogs par gzhag pa med par 'gyur te zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said below, “Even if it did not exist, the classification of bhikṣus, etc. would not exist.”

original: bsags pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsags pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni rdul phra rab kyi bdag nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Non-aggregated means not having the nature of atoms.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rigs pas yod par bstan nas lung gis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rigs pas yod par bstan nas lung gis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the existence of non-informative matter through reasoning, in order to teach it through scripture,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rdzas las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rdzas las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, “The Blessed One also said, ‘Merit that arises from material generosity,’ and so on.”

original: rdzas las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rdzas btang ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i bsod nams la rdzas las byung ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba zhes bya ba ni rdzas btang ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i bsod nams la rdzas las byung ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Arisen from material means merit that arises from the cause of giving material things. It is called “arisen from material” because it is the result of material generosity.

original: rdzas las byung ba gtsug lag khang la sogs pa phul ba la sogs pa de dag las so //
analyzed: rdzas las byung ba gtsug lag khang la sogs pa phul ba la sogs pa de dag las so //
translated: The bases of merit are the giving of gifts, the undertaking of precepts, the performance of virtue, and the performance of worship.

original: bsod nams zhes bya ba ni dge ba la bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams zhes bya ba ni dge ba la bya'o //
translated: The term “merit” refers to virtue.

original: bsod nams nyid kyi bya ba ni bsod nams bya ba ste /
analyzed: bsod nams nyid kyi bya ba ni bsod nams bya ba ste /
translated: The action of merit is the action of merit.

original: de'i gnas ni bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas ni bsod nams bya ba'i gzhi'o //
translated: The basis of that is the basis of the action of merit.

original: de dag la rtag par rgyun du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag la rtag par rgyun du zhes bya ba la /
translated: With regard to those, one should always and continuously

original: rtag pa ni nyi ma re re'o //
analyzed: rtag pa ni nyi ma re re'o //
translated: always means day after day.

original: rgyun du ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du ni rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: Continuous means uninterrupted.

original: de la sems la sogs pa rtag par rgyun du dge ba'i rjes su 'brang ba med pa'i phyir bsod nams kyi sgra ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid gzung bar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems la sogs pa rtag par rgyun du dge ba'i rjes su 'brang ba med pa'i phyir bsod nams kyi sgra ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid gzung bar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: In that regard, the term “merit” should be understood to refer to non-informative form, because there is no always and continuous following of virtue in the mind, etc.🔽Because they are included in the vows, the non-vows, and the opposite of both,

original: sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa dang gnyis ka las bzlog pas bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdom pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa dang gnyis ka las bzlog pas bsdus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni sdom pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means because they have the nature of the vows, etc.

original: dge tshul ba ni dge sbyong gi phyogs so ;
analyzed: dge tshul ba ni dge sbyong gi phyogs so ;
translated: Novices are in the class of monks.

original: / dge slob ma ni gang dge tshul ma'i sdom pa las chos drug dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos drug spong ba'i ngo bos lhag pa'i sdom pa de ni dge slong ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / dge slob ma ni gang dge tshul ma'i sdom pa las chos drug dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos drug spong ba'i ngo bos lhag pa'i sdom pa de ni dge slong ma zhes bya'o //
translated: A female novice is one who, in addition to the novice vows, has the essence of abandoning the six rules and six corresponding rules.

original: chos drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six rules?

original: gcig pu grod du 'gro bar mi bya ba dang / 'bab chu rgal bar mi bya ba dang / skyes pa la reg par mi bya ba dang / skyes pa dang lhan cig 'dug par mi bya ba dang / spyan mi bya ba dang / sdig pa bcab par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gcig pu grod du 'gro bar mi bya ba dang / 'bab chu rgal bar mi bya ba dang / skyes pa la reg par mi bya ba dang / skyes pa dang lhan cig 'dug par mi bya ba dang / spyan mi bya ba dang / sdig pa bcab par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not go to the village alone, one should not cross a river alone, one should not touch a man, one should not sit with a man, one should not reveal one’s private parts, and one should not conceal faults.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i chos drug gang zhe na /🔽gser mi bzung ba dang / gsang ba'i spu breg par mi bya ba dang / sa brko bar mi bya ba dang / sngon po ma rung bar mi bya ba dang / byin len ma byas par mi za ba dang / bzhag pa'i @247a * //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i chos drug gang zhe na / gser mi bzung ba dang / gsang ba'i spu breg par mi bya ba dang / sa brko bar mi bya ba dang / sngon po ma rung bar mi bya ba dang / byin len ma byas par mi za ba dang / bzhag pa'i @247a * //
translated: What are the six corresponding rules?

original: zas mi bza' ba'o //
analyzed: zas mi bza' ba'o //
translated: One should not hold gold, one should not shave the private parts, one should not dig the earth, one should not damage green plants, one should not eat without first offering to the Saṅgha, and one should not eat stored food.

original: de ni 'dod par gtogs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dod par gtogs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'o //
translated: It is only in the realm of desire.

original: gtogs pa ni mi ldan pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gtogs pa ni mi ldan pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not unassociated with the realm of desire.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pas bdag gir byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sred pas bdag gir byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is appropriated by craving that pertains to the realm of desire.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba la ting nge 'dzin ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi po dag go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba la ting nge 'dzin ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi po dag go //
translated: It is called “concomitant with meditative concentration” because meditative concentration is the four meditative concentrations, the special meditative concentration, and the meditative concentration that is not appropriated.

original: rjes su 'brang ba ni gnas pa dang 'gog pa gcig pas rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba ni gnas pa dang 'gog pa gcig pas rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: It is concomitant because it is concomitant with the meditative attainment and the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: gzugs te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs te /
analyzed: gzugs te zhes bya ba ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs te /
translated: It is form, that is, non-revealing form.

original: rnam pa bdun spangs pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba chen po tha mi dad pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / sbyor ba dang mjug spangs pa dang // dngos kyi las kyi lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun spangs pa'i mtshan nyid 'byung ba chen po tha mi dad pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / sbyor ba dang mjug spangs pa dang // dngos kyi las kyi lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is the cause of the great elements that are not differentiated, which is the nature of the abandonment of the seven aspects, and it is included in the actual basis of the karmic path, which is the abandonment of the preparatory and concluding stages.

original: de yang gzugs su gtogs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yang gzugs su gtogs pa kho na'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams su gtogs pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Moreover, it is only form belonging to the form realm.

original: zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa sa drug po de dag tu 'phags pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i gzugs so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba ni mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa sa drug po de dag tu 'phags pa rnams kyi zag pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i gzugs so //
translated: The form that accompanies uncontaminated concentration is the form that occurs simultaneously with the uncontaminated concentration of āryas in the six stages such as unrestricted access concentration.

original: de yang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig nas bzung ste mi skye ba shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de yang sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i skad cig nas bzung ste mi skye ba shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: It is from the moment of perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering up to the knowledge of nonarising.

original: 'di ni khams su ltung ba ma yin pa'i phyir sa btang bas btang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni khams su ltung ba ma yin pa'i phyir sa btang bas btang ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not relinquished by changing level because it does not fall to the realms.

original: khams ni srid pas yongs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: khams ni srid pas yongs su bcad pa'o //
translated: The realms are completely divided by existence.

original: mi ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pas bdag gir ma byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pas bdag gir ma byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not possessed because it is not appropriated by attachment and so on.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i gzugs kyi rgyun la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bshad pa des na skad cig dang po la rgyun med pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin par mi 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i gzugs kyi rgyun la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bshad pa des na skad cig dang po la rgyun med pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin par mi 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: Non-revealing form is explained as the continuum of virtuous and non-virtuous form. Therefore, since there is no continuum in the first moment, it would not be non-revealing form.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skad cig ma yin yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skad cig ma yin yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, “Even though non-revealing form is momentary.”

original: gal te rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skad cig ma yin na gzugs kyi rgyun la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes ji skad du bshad snyam pa la /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig byed ma yin pa skad cig ma yin na gzugs kyi rgyun la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes ji skad du bshad snyam pa la /
translated: If non-revealing form is momentary, how is it explained as non-revealing form in the continuum of form?

original: de'i phyir rigs smos pas na de skad du brjod do zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs smos pas na de skad du brjod do zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, “Because it is a type, it is said to be so.”

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rigs gang yin pa de skad cig dang po dang bye brag med pas rgyun la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rigs gang yin pa de skad cig dang po dang bye brag med pas rgyun la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bshad do //
translated: Since that type of non-revealing form is not different from the first moment, it is explained as non-revealing form in the continuum.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ji ltar 'thob ce na smras pa /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ji ltar 'thob ce na smras pa /
translated: How is non-revealing form obtained?

original: @247b so sor thar pa'i sdom pa 'thob pa ni yang dag par blangs pas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: @247b so sor thar pa'i sdom pa 'thob pa ni yang dag par blangs pas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The obtainment of pratimoksa vows is through proper acceptance.

original: gang gi tshe gang 'di skad du bdag la dge bsnyen du zung shig ces bya ba dang / bdag la bsnyen te gnas par zung shig ces khas blangs pa na'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang 'di skad du bdag la dge bsnyen du zung shig ces bya ba dang / bdag la bsnyen te gnas par zung shig ces khas blangs pa na'o //
translated: When one accepts, “Accept me as a layperson” or “Accept me as a novice,”

original: 'di ni dper smos pa tsam du zad de /🔽dper na gdugs can 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dper smos pa tsam du zad de / dper na gdugs can 'gro'o //
translated: This is merely an example.🔽For example, it is said, “The parasol goes,”

original: rgyal mtshan can 'gro'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan can 'gro'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: “The banner goes.”

original: 'di lta ste 'char ba bzang po'i ni zhu bas mnyes par byas pas so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'char ba bzang po'i ni zhu bas mnyes par byas pas so //
translated: For example, the elder Subhadra was pleased by the request, “Please accept me as a disciple.”

original: chos sbyin ma yis ni pho nyas so //
analyzed: chos sbyin ma yis ni pho nyas so //
translated: Dharmadana was pleased by a messenger.

original: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po ni ston par khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po ni ston par khas blangs pas so //
translated: The arya Mahakasyapa was pleased by accepting the teacher.

original: srid pa tha ma pa rnams kyi ni dge slong tshur shog ces bya bas so //
analyzed: srid pa tha ma pa rnams kyi ni dge slong tshur shog ces bya bas so //
translated: Those in their final lifetime were pleased by the words, “Come, O monk.”

original: lnga sde dag ni nges pa la zhugs pas so //
analyzed: lnga sde dag ni nges pa la zhugs pas so //
translated: The five ascetics were pleased by entering into certainty.

original: dbus kyi yul ni bcu 'dus pas so //
analyzed: dbus kyi yul ni bcu 'dus pas so //
translated: The central country was pleased by the assembly of ten.

original: mtha' 'khob tu ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang lngas so //
analyzed: mtha' 'khob tu ni 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang lngas so //
translated: In the border regions, by five, including a vinaya master.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ni rang byung bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ni rang byung bas so //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas are self-originated.

original: thar pa'i bsam pas sems kyi rgyud yongs su bsgos na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thar pa'i bsam pas sems kyi rgyud yongs su bsgos na 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes a lay practitioner by the intention of liberation, by the complete pervasion of the mindstream.

original: bdun gyi ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bdun gyi ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du'o //
translated: The seven-day lay practitioner is one who takes the lay practitioner vows for as long as one lives.

original: brgyad pa'i ni nyin zhag gcig pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa'i ni nyin zhag gcig pa'o //
translated: The one-day lay practitioner is one who takes the lay practitioner vows for one day.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba med par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba med par ni ma yin no //
translated: One does not become a lay practitioner without going for refuge.

original: 'o na skyabs kyi don gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na skyabs kyi don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of refuge?

original: yongs su bskyang pa'i don ni skyabs kyi don to //
analyzed: yongs su bskyang pa'i don ni skyabs kyi don to //
translated: The meaning of refuge is the meaning of protection.

original: yongs su bskyang ba ni mtshams las mi 'da' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su bskyang ba ni mtshams las mi 'da' bar bya ba'o //
translated: Protection is the non-transgression of the boundary.

original: mtshams ni bslab pa bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams ni bslab pa bcas pa'o //
translated: The boundary is the established training.

original: de la sangs rgyas la skyabs su 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa la skyabs su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas la skyabs su 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa la skyabs su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Among those, going for refuge to the Buddha is going for refuge to the knowledge of elimination and non-arising.

original: chos la skyabs su 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa la skyabs su 'gro'o //
analyzed: chos la skyabs su 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa la skyabs su 'gro'o //
translated: Going for refuge to the Dharma is going for refuge to nirvana.

original: dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam la skyabs su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la skyabs su 'gro ba gang yin pa de ni slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam la skyabs su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Taking refuge in the Sangha is taking refuge in the paths of learning and no-more-learning.

original: gzugs sku ni snga phyi bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs sku ni snga phyi bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Dharma body is not differentiated by earlier and later.

original: ci da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas gcig pu la skyabs su 'gro'am /
analyzed: ci da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas gcig pu la skyabs su 'gro'am /
translated: Do you take refuge in the present Buddha alone, or

original: 'on te 'das pa dang ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad la skyabs su 'gro'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'das pa dang ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad la skyabs su 'gro'o zhe na /
translated: in all Buddhas of the past and future?

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la skyabs su 'gro bar bya ste ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la skyabs su 'gro bar bya ste ;
translated: You should take refuge in all Buddhas,

original: chos kyi sku spyir 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sku spyir 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Dharma body is generally the same.

original: rigs dang tshe dang tshad kyi bye brag gis na bcom ldan 'das tha dad do //
analyzed: rigs dang tshe dang tshad kyi bye brag gis na bcom ldan 'das tha dad do //
translated: The Blessed Ones are differentiated by their lineage, life span, and measure.🔽The relinquishment of the seven is called the offering of training.

original: bdun po'i btang ba ni bslab pa phul ba zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i mi la sangs rgyas 'bul lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /🔽tha na tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa 'di lta bu dag dang @248a * //
analyzed: bdun po'i btang ba ni bslab pa phul ba zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i mi la sangs rgyas 'bul lo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / tha na tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa 'di lta bu dag dang @248a * //
translated: Even if you have offered the Buddha to a knower of the treatises and so on,

original: 'grogs pas chog go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'grogs pas chog go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: you should still live with those who are similar to you in your practice of celibacy.

original: shi 'phos pa ni shi ba'o //🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa ni /
analyzed: shi 'phos pa ni shi ba'o // dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa ni /
translated: Death is the severing of the life faculty.🔽The severing of the root of virtue is the severing of the obtainment of the root of virtue.

original: de la skyes nas thob pa ni sbyor ba can gyi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la skyes nas thob pa ni sbyor ba can gyi dge ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa ste /
translated: The virtue obtained from birth is the cause of the virtuous qualities of one who is engaged in practice.

original: de dag gi thob pa chad na sdom pa btang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag gi thob pa chad na sdom pa btang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the obtainment of those is severed, the vows are relinquished.

original: kha cig na re sngar sdom pa btang bas de'i 'og tu skyes nas thob pa rnams kyi 'thob pa 'chad ces zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re sngar sdom pa btang bas de'i 'og tu skyes nas thob pa rnams kyi 'thob pa 'chad ces zer ro //
translated: Some say: The obtainment of those obtained from birth is severed after the vows are relinquished.

original: mtshan gnyis skyes pa ni pho'i dbang po dang mo'i dbang po cig car byung ba ste /
analyzed: mtshan gnyis skyes pa ni pho'i dbang po dang mo'i dbang po cig car byung ba ste /
