translated: One who is born with two organs is one in whom both the male and female organs arise simultaneously.

original: ba tshva can gyis ltar zhing du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba tshva can gyis ltar zhing du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is not suitable as a field of merit, like a salt-encrusted seed.

original: brgyad pa'i ni de rnams nyid dang mtshan mo 'das pas so zhes bya ba ni nyin zhag gcig tu nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgyad pa'i ni de rnams nyid dang mtshan mo 'das pas so zhes bya ba ni nyin zhag gcig tu nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The eighth is the severing of the root of virtue and the passing of the night.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems thob pas bsam gtan gyi sdom pa 'thob ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems thob pas bsam gtan gyi sdom pa 'thob ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: One obtains the restraint of absorption through obtaining a virtuous mind that is active in the form realm.

original: dge ba'i sems ni dngos gzhi'am nyer bsdogs so //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems ni dngos gzhi'am nyer bsdogs so //
translated: A virtuous mind is either the actual basis or access concentration.

original: de nyid btang bas de gtong ngo zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin las langs na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: de nyid btang bas de gtong ngo zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin las langs na 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang ldan no //
translated: When one arises from concentration, one possesses past and future vows.

original: snyoms par zhugs na da ltar gyi dang ldan no //
analyzed: snyoms par zhugs na da ltar gyi dang ldan no //
translated: When one enters meditative attainment, one possesses present vows.

original: yongs su nyams pa dang gong mar skyes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa dang gong mar skyes pa'o //
translated: One loses the vows through the causes of losing the vows, through degeneration of the absorptions, through death, through the arising of the opposite type, through the two roots, through the two paths, through the two results, through degeneration, and through birth in a higher level.

original: zag pa med pa'i sdom pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i sdom pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the uncontaminated vows.

original: de btang ba'i rgyu brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de btang ba'i rgyu brjod par bya ste /
translated: The causes of losing the vows should be stated.

original: 'bras bu thob pa dang / yongs su nyams pa dang / dbang po shin tu sbyangs pas so //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa dang / yongs su nyams pa dang / dbang po shin tu sbyangs pas so //
translated: One obtains the result, one degenerates, and one sharpens the faculties.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba spyod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽byed pa dang khas blangs pas sdom pa ma yin pa 'thob bo zhes bya ba de la byed pas 'thob pa ni de'i rigs su skyes pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chad pa zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba spyod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // byed pa dang khas blangs pas sdom pa ma yin pa 'thob bo zhes bya ba de la byed pas 'thob pa ni de'i rigs su skyes pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Severing the root of virtue means through engaging in wrong view.🔽One obtains negative commitments through action and through accepting them.🔽One obtains them through action by those born in that class.

original: khas blangs pas 'thob pa ni de'i rigs su skyes pa ma yin pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: khas blangs pas 'thob pa ni de'i rigs su skyes pa ma yin pa rnams kyis so //
translated: One obtains them through accepting them by those not born in that class.

original: chos nyid 'thob pa gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems thob pas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos nyid 'thob pa gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems thob pas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “attaining reality” means attaining a virtuous mind that operates in the form realm.

original: chos nyid ni 'phags pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: chos nyid ni 'phags pa'i lam ste /
translated: Reality refers to the noble path.

original: chos nyid de thob par byed rnyed par byed pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos nyid de thob par byed rnyed par byed pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Attaining reality means acquiring it.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems thob pa'o //🔽'di la tshe ka'i rtogs pa brjod pa'i dpe yod de /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems thob pa'o // 'di la tshe ka'i rtogs pa brjod pa'i dpe yod de /
translated: It is attaining a virtuous mind that operates in the form realm.🔽There is an example of this in the Avadāna of the Tsaṭṭas.

original: dper na sh'akya rnams kyis bsgo ba bzhin du byed pa'i tshe ka zhes bya ba de dag ri dags shor zhing 'tsho bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: dper na sh'akya rnams kyis bsgo ba bzhin du byed pa'i tshe ka zhes bya ba de dag ri dags shor zhing 'tsho bar byed pa'o //
translated: The Tsaṭṭas were people who lived by hunting deer and did as they were told by the Śākyas.🔽At one time, the Blessed One saw that their mental continuums had matured and he established them in the truths.

original: re zhig cig na de dag rgyud yongs su smin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs nas bden pa rnams la bkod par gyur pa dang / de dag gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems thob pas sdom @248b pa ma yin pa'i rgyun chad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: re zhig cig na de dag rgyud yongs su smin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gzigs nas bden pa rnams la bkod par gyur pa dang / de dag gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sems thob pas sdom @248b pa ma yin pa'i rgyun chad pa lta bu'o //
translated: They attained a virtuous mind that operates in the form realm and their stream of nonrestraint was severed.

original: rgyun 'chad pa ni sdom pa yang dag par blangs pas so //
analyzed: rgyun 'chad pa ni sdom pa yang dag par blangs pas so //
translated: The stream of nonrestraint was severed by their taking up restraint.

original: 'di lta ste dper na seng ge gnas pa'i phug tu srog chags ri dags phra mo gnas par mi nus pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na seng ge gnas pa'i phug tu srog chags ri dags phra mo gnas par mi nus pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a small animal that cannot live in the cave of a lion.

original: mtshan gnyis skyes pa ni zhing gi dngos por mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis skyes pa ni zhing gi dngos por mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One with two organs is not suitable as a field for the bases of training.

original: shi ba ni ris mthun pa yongs su btang ba'o //
analyzed: shi ba ni ris mthun pa yongs su btang ba'o //
translated: Death is the relinquishment of the class of sentient beings.🔽Obtaining the state of Dharma is obtaining a virtuous mind that experiences form.

original: chos nyid thob pa gzugs na spyod pa dge ba'i sems thob pas so zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i dus na sems can thams cad man ngag med par bsam gtan bskyed de //
analyzed: chos nyid thob pa gzugs na spyod pa dge ba'i sems thob pas so zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i dus na sems can thams cad man ngag med par bsam gtan bskyed de //
translated: At the time of destruction, all sentient beings generate meditative stabilization without instruction.

original: de'i dus na sdom pa ma yin pa gtong ngo //
analyzed: de'i dus na sdom pa ma yin pa gtong ngo //
translated: At that time, they relinquish non-vows.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin par ma thob pa ni nyon mongs pa dang dad pa drag po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin par ma thob pa ni nyon mongs pa dang dad pa drag po zhes bya ba la /
translated: Not obtaining non-indicative form is the strong faith of affliction.

original: drag po'i sgra ni so sor sbyar te /
analyzed: drag po'i sgra ni so sor sbyar te /
translated: The word “strong” is applied to each.

original: nyon mongs pa drag po'i shugs dang dad pa drag po'i shugs kyis khu tshur dang thal lcag la sogs pa dang / mchod rten la phyag bya ba la sogs pa ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa drag po'i shugs dang dad pa drag po'i shugs kyis khu tshur dang thal lcag la sogs pa dang / mchod rten la phyag bya ba la sogs pa ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is so in accordance with the force of the affliction and the force of the faith, and with the fist, the palm, and so on, and with the worship of the stupa, and so on.

original: yi dam 'dzin pa zhes bya bas ni drag po med par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ston to //
analyzed: yi dam 'dzin pa zhes bya bas ni drag po med par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ston to //
translated: By the words, “one who has taken a vow,” it shows that it is also without anger.

original: gtsug lag khang la sogs pa phul bas so zhes bya bas ni rdzas las byung ba nyid ston to //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang la sogs pa phul bas so zhes bya bas ni rdzas las byung ba nyid ston to //
translated: By the words, “by giving a temple, and so on,” it shows that it is also from material generosity.

original: rgyun chad pa ni slob par byed de de dag nyid btang bas so zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang dad pa drag po'i shugs btang ste bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa ni slob par byed de de dag nyid btang bas so zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang dad pa drag po'i shugs btang ste bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: By the words, “one who is training, by interrupting,” it shows that it is also from the interruption of the force of the affliction and the force of the faith, because one has given up those very things, in order to remove them.

original: rang dang mthun pa ni rang gi spyi'o //
analyzed: rang dang mthun pa ni rang gi spyi'o //
translated: The universal of the self is the universal of the self.

original: phyogs gcig dang mthun pa ni phyogs kyi spyi'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig dang mthun pa ni phyogs kyi spyi'o //
translated: The universal of the direction is the universal of the direction.

original: zad par dang mthun pa ni zad par gyi spyi'o //
analyzed: zad par dang mthun pa ni zad par gyi spyi'o //
translated: The universal of the totality is the universal of the totality.

original: phyogs kyi spyi ni mi rtag pa nyid dang sdug bsngal ba nyid do zhes bya ba de la 'dus byas rnams ni mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs kyi spyi ni mi rtag pa nyid dang sdug bsngal ba nyid do zhes bya ba de la 'dus byas rnams ni mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: All conditioned things are impermanent.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams ni sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
translated: All that is impure is suffering.

original: zad par gyi spyi ni stong pa dang bdag med pa nyid de zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: zad par gyi spyi ni stong pa dang bdag med pa nyid de zhes bya ba de la /
translated: The universal of totality is emptiness and nonself.

original: bdag med pa nyid ni chos thams cad bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid ni chos thams cad bdag med pa'o //
translated: Nonself is the nonexistence of a self in all things.

original: stong pa nyid ni mu stegs kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gis stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mu stegs kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gis stong zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Emptiness is the emptiness of a self imagined by the heterodox.

original: ci'i phyir sa la sogs pa nas tha ma rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la thug pa'i dngos po de dag gzugs zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa la sogs pa nas tha ma rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la thug pa'i dngos po de dag gzugs zhes brjod ce na /
translated: Why is that entity called form, beginning with earth and ending with noninformative form?

original: gzugs su rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is capable of being struck.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gzugs pas gzugs pa yin pas de'i phyir gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gzugs pas gzugs pa yin pas de'i phyir gzugs nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus the Blessed One said, “Monks, it is struck, thus it is form. Therefore it is called the appropriated aggregate of form.

original: cis gzugs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: cis gzugs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is it that strikes it?

original: lag pa'i kun du reg @249a * //
analyzed: lag pa'i kun du reg @249a * //
translated: Touching all around with the hands.🔽

original: pas reg na gzugs so //
analyzed: pas reg na gzugs so //
translated: When it is touched by the touch of the hand, it is touched.

original: bong ba'i kun du reg pa dang / dbyig pa'i kun du reg pa dang / mtshon cha'i kun du reg pa dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / rlung dang /
analyzed: bong ba'i kun du reg pa dang / dbyig pa'i kun du reg pa dang / mtshon cha'i kun du reg pa dang / grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / rlung dang /
translated: When it is touched by the touch of a clod, a stick, a knife, cold, heat, hunger, thirst, flies, mosquitoes, wind,🔽sun, and reptiles, it is touched.

original: nyi ma dang / gdug pa'i kun du reg pa rnams kyis reg na gzugs pas gzugs par 'gyur ro //🔽gnod par 'gyur /
analyzed: nyi ma dang / gdug pa'i kun du reg pa rnams kyis reg na gzugs pas gzugs par 'gyur ro // gnod par 'gyur /
translated: When it is touched by the touch of a hand, etc., it is touched.🔽It is injured.

original: snang par 'gyur te /
analyzed: snang par 'gyur te /
translated: It is affected.

original: lag pa la sogs par rnam par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lag pa la sogs par rnam par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is changed into the form of a hand, etc.

original: de'i gnod pa ni gang /
analyzed: de'i gnod pa ni gang /
translated: What is its injury?

original: rnam par 'gyur ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is its change?

original: gang rkyen rnams kyi de bzhin du 'gyur ba de lta bu de ni gnod pa dang rnam par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang rkyen rnams kyi de bzhin du 'gyur ba de lta bu de ni gnod pa dang rnam par 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The change of that which is in such a way as the conditions are, is called injury and change.

original: de ltar gzugs med pa la ni skyon 'di 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gzugs med pa la ni skyon 'di 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Such faults do not occur in the formless realm.

original: de dag las rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las rnam par 'gyur ba'i tshad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their transformation is not perceived.

original: des na de'i rnam par 'gyur ba rjes su dpag tu rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na de'i rnam par 'gyur ba rjes su dpag tu rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, their transformation is inferred.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang rdul phra rab tsam dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni dbyig pa la sogs pas gzugs su med na ji ltar gzugs zhes bya /🔽de yang gzugs yin te /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang rdul phra rab tsam dang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni dbyig pa la sogs pas gzugs su med na ji ltar gzugs zhes bya / de yang gzugs yin te /
translated: Past and future form, form the size of an atom, and non-revealing form do not exist as form, since they are not objects of the staff and so on. How can they be called form?🔽They are form because

original: de'i mtshan nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they obtain the characteristics of form.

original: 'das pa ni da ltar gzugs su med kyang de gzugs yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa ni da ltar gzugs su med kyang de gzugs yin no //
translated: Past form does not exist as form in the present, but it is form.

original: ma 'ongs pa 'byung ba'i chos can ni gzugs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa 'byung ba'i chos can ni gzugs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Future form that is subject to arising will become form.

original: mi 'byung ba'i chos can yang de'i rigs yin pas gzugs te /
analyzed: mi 'byung ba'i chos can yang de'i rigs yin pas gzugs te /
translated: Future form that is not subject to arising is also form because it is the type of form.

original: bsreg par bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: bsreg par bya ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like what is to be burned.

original: dper na ma tshig pa yang bsreg par bya ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dper na ma tshig pa yang bsreg par bya ba zhes bya ste /
translated: For example, what is not burned is called what is to be burned.

original: shing la sogs pa bsreg par bya ba'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing la sogs pa bsreg par bya ba'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the type of what is to be burned, such as wood and so on.

original: rdul phra rab kyi gzugs ni gcig pu so so nas mi 'byung gi sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun ltos nas skye ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab kyi gzugs ni gcig pu so so nas mi 'byung gi sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i rdul phra rab rnams phan tshun ltos nas skye ba'i phyir te /
translated: The form of subtle particles does not arise individually, but subtle particles of the primary elements and those derived from the primary elements arise in dependence on each other, since they are projected by former karma and become cause and effect.

original: de'i phyir so so nas skye ba med pas bsags par gnas pa la gzugs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir so so nas skye ba med pas bsags par gnas pa la gzugs par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since they do not arise individually, they are called form because they exist as a collection.

original: thogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: thogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: They are called obstructive because they are obstructive.

original: rdul phra rab bsags par gnas pa'i gzugs la gzugs so //
analyzed: rdul phra rab bsags par gnas pa'i gzugs la gzugs so //
translated: Form that exists as a collection of subtle particles is form and obstructive.

original: thogs so // rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir dbyig pa la sogs pas gzugs su med du zin kyang de skyed pa'i gnas su gyur pa 'byung ba chen po rnams la gzugs so //
analyzed: thogs so // rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni thogs pa med pa'i phyir dbyig pa la sogs pas gzugs su med du zin kyang de skyed pa'i gnas su gyur pa 'byung ba chen po rnams la gzugs so //
translated: Nonindicative form is not form and not obstructive because it is not obstructive. However, the primary elements that are its generating basis are form.

original: de la btsugs pas de la yang btsugs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la btsugs pas de la yang btsugs pa yin te /
translated: If one is obstructed by that, one is also obstructed by it,

original: shing 'gul na grib @249b ma 'gul ba bzhin no //
analyzed: shing 'gul na grib @249b ma 'gul ba bzhin no //
translated: just as if one moves a tree, one moves its shadow.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i gnas mig la sogs pa la btsugs pas btsugs par 'gyur ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i gnas mig la sogs pa la btsugs pas btsugs par 'gyur ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The error of positing the basis of the eye consciousness and so on as the eye and so forth does not occur because

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gnas ni 'byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gnas ni 'byung ba rnams te /
translated: the basis of nonindicative form is the elements.

original: de dang rtag tu lhan cig skyes pa dang // rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang rtag tu lhan cig skyes pa dang // rnam par rig byed ma yin pa la gnas gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is always simultaneously generated with the elements and nonindicative form has no other basis.

original: mig la sogs pa'i cha mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa'i bye brag gis rtag tu rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba ma yin la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i cha mtshungs pa dang / de dang mtshungs pa'i bye brag gis rtag tu rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skye ba ma yin la /
translated: It is not always simultaneously generated with consciousness because of the similarity of the eye and so on and the distinctions of that.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gnas mig la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi gnas mig la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: The basis of the eye consciousness and so on is not only the eye and so forth.

original: lhan cig skyes pa mig la sogs pa dang 'gags ma thag pa'i yid kyang de dag gi gnas yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa mig la sogs pa dang 'gags ma thag pa'i yid kyang de dag gi gnas yin te /
translated: The basis of the eye consciousness and so on is also the simultaneously generated eye and so forth and the mind that has just ceased.

original: de'i phyir gzugs can dang gzugs ma yin pa'i dbang po gnyis ka gnas su gyur pas de dag gzugs su 'gyur ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs can dang gzugs ma yin pa'i dbang po gnyis ka gnas su gyur pas de dag gzugs su 'gyur ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since both the physical and nonphysical faculties are the basis, the error of form does not arise.

original: gzugs mdor bsdus te rnam par dbye ba byas pa'o /
analyzed: gzugs mdor bsdus te rnam par dbye ba byas pa'o /
translated: Form is summarized and analyzed.

original: // / chos mngon pa la 'jug pa rgya cher 'grel pa'i snying po kun las btus pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: // / chos mngon pa la 'jug pa rgya cher 'grel pa'i snying po kun las btus pa zhes bya ba /
translated: The Essence of the Compendium of Abhidharma, an Extensive Commentary on the Abhidharmasamuccaya

original: bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa /
translated: Volume Two

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dang gnyi ga las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The pleasant, unpleasant, and opposite of both,

original: reg pa'i skye gnas can zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: reg pa'i skye gnas can zhes bya ba de la /
translated: are the sources of contact.

original: reg pa ni sems yul la reg pa'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni sems yul la reg pa'o //
translated: Contact is the mind touching its object.

original: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa'o //
translated: The pleasant is the contact that leads to the experience of pleasure.

original: bde bar tshor ba dang mthun pa ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bde bar tshor ba dang mthun pa ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: That which is conducive to the experience of pleasure is that which leads to the experience of pleasure.

original: bde bar tshor ba skyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde bar tshor ba skyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that which produces the experience of pleasure.

original: de bzhin du mi 'dod pa dang gnyis ka las bzlog pa yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi 'dod pa dang gnyis ka las bzlog pa yang shes par bya'o //
translated: The unpleasant and both should be understood in the same way.

original: skye gnas de ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: skye gnas de ni rgyu ste /
translated: That source is the cause.

original: tshor ba gang gi yin pa de reg pa'i skye gnas can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba gang gi yin pa de reg pa'i skye gnas can zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is of a certain feeling is said to have the birth and origination of contact.

original: lus dang sems kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag ces bya ba ni gnas skabs snga ma las gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag ces bya ba ni gnas skabs snga ma las gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The difference in the condition of body and mind is a change from a previous condition.

original: don de ni sim pa dang / gdung ba dang / gnyi ga las bzlog pa ste zhes bya bas ston to //
analyzed: don de ni sim pa dang / gdung ba dang / gnyi ga las bzlog pa ste zhes bya bas ston to //
translated: This meaning is indicated by the words: “satisfaction, dissatisfaction, and neither of these two.”

original: sim pa ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: sim pa ni bde ba'o //
translated: Satisfaction is pleasure.

original: gdung ba ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gdung ba ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Dissatisfaction is pain.

original: gnyi ga las bzlog pa ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: gnyi ga las bzlog pa ni btang snyoms so //
translated: The absence of both is equanimity.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i mngon par chags pa ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i mngon par chags pa ste /
translated: The condition of existence due to feeling is attachment that arises from the cause of feeling.

original: chags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de yang rnam par shes pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa drug ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de yang rnam par shes pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa drug ste zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is synonymous with “attachment.”🔽Moreover, it is of six kinds due to the difference in consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bye brag ni rnam par shes pa'i @250a * //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bye brag ni rnam par shes pa'i @250a * //
translated: The difference in consciousness is due to the difference in the six sense bases.

original: rgyud kyi mtshan nyid gcig mod kyi gnas dang dmigs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa drug tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyud kyi mtshan nyid gcig mod kyi gnas dang dmigs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Although the characteristics of the mind and mental factors are the same, they are distinguished as six by the differences of their bases and objects.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyed pa zhes bya ba ni mig dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum du 'dus nas reg pa gang yin pa de las skyes pa ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyed pa zhes bya ba ni mig dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum du 'dus nas reg pa gang yin pa de las skyes pa ni mig gi 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: Arisen from the contact that is the coming together of eye, form, and consciousness means that which arises from the contact that is the coming together of eye, form, and consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig byung ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig byung ba ste /
translated: Arisen together with the five consciousnesses means that which occurs simultaneously with the five consciousnesses.

original: de ni lus kyi'o //
analyzed: de ni lus kyi'o //
translated: That is bodily feeling.

original: tshor ba thams cad ni sems kyi yin na ci'i phyir lus kyi zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad ni sems kyi yin na ci'i phyir lus kyi zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If all feeling is mental, why is it called bodily?

original: smras pa lus la gnas pa'i phyir lus kyi'o //
analyzed: smras pa lus la gnas pa'i phyir lus kyi'o //
translated: It is called bodily because it is located in the body.

original: lus ni bsags pa ste 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: lus ni bsags pa ste 'dus pa'o //
translated: The body is a collection, a composite.

original: des mig la sogs pa spyir yongs su bsdus so //
analyzed: des mig la sogs pa spyir yongs su bsdus so //
translated: It generally includes the eye and so on.

original: cig shos ni sems kyi'o zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: cig shos ni sems kyi'o zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The other is mental means that which arises together with the mental consciousness.

original: de la lus kyi sim pa zhes bya ba de ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: de la lus kyi sim pa zhes bya ba de ni bde ba'o //
translated: The faculty of pleasure is the comfort of the body.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa dang / bsam gtan dang por mig dang rna ba dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i khams na rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa dang / bsam gtan dang por mig dang rna ba dang lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: It is associated with the five sensory consciousnesses in the realm of desire, and with the consciousnesses of the eye, ear, and body in the first meditation.

original: bsam gtan gsum la ni yid kyi nyid do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum la ni yid kyi nyid do //
translated: In the three higher meditations, it is associated with mental consciousness alone.

original: lus kyi sim pa ma yin pa ni 'dod pa'i khams nyid na'o //
analyzed: lus kyi sim pa ma yin pa ni 'dod pa'i khams nyid na'o //
translated: The faculty of displeasure is the discomfort of the body.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams gzung ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams gzung ngo //
translated: It is found in the realm of desire, in the first and second meditations, and in the preliminary concentration.

original: de las bzlog pa ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o zhes bya ba de la /
translated: The faculty of mental pain is the opposite of the faculty of pleasure.

original: sim pa ni yid bde ba'i dbang po'o zhes bshad pas /🔽de las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: sim pa ni yid bde ba'i dbang po'o zhes bshad pas / de las bzlog pa ste /
translated: Since it has been explained that comfort is the faculty of pleasure,🔽the opposite of comfort is mental pain.

original: gang yid kyi sim pa ma yin pa de yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: gang yid kyi sim pa ma yin pa de yid mi bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: Mental pain is the discomfort of the mind.

original: de yang 'dod pa'i khams nyid na'o //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa'i khams nyid na'o //
translated: It is found in the realm of desire.

original: lus kyi zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa lnga la lus kyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyi zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa lnga la lus kyi zhes bya'o //
translated: The word “bodily” refers to the five consciousnesses.

original: sems kyi zhes bya ba ni yid kyi ste /
analyzed: sems kyi zhes bya ba ni yid kyi ste /
translated: The word “mental” refers to the mental consciousness.

original: de ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: de ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //
translated: This is the faculty of equanimity.

original: de ni khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de ni khams gsum pa'o //
translated: It exists in the three realms.

original: de la rab tu zhi zhing yongs su mi skyo ba'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa las skyes pa'i yid kyi ni bde ba zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de la rab tu zhi zhing yongs su mi skyo ba'i phyir bsam gtan gsum pa las skyes pa'i yid kyi ni bde ba zhes bstan to //
translated: In the third meditation, the mental faculty is called the faculty of pleasure because it is completely tranquil and not at all subject to satiety.

original: g-yeng bar byed de yongs su skyo ba'i phyir sa gsum las skyes pa'i yid kyi ni bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: g-yeng bar byed de yongs su skyo ba'i phyir sa gsum las skyes pa'i yid kyi ni bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: In the three realms, the mental faculty is called the faculty of satisfaction because it is subject to satiety.

original: lus kyi bde ba'i tshor pa ni dpyod pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa mid  pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi bde ba'i tshor pa ni dpyod pa dang rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa mid  pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculty of bodily pleasure is not subject to satiety because it is not associated with discursive thought.

original: tshor ba bshad zin to //🔽mtshan ma dang ming dang don gyi brda shes pa zhes bya ba de la /🔽mtshan ma dang mngon brtags dang mtshan nyid @250b ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshor ba bshad zin to // mtshan ma dang ming dang don gyi brda shes pa zhes bya ba de la / mtshan ma dang mngon brtags dang mtshan nyid @250b ni rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of feeling is completed.🔽The knowledge of the conventional is the knowledge of the name, the object, and the expression.🔽The name, the object, and the expression are synonyms.

original: ming ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: ming ni 'du shes so //
translated: Name is the discrimination of the object.

original: don ni skye mched bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: don ni skye mched bcu gnyis so //
translated: The meaning is the twelve sense spheres.

original: brda' ni gcig tu bsdus pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: brda' ni gcig tu bsdus pa'i gnas so //
translated: The sign is the basis of the collection.

original: kun du shes pa ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: kun du shes pa ni 'du shes so //
translated: The cognition is the perception.

original: 'di'i yul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i yul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the object of that, he says:

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / ring po dang thung ngu zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / ring po dang thung ngu zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: blue, yellow, long, short, etc.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs la dmigs par ston to //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs la dmigs par ston to //
translated: The phrase “endowed with visual consciousness” shows that it has the form of color and shape as its object.

original: dung zhes bya ba 'dis ni sgra la dmigs pa'o //🔽padma'i dri zhes bya ba ni dri la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dung zhes bya ba 'dis ni sgra la dmigs pa'o // padma'i dri zhes bya ba ni dri la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The word “conch” shows that it has sound as its object.🔽The phrase “the smell of a lotus” shows that it has smell as its object.

original: kha ba dang lan tshva zhes bya ba ni ro la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: kha ba dang lan tshva zhes bya ba ni ro la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “bitter, astringent” shows that it has taste as its object.

original: 'jam pa dang rtsub pa zhes bya ba ni reg bya la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jam pa dang rtsub pa zhes bya ba ni reg bya la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “smooth, rough” shows that it has the tangible as its object.

original: bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul rab tu ston to //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i yul rab tu ston to //
translated: The phrase “woman, man, etc.” shows that it has the mental object as its object.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i byed rgyu'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i byed rgyu'o //
translated: The phrase “the cause of conceptual differentiation” means the cause of the conceptual differentiation of the object.

original: rnam par shes pa kun la yang 'du shes yod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa kun la yang 'du shes yod de /
translated: All consciousnesses have ideation.

original: de'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The object of ideation is the general characteristics of the object.

original: 'o na chos mngon pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas ni sngon por shes kyi sngon po'o zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na chos mngon pa las mig gi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas ni sngon por shes kyi sngon po'o zhes bya bar ni ma yin no //
translated: But in the Abhidharma, it is said: “One who is endowed with visual consciousness knows blue, but does not know ‘blue.’

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas ni sngon por shes la /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang ldan pas ni sngon por shes la /
translated: One who is endowed with mental consciousness knows blue and knows ‘blue.’

original: sngon po'o zhes bya bar yang shes so zhes 'byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po'o zhes bya bar yang shes so zhes 'byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How can this be reconciled with the statement that the five consciousnesses do not have ideation?

original: rnam par shes pa lnga ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis med pas mi gsal ba'i phyir de skad ces bya'o//
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga ni rnam par rtog pa gnyis med pas mi gsal ba'i phyir de skad ces bya'o//
translated: The five consciousnesses are said not to have ideation because they are not clear with regard to the two kinds of ideation.

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Ideation is threefold:

original: chung ngu ni rdul phra rab la sogs pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chung ngu ni rdul phra rab la sogs pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: small, when it has as its object the subtle, such as atoms;

original: chen por gyur pa ni ri rab la sogs pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: chen por gyur pa ni ri rab la sogs pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: great, when it has as its object the gross, such as Mount Meru;

original: sogs pa smos pas ni rgya mtsho la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni rgya mtsho la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: and so on, which refers to the ocean, etc.

original: tshad med pa ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Immeasurable, when it has as its object the base consisting of infinite space, etc.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “and so on” indicates the sphere of infinite consciousness and so on.

original: 'du shes bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'du shes bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of ideation is finished.

original: de la gnas dang / dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la gnas dang / dmigs pa dang rnam pa dang / dus dang / rdzas mtshungs pa nyid de /
translated: The five similarities are similarity of basis, object, aspect, time, and substance.🔽The five similarities are: similarity of basis, similarity of object, similarity of aspect, similarity of time, and similarity of substance.

original: mtshungs pa lnga dag gis sems mtshungs par ldan pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni so sor sbyar te gnas mtshungs pa nas rdzas mtshungs pa'i bar du'o //🔽de la gnas mtshungs pa ni 'di lta ste /🔽mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'i gnas ni mig go //
analyzed: mtshungs pa lnga dag gis sems mtshungs par ldan pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la mtshungs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni so sor sbyar te gnas mtshungs pa nas rdzas mtshungs pa'i bar du'o // de la gnas mtshungs pa ni 'di lta ste / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / tshor ba la sogs pa'i gnas ni mig go //
translated: Similarity of basis means that the eye is the basis of eye consciousness and the feeling and so on that arise together with it.

original: gzugs ni dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs ni dmigs pa ste /
translated: Similarity of object means that form is the object of eye consciousness and the feeling and so on that arise together with it.

original: 'di ni gnas dang dmigs pa mtshungs pa'o //🔽yul gyi rnam pa gang yin pa de'i @251a * //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas dang dmigs pa mtshungs pa'o // yul gyi rnam pa gang yin pa de'i @251a * //
translated: This is the similarity of basis and object.🔽Similarity of aspect means that the aspect of the object is the aspect of the consciousness.

original: rnam par rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam par rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The consciousness arises in the aspect of the object.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa dus thams cad du sems dang lhan cig ste /
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa dus thams cad du sems dang lhan cig ste /
translated: Similarity of time means that the mind and mental factors arise simultaneously.

original: de dang 'grogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang 'grogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are associated with it.

original: rdzas mtshungs pa ni sems gcig la tshor ba la sogs pa rdzas gnyis lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas mtshungs pa ni sems gcig la tshor ba la sogs pa rdzas gnyis lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the same substance, because two substances such as feeling, etc., do not occur simultaneously in one mind.

original: rnam pa lnga po de dag gis mnyam du mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po de dag gis mnyam du mtshungs par ldan pa ste /
translated: They are similar in five ways, i.e., they are similar in being associated.

original: zhugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhugs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by “engaged.

original: sems smos pa ni gnas mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems smos pa ni gnas mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” The word “mind” is mentioned in order to show that they are similar in basis.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa mang po bsdus te /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir mtshungs par ldan pa dang mi ldan pa mang po bsdus te /
translated: Therefore, means because many associated and non-associated are included,

original: 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: they are taught as the aggregate of formations.

original: 'du byed smos pa ni 'dus ma byas bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed smos pa ni 'dus ma byas bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “formations” is mentioned in order to exclude the unconditioned.

original: de bas na mang zhing snying po med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na mang zhing snying po med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to show that they are many and without essence,

original: chu shing gi phung po'i dpes chos mang po du mar ston to //
analyzed: chu shing gi phung po'i dpes chos mang po du mar ston to //
translated: many dharmas are shown by the example of a mass of plantain trees.

original: ji skad smos pa'i go rims bzhin du sems pa bsnyad do //
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i go rims bzhin du sems pa bsnyad do //
translated: They are explained as volitions in the order in which they are mentioned.

original: sems pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
translated: Volition is taught as their nature.

original: sems mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba ni byed par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sems mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba ni byed par bstan pa ste /
translated: The phrase “the mental factor of intention” indicates the agent.

original: mngon du 'du byed pas mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du 'du byed pas mngon par 'du byed pa'o //
translated: It is called “intention” because it intends, i.e., it is the mental factor that intends.

original: sems byed pa med pa las sems pa'i dbang gis byed pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems byed pa med pa las sems pa'i dbang gis byed pa dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: The mind is without activity, but through the power of intention, it becomes active.

original: de'i phyir sems kun du g-yo'o zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kun du g-yo'o zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, the phrase “the mind is disturbed” means that the mind is disturbed by intention.

original: de ni 'di skad du gang sems mngon par 'du byed cing las su rung bar byed pa de sems pa ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du gang sems mngon par 'du byed cing las su rung bar byed pa de sems pa ste /
translated: This means that the mind is disturbed by the mental factor of intention, which is the activity of the mind.

original: sems pa'i dbang gis dmigs pa la sems g-yo bar 'gyur bas khab long gi dbang gis lcags g-yo ba bzhin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems pa'i dbang gis dmigs pa la sems g-yo bar 'gyur bas khab long gi dbang gis lcags g-yo ba bzhin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind is disturbed by the power of intention, just as iron is attracted by the power of a magnet.

original: yid kyi las zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yid kyi las zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The phrase “mental action” means the activity of the mind.

original: dper na lus kyi 'jug pa la lus kyi las zhes bya ba de bzhin du yid dang ldan pa'i las la yid kyi las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na lus kyi 'jug pa la lus kyi las zhes bya ba de bzhin du yid dang ldan pa'i las la yid kyi las zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as bodily action is called “the activity of the body,” so mental action is called “the activity of the mind.”

original: de yang dge bzhes bya ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dge bzhes bya ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Virtue is that which is associated with nonattachment and so on.

original: de la rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'i ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa lnga dang lhan cig skyes pa'i ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa'i ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang /
translated: Nonattachment, nonaversion, and nondelusion that are concomitant with the five sense consciousnesses and nonattachment, nonaversion, and nondelusion that are concomitant with mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig skyes pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Nonattachment, nonaverseon, and nondelusion that are concomitant with mental consciousness are either contaminated or uncontaminated.

original: 'jig rten gsum la dbang @251b byed pa yin med kyi 'di dbang po zhes ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum la dbang @251b byed pa yin med kyi 'di dbang po zhes ni mi bya ste /
translated: It is not called a faculty since it is not the dominant condition of the three realms and it is not the result of the three realms.

original: 'bras bu mngon sum ma yin pa dang / rtsod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu mngon sum ma yin pa dang / rtsod pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a result that is directly perceived and it is a source of dispute.

original: gnyis yod na ldan pa zhes bya na /
analyzed: gnyis yod na ldan pa zhes bya na /
translated: If something is called a faculty when it possesses two qualities,

original: ci'i phyir ma chags pa la sogs pa'i chos can ni sems yin la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma chags pa la sogs pa'i chos can ni sems yin la /
translated: Why is the mind the reality that is not attached, etc.🔽, and not the mind itself that is not attached, etc.

original: sems ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'i chos ma yin zhe na ;
analyzed: sems ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'i chos ma yin zhe na ;
translated: But mind is not a phenomenon of nonattachment and so on.🔽

original: dper na nye bar gnas pa'i dbang gis shel gzhan du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dper na nye bar gnas pa'i dbang gis shel gzhan du 'gyur gyi /
translated: For example, a crystal is changed by the influence of what is near it,

original: shel gyi nye bar gnas pa bsgyur ba ni ma yin par mthong ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: shel gyi nye bar gnas pa bsgyur ba ni ma yin par mthong ba lta bu'o //
translated: but the influence of the crystal itself is not changed.

original: de gnyis ni rigs te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni rigs te /
translated: These two examples are appropriate,

original: nye bar gnas pa logs shig tu dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa logs shig tu dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the influence of what is near is perceived as something separate.

original: sems pa la sogs pa'i chos bsal na ma chags pa la sogs pa logs shig na med do //
analyzed: sems pa la sogs pa'i chos bsal na ma chags pa la sogs pa logs shig na med do //
translated: But when the realities of intention, etc. are removed, there is no nonattachment, etc. that is separate from them.

original: de bas na grub pa'i mtha' las /
analyzed: de bas na grub pa'i mtha' las /
translated: Therefore, the conclusion is that

original: tshogs gzhan dag 'byung ngo zhe'o //🔽gal te de lta na don dam pa dang / rang bzhin dang ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang pa'i dge ba ste /
analyzed: tshogs gzhan dag 'byung ngo zhe'o // gal te de lta na don dam pa dang / rang bzhin dang ldan pa dang / kun nas bslang pa'i dge ba ste /
translated: the other collections arise.🔽If that is so, then the four kinds of virtue, etc. are undermined, namely,

original: dge ba rnam pa bzhi la sogs pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba rnam pa bzhi la sogs pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: ultimate virtue, natural virtue, virtue that consists of a motivation, and virtue that consists of a conclusion.

original: de la don dam par dge ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de la don dam par dge ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Of these, ultimate virtue is nirvana.

original: de bzhin du don dam par mi dge ba ni 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par mi dge ba ni 'khor ba'o //
translated: Likewise, the ultimate nonvirtue is samsara.

original: mig la sogs pa lung du ma bstan pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa mngon par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa lung du ma bstan pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa mngon par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is neutral, such as the eye faculty, is not the result of karmic maturation because it is not established as a result of karmic maturation.

original: rang bzhin gyis dge ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dge ba ni ma chags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which is virtuous by nature is nonattachment and so on.

original: de dang mi mthun pa ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: That which is contrary to that is nonvirtue.

original: ldan pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which is concomitant is feeling and so on.

original: kun nas bslang ba ni lus dang ngag gi las so //
analyzed: kun nas bslang ba ni lus dang ngag gi las so //
translated: That which is motivated is physical and verbal karma.

original: 'dis ni mi dge ba yang bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi dge ba yang bshad do //
translated: This also explains nonvirtue.

original: don dam par lung du ma bstan pa gnyis ste /
analyzed: don dam par lung du ma bstan pa gnyis ste /
translated: There are two ultimate neutral states:

original: nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa'o //
translated: space and nonanalytical cessation.

original: de ltar na tshor ba la sogs pa ni gsum du dmigs kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na tshor ba la sogs pa ni gsum du dmigs kyi /
translated: Thus feeling and so on are observed to be threefold.

original: ma chags pa la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: ma chags pa la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Nonattachment and so on are not like that.

original: des na ldan pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des na ldan pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore they are taught to be concomitant.

original: spyod lam dang / bzo'i gnas dang / sprul pa byed pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: spyod lam dang / bzo'i gnas dang / sprul pa byed pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni lung du ma bstan pa rnams so //
translated: The indeterminate ones are those that are associated with the mind that is the result of the maturation of the mind that creates emanations, the mind that creates artistic endeavors, and the mind that creates behavior.🔽Contact is that which arises from the object, faculty, and consciousness.

original: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa de las byung ba ste /
analyzed: reg pa ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa las byung ba zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa de las byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from the object, faculty, and consciousness.

original: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa las byung ba'i reg pa'o //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po dang rnam par shes pa las byung ba'i reg pa'o //
translated: It is contact that arises from the object, faculty, and consciousness.

original: gang gis sems de yul la reg pa dang 'dra ba sems las 'byung ba'i chos te /🔽sems las don @252a * //
analyzed: gang gis sems de yul la reg pa dang 'dra ba sems las 'byung ba'i chos te / sems las don @252a * //
translated: It is a mental factor that is like the contact of the mind with the object.

original: gzhan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du gyur pa'o //
translated: It is a factor that is different from the mind.

original: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'dis tshor ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'i dngos por ston to //
analyzed: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni 'dis tshor ba la sogs pa'i rgyu'i dngos por ston to //
translated: The characteristic of feeling is that it is the cause of feeling, etc.

original: 'di la 'dus pa'i don gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la 'dus pa'i don gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “aggregate”?

original: 'bras bu gcig pa'i don ni 'dus pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa'i don ni 'dus pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “aggregate” is the meaning of “having the same result.”

original: gsum po de dag ni reg pa las byung ba dang mthun par gnas pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: gsum po de dag ni reg pa las byung ba dang mthun par gnas pa'i phyir ro//
translated: These three are in harmony with what arises from contact.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'di ltar reg pa ni sems las byung ba'i tshor ba zhes bshad pas reg pa'i rgyu las byung bar shes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar reg pa ni sems las byung ba'i tshor ba zhes bshad pas reg pa'i rgyu las byung bar shes so //
translated: Since contact is explained as the cause of feeling that arises with the mind, it is understood that feeling arises from the cause of contact.

original: de skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o //
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o //
translated: “Feeling has contact as its condition.”

original: sems pa'o // 'du shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sems pa'o // 'du shes so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: “ Intention,” “perception,” and so on.

original: bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bde bar tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa myong bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bde bar tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ To be experienced as pleasure” means to be associated with the feeling of pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa myong bar 'gyur ba yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to “to be experienced as pain” and “to be experienced as neither pleasure nor pain.”

original: yang na bde ba tshor ba dang mthun pa ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yang na bde ba tshor ba dang mthun pa ni bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Alternatively, “to be experienced as pleasure” means to be in harmony with the feeling of pleasure.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba skye ba dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the mental attention that is in harmony with the arising of a pleasant feeling.

original: yid la byed pa ni sems kyis 'jug pa zhes bya ba la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa yul la gtod pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni sems kyis 'jug pa zhes bya ba la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa yul la gtod pa ste /
translated: Mental attention is the directing of the mind. Directing is the application of consciousness to an object.

original: don de ni gang sems yul rnams la gtod pa zhes bya bas ston ste /
analyzed: don de ni gang sems yul rnams la gtod pa zhes bya bas ston ste /
translated: The meaning of that is indicated by the phrase “the directing of the mind to an object.”

original: gang sems yul la 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽sngon myong ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /🔽sngon myong ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'das pa'i dus yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: gang sems yul la 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // sngon myong ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la / sngon myong ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'das pa'i dus yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: It is the mental attention that is in harmony with the arising of a pleasant feeling.🔽The phrase “in relation to an object that has been experienced in the past” indicates that the past is being discussed.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni myong ba dang myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni myong ba dang myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa bsdu ba'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the present and future.

original: sems par byed pas sems pa ste /
analyzed: sems par byed pas sems pa ste /
translated: It is the mental attention that is in harmony with the arising of a pleasant feeling.

original: sngon myong ba la sogs pa'i yul la 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon myong ba la sogs pa'i yul la 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “in relation to an object that has been experienced in the past” indicates that the past is being discussed.🔽The phrase “and so on” includes the present and future.

original: yul gzhan la zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun yul gzhan la gtod pa ni yid la byed pa'i las so //
analyzed: yul gzhan la zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun yul gzhan la gtod pa ni yid la byed pa'i las so //
translated: The directing of the continuum of consciousness that is engaged with one object to another object is the action of mental attention.

original: gtad nas yul 'dzin par gzhol ba ni sems pa'i las so //
analyzed: gtad nas yul 'dzin par gzhol ba ni sems pa'i las so //
translated: The function of attention is to direct the mind to the object.🔽The function of contact is to make the mind rest on the object.🔽The function of feeling is to experience the object.🔽The function of conceptualization is to grasp the characteristics of the object.🔽The function of volition is to direct the mind to the object.🔽The function of resolve is to make the mind rest on the object.🔽The function of mindfulness is to prevent the mind from forgetting the object.

original: gzhol nas nye bar 'dre bar byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i las so //
analyzed: gzhol nas nye bar 'dre bar byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i las so //
translated: The function of concentration is to make the mind one-pointed on the object.🔽The function of wisdom is to discern the characteristics of the object.🔽The function of faith is to make the mind clear and bright.🔽The function of diligence is to make the mind energetic and active.🔽The function of mindfulness is to make the mind remember and not forget.

original: nye bar 'dres nas mi 'phyar bar byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi las so //🔽dbang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar 'dres nas mi 'phyar bar byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi las so // dbang po ni ma yin te /
translated: The function of concentration is to make the mind one-pointed and focused.🔽The function of wisdom is to discern and understand the nature of phenomena.🔽The function of faith is to make the mind clear and bright.🔽The function of diligence is to make the mind energetic and active.🔽The function of mindfulness is to make the mind remember and not forget.

original: sems gtod pa'i phyir ro //🔽yan lag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems gtod pa'i phyir ro // yan lag tu gyur pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The function of concentration is to make the mind one-pointed and focused.🔽The function of wisdom is to discern and understand the nature of phenomena.🔽The function of faith is to make the mind clear and bright.🔽The function of diligence is to make the mind energetic and active.🔽The function of mindfulness is to make the mind remember and not forget.

original: yan lag tu gyur pa ni rgyur gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de'i phyir 'di zhes bya ba'i snyam pa gang las 'byung zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag tu gyur pa ni rgyur gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // de'i phyir 'di zhes bya ba'i snyam pa gang las 'byung zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The function of concentration is to make the mind one-pointed and focused.🔽The function of wisdom is to discern and understand the nature of phenomena.🔽The function of faith is to make the mind clear and bright.🔽The function of diligence is to make the mind energetic and active.🔽The function of mindfulness is to make the mind remember and not forget.

original: 'dod pa ni sems @252b thams cad du 'jug tu zin kyang dge ba spyad pa la 'di gtso bor gyur pas de'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi yan lag tu gyur pa ste zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni sems @252b thams cad du 'jug tu zin kyang dge ba spyad pa la 'di gtso bor gyur pas de'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi yan lag tu gyur pa ste zhes smos so //
translated: The function of concentration is to make the mind one-pointed and focused.🔽The function of wisdom is to discern and understand the nature of phenomena.🔽The function of faith is to make the mind clear and bright.🔽The function of diligence is to make the mind energetic and active.🔽The function of mindfulness is to make the mind remember and not forget.

original: yul lam zhum pa zhes bya ba ni gang yul la sems rgyas par byed pa'o //🔽de ni mos pa ste /
analyzed: yul lam zhum pa zhes bya ba ni gang yul la sems rgyas par byed pa'o //🔽de ni mos pa ste /
translated: The function of concentration is to make the mind one-pointed and focused.🔽The function of wisdom is to discern and understand the nature of phenomena.🔽The function of faith is to make the mind clear and bright

original: lhag par mos shing yul la rnam par shes pa zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par mos shing yul la rnam par shes pa zhugs pa'o //
translated: It is the mind's inclination toward an object, and the mind's engagement with the object.

original: don de ni yul la ma zhum pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: don de ni yul la ma zhum pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: The meaning of that is the meaning of not shrinking away from the object.

original: mos pa 'dus byas kyi rnam par grol bar ston pa ste /
analyzed: mos pa 'dus byas kyi rnam par grol bar ston pa ste /
translated: Faith is taught as the conditioned liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Liberation is twofold: conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de la 'dus ma byas ni 'dod chags dang bral bas mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas ni 'dod chags dang bral bas mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Among them, the unconditioned is nirvana, which is freedom from attachment.

original: 'dus byas kyi rnam par grol ba ni mos pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi rnam par grol ba ni mos pa ste /
translated: The conditioned liberation is faith.

original: gang dang ldan pas rta srab phud pa bzhin du sems yul la ma zhum par rgyug pa de lta bu de mos pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang ldan pas rta srab phud pa bzhin du sems yul la ma zhum par rgyug pa de lta bu de mos pa'o //
translated: It is like that because it is the mind's inclination toward an object, and the mind's engagement with the object.

original: dad pa'i sems dang ba ste zhes bya ba de la dad pa ni yon tan la yid ches pa dang / de sngon du song ba'i dga' ba ste /
analyzed: dad pa'i sems dang ba ste zhes bya ba de la dad pa ni yon tan la yid ches pa dang / de sngon du song ba'i dga' ba ste /
translated: Faith is a clear mind. Faith is confidence in good qualities, and joy that precedes it.

original: de bas na don gzhan du gyur pa'o ;
analyzed: de bas na don gzhan du gyur pa'o ;
translated: Therefore, it is a different meaning.

original: / dad pa ni sems dang ba'o //
analyzed: / dad pa ni sems dang ba'o //
translated: Faith is a clear mind.

original: dkon mchog gsum ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun no //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun no //
translated: The Three Jewels are the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis la 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis la 'brel ba'o //
translated: The connection between cause and effect is the relationship between the two, cause and effect.

original: sems kyi rnyog pa de sel ba'i ngang tshul can yin pas dpe de bstan to //
analyzed: sems kyi rnyog pa de sel ba'i ngang tshul can yin pas dpe de bstan to //
translated: The mind is like a pond, and the afflictions are like the mud. The bodhisattvas’ practice of the perfections is like the churning stick, and the bodhisattvas’ patience is like the churning rope. The bodhisattvas’ patience is the means of removing the afflictions, which are like the mud.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub ni zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi byang chub ni zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad dang stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po'o //
translated: The buddhas’ enlightenment is the knowledge of elimination, the knowledge of nonarising, the eighteen unshared qualities of the buddhas, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the three closely placed recollections, and great compassion.

original: chos kyi legs par sgrub pa nyid ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spong bar slu ba med pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi legs par sgrub pa nyid ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spong bar slu ba med pa ste /
translated: The Dharma’s excellence of accomplishment is the undeceiving abandonment of the afflictions.

original: 'gro ba'i bla mas ji skad du /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i bla mas ji skad du /
translated: As the teacher of the world has said:

original: ngas khyed la gang nyan thos rnams kyi lam bshad pa de ni nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa snyam zhes bya ba'i gnas med do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ngas khyed la gang nyan thos rnams kyi lam bshad pa de ni nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa snyam zhes bya ba'i gnas med do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: I have said to you, “There is no basis for thinking that the path of the disciples is not a way out.”

original: yang dag par sgrub pa ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims yod pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa ni 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims yod pa'o //
translated: Correct practice is the morality pleasing to the Aryas.🔽All those outside of this are deluded.

original: 'di las phyi rol du gyur pa thams cad 'khrul par byed pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid la zhes bya ba dang / dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa de dag yod pa nyid la de yod pa nyid du mngon par yid ches pas ni nges pa ste /🔽mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa de la mngon @253a * //
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol du gyur pa thams cad 'khrul par byed pa rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid la zhes bya ba dang / dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa de dag yod pa nyid la de yod pa nyid du mngon par yid ches pas ni nges pa ste / mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa de la mngon @253a * //
translated: Those who have faith in the reality of the Three Jewels and so on are certain.

original: par dad cing nges so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: par dad cing nges so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The aspect of that faith is called “faith and certainty.”

original: 'o na rgyal po ma skyes dgra rtsa ba med pa'i dad pa dang ldan zhes gang yang gsungs pa la /
analyzed: 'o na rgyal po ma skyes dgra rtsa ba med pa'i dad pa dang ldan zhes gang yang gsungs pa la /
translated: But it is said that Ajatashatru had rootless faith.

original: rtsa ba med pa'i dad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa'i dad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is rootless faith?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is devoid of the noble truths.

original: 'o na so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi rgyud kyi yang rtsa ba med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi rgyud kyi yang rtsa ba med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But then the root would be nonexistent in the mindstreams of all ordinary beings.

original: de la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: khyad zhugs pa dang ldan pa la de skad ces brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad zhugs pa dang ldan pa la de skad ces brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the root is that which is special and possesses that.

original: de bas na gang bden pa mthong ba dang mthun par bsten pa nyid rtsa ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gang bden pa mthong ba dang mthun par bsten pa nyid rtsa ba med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the root is that which is cultivated in accordance with the vision of the truths.

original: dad pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: dad pa bshad zin to //
translated: Faith has been explained.

original: brtson 'grus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Diligence is the joy in virtue.

original: dge ba'i chos la mngon par spro ba ni de la mngon du phyogs shing mthor 'gro bar rtsol ba ni spro ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la mngon par spro ba ni de la mngon du phyogs shing mthor 'gro bar rtsol ba ni spro ba'o //
translated: Joy in virtue is the delight in virtue, the inclination toward it, and the striving for it.

original: 'dir dge ba rnams bskyed pa dang gnas par byed pa dang / mi dge ba rnams mi skyed pa dang 'gog par byed pa dang go rims bzhin du lta 'o //
analyzed: 'dir dge ba rnams bskyed pa dang gnas par byed pa dang / mi dge ba rnams mi skyed pa dang 'gog par byed pa dang go rims bzhin du lta 'o //
translated: Here, it should be understood that the virtues are generated and maintained, and the nonvirtues are not generated and are stopped, respectively.

original: 'khor ba'i 'dam zhes bya ba ni 'khor bar byed pas 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'dam zhes bya ba ni 'khor bar byed pas 'khor ba ste /
translated: The mire of cyclic existence is cyclic existence because it causes one to revolve.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid 'byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The characteristic of the five appropriative aggregates is called “arising.”

original: 'khor ba nyid 'dam yin pas 'khor ba'i 'dam mo //
analyzed: 'khor ba nyid 'dam yin pas 'khor ba'i 'dam mo //
translated: The mire of cyclic existence is the mire of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba'i 'dam ni 'khor ba las 'byung par dka' ba'i phyir 'dam mo //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'dam ni 'khor ba las 'byung par dka' ba'i phyir 'dam mo //
translated: The mire of cyclic existence is a mire because it is difficult to emerge from cyclic existence.

original: der bying ba'i sems mngon par 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: der bying ba'i sems mngon par 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba ni 'byin pa'o //
translated: The mind that is sinking in that mire is emerging.

original: de ni brtson 'grus te mngon par 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyud gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni brtson 'grus te mngon par 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyud gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is effort, because it causes the continuum of conceptualization, such as emerging, to remain.

original: brtson 'grus bshad zin to //
analyzed: brtson 'grus bshad zin to //
translated: Effort has been explained.

original: dran pa zhes bya ba ni dran par byed pas dran pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa zhes bya ba ni dran par byed pas dran pa'o //
translated: Mindfulness is that by which one is mindful.

original: de ni sems gsal ba nyid de gsal ba'i dngos po ni gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de ni sems gsal ba nyid de gsal ba'i dngos po ni gsal ba nyid do //
translated: It is the clarity of mind, because clarity is the nature of clarity.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni shes par bya ba yin pas don de gsal ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni shes par bya ba yin pas don de gsal ba nyid do //
translated: Form, etc., is the object that is to be clarified.

original: de yang byas pa la sogs pa ma brjed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang byas pa la sogs pa ma brjed pa'o //
translated: It is also the non-forgetting of what has been done, etc.

original: ci'i phyir ma brjed pa la gsal ba nyid ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma brjed pa la gsal ba nyid ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why is non-forgetting called clarity?

original: 'di ltar myong ba'i don dran pas gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar myong ba'i don dran pas gsal bar byed de /
translated: Thus, memory clarifies the object of experience.

original: sal sal por byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sal sal por byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “clarifies” is “makes clear.”

original: myong ba'i yul dran pa dran pa gzhan gyi dbang gis sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis yul gyi dngos por 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: myong ba'i yul dran pa dran pa gzhan gyi dbang gis sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyis yul gyi dngos por 'gyur zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The intended meaning is that the mind and mental factors, by the power of another memory, become the entity of the object of memory.

original: byas pa dang bya ba dang byed pa'i yul de dag kyang dran mod kyi phal cher 'das pa'i yul la 'jug pas 'das pa yul nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: byas pa dang bya ba dang byed pa'i yul de dag kyang dran mod kyi phal cher 'das pa'i yul la 'jug pas 'das pa yul nyid du bstan to //
translated: Although one also remembers the object of action and the agent, since they are mostly engaged in the object of the past, the object of the past is taught.🔽Concentration is the one-pointedness of mind.

original: ting nge @253b 'dzin sems rtse gcig pa ste zhes bya ba ni sems spre'u dang 'dra bas na spre'u smos te /
analyzed: ting nge @253b 'dzin sems rtse gcig pa ste zhes bya ba ni sems spre'u dang 'dra bas na spre'u smos te /
translated: The mind is like a monkey, so a monkey is mentioned.

original: rgod par grags pa'i phyir dper smos kyi /
analyzed: rgod par grags pa'i phyir dper smos kyi /
translated: It is mentioned as an example because it is well known to be agitated.

original: 'dra ba tsam gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba tsam gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not mentioned because it is similar.

original: gzhan nas kyang dge slong dag 'di ltar myur du 'gyur ba ni chos gcig las ngas ma mthong ste /
analyzed: gzhan nas kyang dge slong dag 'di ltar myur du 'gyur ba ni chos gcig las ngas ma mthong ste /
translated: Moreover, in another sutra, the Buddha said, “Monks, I do not see any phenomenon that changes as quickly as this.

original: de ni sems so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni sems so zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the mind.”

original: dmigs pa gcig ces bya ba ni yul gcig la 'dzin par nus pa ste de nyid yul gcig la 'dzin pa nyid du ston to //🔽dper na sprul rang bzhin gyis gya gyur 'gro ba 'od ma'i sbubs su bcug pa de bzhin du sems kyang rang bzhin gyis gya gyu ba ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig ces bya ba ni yul gcig la 'dzin par nus pa ste de nyid yul gcig la 'dzin pa nyid du ston to // dper na sprul rang bzhin gyis gya gyur 'gro ba 'od ma'i sbubs su bcug pa de bzhin du sems kyang rang bzhin gyis gya gyu ba ste /
translated: The phrase “having a single object” means that it is able to apprehend a single object.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis de dmigs pa gcig la gnas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang gis de dmigs pa gcig la gnas so //
translated: Just as a snake, which is naturally crooked, is placed straight in a bamboo tube, so too the mind, which is naturally crooked, is placed straight in a single object by the power of concentration.

original: gang dag gi lta ba las dge slong dag rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis dang ba yin na /
analyzed: gang dag gi lta ba las dge slong dag rnam par shes pa ni rang bzhin gyis dang ba yin na /
translated: Those who hold the view that the mind is naturally clear and pure,

original: de glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyis nye bar nyon mongs par gyur to zhes 'byung ba de skad du brjod pa ni thog ma yod pa can gyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de glo bur gyi nyon mongs pa rnams kyis nye bar nyon mongs par gyur to zhes 'byung ba de skad du brjod pa ni thog ma yod pa can gyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: and that it is defiled by adventitious afflictions, are guilty of the error of asserting that the mind has a beginning.

original: 'dis sems dang sems las byung ba rnams snyoms par byed pas ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: 'dis sems dang sems las byung ba rnams snyoms par byed pas ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: It is concentration because it concentrates the mind and mental factors.

original: dmigs pa gcig la 'jog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig la 'jog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the settling of the mind on a single object.

original: de bas na sems spre'u lta bu dmigs pa gcig la 'jug ces bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de bas na sems spre'u lta bu dmigs pa gcig la 'jug ces bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the mind, which is like a monkey, should be fixed on a single object.
