original: 'dir ni sems dang sems las byung ba mtha' dag la sems zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni sems dang sems las byung ba mtha' dag la sems zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the mind and all mental factors are called the mind.

original: sems rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rtse gcig pa la sems rtse gcig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rtse gcig pa la sems rtse gcig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the one-pointedness of the mind.

original: rtse zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la bya ste /
analyzed: rtse zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa la bya ste /
translated: The word “pointedness” refers to the object.

original: dmigs pa gcig la 'jug pa zhes gang smras pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig la 'jug pa zhes gang smras pa'o //
translated: It is said that the mind engages in a single object.🔽Wisdom is the discernment of phenomena.

original: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni mchog tu shes pas na shes rab bo //
analyzed: shes rab ni chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste zhes bya ba ni mchog tu shes pas na shes rab bo //
translated: It is wisdom because it is supreme knowledge.

original: yang na rab tu shes pas shes rab ste khong du chud pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rab tu shes pas shes rab ste khong du chud pa'o //
translated: Or, it is wisdom because it is well known, i.e., well understood.

original: rab kyi sgra ni 'du shes las gzhan du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab kyi sgra ni 'du shes las gzhan du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “well” is used to indicate that it is different from mere discernment.

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba la chung ngu rtogs pa ni 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba la chung ngu rtogs pa ni 'byed pa'o //
translated: Discernment is the understanding of the small.

original: 'bring ni rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring ni rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Analysis is the understanding of the medium.

original: cher rtogs pa ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: cher rtogs pa ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Thorough analysis is the understanding of the great.

original: de bas na thams cad khong du chud par bsdu ba'i phyir nye bar sgyur ba gnyi ga smos so //
analyzed: de bas na thams cad khong du chud par bsdu ba'i phyir nye bar sgyur ba gnyi ga smos so //
translated: Therefore, both are mentioned in order to include everything.

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa de yang shin tu rnam par 'byed pas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa de yang shin tu rnam par 'byed pas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: That discernment is thorough discernment because it is a very thorough discernment.

original: rab de ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab de ji lta bu yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate what kind of thorough discernment it is, he says:

original: chos rnam pa brgyad po de dag gi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: chos rnam pa brgyad po de dag gi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: of those eight aspects of the Dharma.

original: gzugs la sogs @254a * //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs @254a * //
translated: The dharmas are form, etc.

original: pa'i chos rnams nas so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la thug pa dag go //
analyzed: pa'i chos rnams nas so sor brtags pas 'gog pa la thug pa dag go //
translated: up to the analytical cessations.

original: ji ltar mthun mthun du zhes bya ba ni gang la gang 'thad pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mthun mthun du zhes bya ba ni gang la gang 'thad pa'o //
translated: As appropriate means in whatever way is suitable.

original: de gang zhe na sdud pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de gang zhe na sdud pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is that? It is the collection, etc.

original: de la sdud par byed pas sdud pa ste /
analyzed: de la sdud par byed pas sdud pa ste /
translated: Therein, the collection is that which collects.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for nature.

original: 'di lta ste sa ni sra bas bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste sa ni sra bas bsdus pa ste /
translated: For example, earth is collected by solidity;

original: sra ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: sra ba'i rang bzhin zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: it is known as having the nature of solidity.

original: 'jig rten na dngos po gzhan gyis sar mthong ba med dam /
analyzed: 'jig rten na dngos po gzhan gyis sar mthong ba med dam /
translated: Is there not earth seen in the world by means of another entity?

original: dper na skud pas gos kyi gzungs byas pa dang gdung rten gyis gdung gi gzungs byas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na skud pas gos kyi gzungs byas pa dang gdung rten gyis gdung gi gzungs byas pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a cloth is held together by threads, and a skeleton is held together by bones.

original: de ni res 'ga' tsam dang rgyu la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir sdud pa ste brda can no //
analyzed: de ni res 'ga' tsam dang rgyu la rag las te 'byung ba'i phyir sdud pa ste brda can no //
translated: It is a “restrainer” because it sometimes restrains, and because it arises in dependence on a cause.

original: gang rang bzhin gyis sdud pa de na ji srid du rdzas med par ma gyur gyi bar du yod pa dang / rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir don dam pa'i sdud pa ste /
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis sdud pa de na ji srid du rdzas med par ma gyur gyi bar du yod pa dang / rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir don dam pa'i sdud pa ste /
translated: That which restrains by its very nature exists as long as the substance does not cease, and it restrains ultimately because it does not depend on another cause.

original: slob dpon gyi nye gnas bzhin du dngos pos rang bzhin gyis bzung nas 'khyud pa bzhin du gnas pa ste ;
analyzed: slob dpon gyi nye gnas bzhin du dngos pos rang bzhin gyis bzung nas 'khyud pa bzhin du gnas pa ste ;
translated: It restrains like a master’s servant, and it restrains like a mother holding her child.

original: sa ni rdzas gzhan du 'gro ba bkag pa'i ngo bos sra ba bzung nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sa ni rdzas gzhan du 'gro ba bkag pa'i ngo bos sra ba bzung nas gnas pa'o //
translated: Earth restrains by the nature of its substance, which is solidity, and it restrains by the nature of its substance, which is fluidity.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa ni mtshungs par 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa ni mtshungs par 'jug pa ste /
translated: Concomitance is the state of being concurrent.

original: de ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: It is that of mind and mental factors.

original: ldan pa rnams thob pa la bya'o //
analyzed: ldan pa rnams thob pa la bya'o //
translated: Possession is to be possessed of.

original: rgyu ni drug ste mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba dang / skal pa mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa dang / byed rgyu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni drug ste mtshungs par ldan pa dang / lhan cig 'byung ba dang / skal pa mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba dang / rnam par smin pa dang / byed rgyu zhes bya'o //
translated: The causes are six: the associated cause, the co-existent cause, the homogeneous cause, the universal cause, the ripening cause, and the enabling cause.

original: rkyen ni rgyu dang / de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen gyi bye brag gis gzhi'o //
analyzed: rkyen ni rgyu dang / de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen gyi bye brag gis gzhi'o //
translated: The conditions are the same as the causes, with the distinction that the condition is the basis of the effect, whereas the cause is not the basis of the effect.

original: 'bras bu ni lnga ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni lnga ste /
translated: The effects are five:

original: skyes bu'i byed pa dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / bdag po dang / bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / bdag po dang / bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the effect of dominance, the effect of human action, the effect of equal outflow, the effect of ripening, and the effect of disconnection.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa la sogs pa de dag ni 'og tu rgyas par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa la sogs pa de dag ni 'og tu rgyas par bshad par bya'o //
translated: The associated cause, etc., will be discussed later in detail.

original: rang dang spyi ni rang dang spyi ste /
analyzed: rang dang spyi ni rang dang spyi ste /
translated: The specific and the general are the specific and the general.

original: de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristics of these two are the specific and general characteristics.

original: de la chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni chos gzhan thams cad las bzlog pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: de la chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni chos gzhan thams cad las bzlog pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The specific characteristic of factors is their nature as opposed to any other factor.

original: dper na me'i tsha ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na me'i tsha ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the heat of fire.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni chos thams cad kyi thun mong gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni chos thams cad kyi thun mong gi ngo bo ste /
translated: The general characteristics are the common nature of all things.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: emptiness, etc.

original: 'dis rtog par byed pas rtog pa ste shes rab bo //
analyzed: 'dis rtog par byed pas rtog pa ste shes rab bo //
translated: It is understanding because it understands. Understanding is wisdom.

original: rtog pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni so sor sbyar te /
analyzed: rtog pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni so sor sbyar te /
translated: The word “understanding” is applied individually to each of the following:

original: sdud pa la rtog pa dang / @254b mtshungs par ldan pa la rtog pa la sogs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sdud pa la rtog pa dang / @254b mtshungs par ldan pa la rtog pa la sogs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: the understanding of the summary, the understanding of the associated, etc.

original: de dag rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin dpyod de rtog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin dpyod de rtog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called “understanding” because it analyzes the nature of each of those.

original: rtog pa ni sems rtsing ba'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la sems kyi rtsing ba ni sems rtsing ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ni sems rtsing ba'i mtshan nyid do zhes bya ba la sems kyi rtsing ba ni sems rtsing ba'o //
translated: It is said that “understanding is the characteristic of a gross mind.” A gross mind is a mind that is gross.

original: de nyid mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de nyid mtshan nyid de /
translated: That itself is a characteristic.

original: sems rtsing ba'i mtshan nyid de gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems rtsing ba'i mtshan nyid de gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the characteristic of a gross mind, that is, of what kind.

original: gang gi dbang gis sems rtsing bar gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis sems rtsing bar gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: It is by the power of that that the mind becomes gross.

original: sems sam sems las byung ba gzhan dag gis rtsing ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sems sam sems las byung ba gzhan dag gis rtsing ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the mind or other mental factors are gross.

original: rang bzhin gzhan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are of a different nature.

original: de la rtsing ba ni gsal bar rgyu ba nyid de lus kyi tshad tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rtsing ba ni gsal bar rgyu ba nyid de lus kyi tshad tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: Coarseness is the movement of the mind in a gross manner, not the size of the body.

original: 'di ltar yang 'jig rten na yang gzugs med pa la blo rtsing ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang 'jig rten na yang gzugs med pa la blo rtsing ngo //
translated: For, in the world, the mind is said to be coarse in the formless realm.

original: blo zhib po zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa snang ngo //
analyzed: blo zhib po zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa snang ngo //
translated: The mind is said to be subtle in the form realm.

original: bstan bcos las kyang rnam par shes pa rtsing ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang rnam par shes pa rtsing ngo //
translated: In the treatises, consciousness is said to be coarse in the desire realm.

original: zhib po zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhib po zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: It is said to be subtle in the form realm.🔽In two ways, it is also called imagination.

original: gnyis su na kun du rtog pa zhes kyang bya ste zhes bya ba ni gnyis su na kun du rtog pa gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: gnyis su na kun du rtog pa zhes kyang bya ste zhes bya ba ni gnyis su na kun du rtog pa gang yin pa de'o //
translated: In two ways, it is also called imagination.

original: 'du shes nyid rlung yin pas 'du shes kyi rlung ste ;
analyzed: 'du shes nyid rlung yin pas 'du shes kyi rlung ste ;
translated: The wind of perception is the wind of the element of wind.

original: 'du shes kyi rlung gis bskyod nas 'jug pa gang yin pa de 'du shes kyi rlung gis bskyod nas 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi rlung gis bskyod nas 'jug pa gang yin pa de 'du shes kyi rlung gis bskyod nas 'jug pa ste /
translated: The wind of perception moves it, and it moves in the form of the wind of perception.

original: 'du shes kyis btang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'du shes kyis btang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is moved by the wind of perception, which means it is sent by perception.

original: 'du shes kyi yul gyi mtshan ma yongs su bcad nas rnam par rtog pa sems yul la gtong bar nus so //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi yul gyi mtshan ma yongs su bcad nas rnam par rtog pa sems yul la gtong bar nus so //
translated: Having determined the sign of the object of perception, one is able to direct the conceptual mind to the object.

original: tshogs ni 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs ni 'dus pa ste /
translated: An aggregate is a collection.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gi tshogs ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga po dag gi tshogs ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga ste /
translated: The five aggregates of consciousness are the five aggregates of consciousness.

original: de dag ni rtsing ba yang yin la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga yang yin pas rnam par shes pa rtsing ba'i tshogs lnga ste /
analyzed: de dag ni rtsing ba yang yin la rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga yang yin pas rnam par shes pa rtsing ba'i tshogs lnga ste /
translated: They are both gross and the five aggregates of consciousness, thus they are the five gross aggregates of consciousness.

original: de dag gi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu'o //
translated: They are the cause of those.

original: de dang ldan na de dag rtsing ngo zhes bya bar brjod do//
analyzed: de dang ldan na de dag rtsing ngo zhes bya bar brjod do//
translated: When one possesses them, one is said to be gross.

original: sems zhib pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems zhib pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba la /
translated: The characteristic of the subtlety of mind.

original: zhib pa'i dngos po ni zhib pa nyid de /
analyzed: zhib pa'i dngos po ni zhib pa nyid de /
translated: Subtlety is the state of being subtle.

original: sems kyi zhib pa nyid ni sems zhib pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems kyi zhib pa nyid ni sems zhib pa nyid do //
translated: The subtlety of mind is the subtlety of mind.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni sems zhib pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni sems zhib pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de'o //
translated: That which is the characteristic of that is the characteristic of the subtlety of mind.

original: de la zhib pa nyid ni mi gsal ba mi rno ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhib pa nyid ni mi gsal ba mi rno ba'o //
translated: Therein, subtlety is indistinctness and dullness.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa dang mthun pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa mthun pa'o //🔽mthun pa ni mi 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa dang mthun pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i 'jug pa mthun pa'o // mthun pa ni mi 'gal ba ste /
translated: That which is compatible with the activity of the mental consciousness is compatible with the activity of the mental consciousness.🔽Compatibility means non-contradiction.

original: gags byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gags byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means not obstructing.

original: 'dis rnam par dpyod pa'i yul la yang dpyod do //
analyzed: 'dis rnam par dpyod pa'i yul la yang dpyod do //
translated: This analyzes the object of analysis.

original: bag med pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams mi bsgom pa ste zhes bya ba ni bag yod @255a * //
analyzed: bag med pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams mi bsgom pa ste zhes bya ba ni bag yod @255a * //
translated: Negligence is not cultivating virtuous dharmas.

original: pa ma yin pas bag med pa ste /
analyzed: pa ma yin pas bag med pa ste /
translated: Negligence is not being heedful.

original: gang dang ldan pas dge ba'i chos la kun du bsten pa zad par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang ldan pas dge ba'i chos la kun du bsten pa zad par byed pa'o //
translated: It is that by which one destroys the cultivation of virtuous dharmas.

original: don de nyid mi 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ston to //
analyzed: don de nyid mi 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o zhes bya bas ston to //
translated: This very meaning is shown by the phrase the meaning of not engaging.

original: de la bdag la phan pa la mngon par mi brtson zhing yal bar 'dor ba ni bag med pa ste /
analyzed: de la bdag la phan pa la mngon par mi brtson zhing yal bar 'dor ba ni bag med pa ste /
translated: Among those, not striving for one's own benefit and abandoning it is negligence.

original: rang la phan pa ni dge ba'i chos goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang la phan pa ni dge ba'i chos goms par byed pa'o //
translated: One's own benefit is cultivating virtuous dharmas.

original: de la mngon par mi brtson pa ni de la mi gzhol ba ste yal bar 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: de la mngon par mi brtson pa ni de la mi gzhol ba ste yal bar 'dor ba'o //
translated: Not striving for that is not applying oneself to it, abandoning it.

original: gang yod na de 'byung ba de ni bag med pa'o //
analyzed: gang yod na de 'byung ba de ni bag med pa'o //
translated: That which exists when this exists is heedlessness.

original: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa ste zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: bag yod pa ni dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa ste zhes bya ba de la /
translated: Heedfulness is the cultivation of virtuous qualities.

original: 'di yod na bag med par mi byed pas bag yod pa ste ;
analyzed: 'di yod na bag med par mi byed pas bag yod pa ste ;
translated: When this exists, one does not act heedlessly, so it is heedfulness.

original: dge ba'i nor bsrung ba'i phyir gang gis 'jug par 'gyur ba de bag yod pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i nor bsrung ba'i phyir gang gis 'jug par 'gyur ba de bag yod pa'o //
translated: It is heedfulness because it is that by which one enters into the protection of the wealth of virtue.

original: bag med pa'i phyir 'jil ba zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bag med pa'i phyir 'jil ba zhes bya ba ni gnyen po'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The antidote to heedlessness is called disgust, which means to be ashamed of.

original: skyo ba ni 'khor ba'i nyes pa la rtogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: skyo ba ni 'khor ba'i nyes pa la rtogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Disgust is the realization of the faults of cyclic existence.

original: 'khor ba'i nyes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / rga shi dang mya ngan la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nyes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / rga shi dang mya ngan la sogs pa ste /
translated: The faults of cyclic existence are desire, etc., and old age, death, sorrow, etc.

original: de dag la rtog pa ni 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la rtog pa ni 'byed pa'o //
translated: The realization of these is the discernment of them.

original: de bas na gang skyo ba de 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthun te /
analyzed: de bas na gang skyo ba de 'dod chags dang bral ba dang mthun te /
translated: Therefore, disgust is conducive to freedom from desire.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyur gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyur gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the cause of freedom from desire.

original: yid byung na mi chags so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid byung na mi chags so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, When one is disgusted, one is not attached.

original: de nyid rnam par grol ba'i phyir sems las byung ba'i chos gang byung na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: de nyid rnam par grol ba'i phyir sems las byung ba'i chos gang byung na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: Because of that very liberation, he says, “whatever mental factors arise.

original: gang dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni gang dang 'brel pas so //
analyzed: gang dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni gang dang 'brel pas so //
translated: ” “Endowed with” means connected with.

original: yid 'byung ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni yid 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid 'byung ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni yid 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: “Mental attention directed to renunciation” means mental attention that is associated with renunciation.

original: rab tu dga' ba ni mgu ba dang mchog tu dga' ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba ni mgu ba dang mchog tu dga' ba ste /
translated: “Joy” is satisfaction and supreme joy.

original: dge ba'i sems la gnod pa las byung bar gnyen po tshol ba can no //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems la gnod pa las byung bar gnyen po tshol ba can no //
translated: It is the search for the antidote that arises from the harm to a virtuous mind.

original: de rnyed nas de la yid tshim pa gang yin pa de ni mchog tu dga' ba'o zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: de rnyed nas de la yid tshim pa gang yin pa de ni mchog tu dga' ba'o zhes bya ba de la /
translated: When that is found, the satisfaction of the mind with regard to that is supreme joy.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir gnod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir gnod pa ste /
translated: The desire realm is harm because it is the basis of all suffering.

original: de las byung ba ni 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni 'dor ba'o //
translated: That which arises from it is to be abandoned.

original: 'byung ba'i gnyen po ni gnod par byed pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i gnyen po ni gnod par byed pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The antidote to arising is the side that harms,

original: 'dor ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dor ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which is to say, the cause of abandonment.

original: de ni lam mo //
analyzed: de ni lam mo //
translated: That is the path.

original: gnyen po tshol ba can gyi ngang tshul can gang yin pa de ni gnyen po tshol ba can no //
analyzed: gnyen po tshol ba can gyi ngang tshul can gang yin pa de ni gnyen po tshol ba can no //
translated: One who is of the nature of seeking the antidote is one who seeks the antidote.

original: gnyen po tshol ba can des de rnyed nas zhes bya ba'i rnyed pa ni thob pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po tshol ba can des de rnyed nas zhes bya ba'i rnyed pa ni thob pa ste /
translated: Having found that antidote, the attainment is the obtainment of that path.

original: lam de rnyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lam de rnyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is the meaning of having found the path.🔽When one has found that path, the arising of complete satisfaction of the mind is supreme joy.

original: de la lam de @255b rnyed nas yid yongs su tshim pa skye ba gang yin pa de mchog tu dga' ba ste de dang ldan pas yid bde ba dang bral ba mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa la mchog tu dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes🔽bya'o // de la rab tu dga' ba ni mgu ba zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba ni yid bde ba ste /
analyzed: de la lam de @255b rnyed nas yid yongs su tshim pa skye ba gang yin pa de mchog tu dga' ba ste de dang ldan pas yid bde ba dang bral ba mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa la mchog tu dga' ba yid la byed pa zhes bya'o // de la rab tu dga' ba ni mgu ba zhes bya ba la rab tu dga' ba ni yid bde ba ste /
translated: One who possesses that is one who has applied attention to supreme joy.🔽Supreme joy is delight.

original: de dang lhan cig skyes pa ni mgu ba dang rangs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig skyes pa ni mgu ba dang rangs pa'o //
translated: That which is innate with that is satisfaction and delight.

original: yang de ni rnam grangs su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: yang de ni rnam grangs su brjod pa'o //
translated: That is also expressed in a different way.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba la las dang mthun pa ni las su rung ba'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa ni sems las su rung ba nyid do zhes bya ba la las dang mthun pa ni las su rung ba'o //
translated: Serviceability is the ability to act.

original: las su rung ba'i dngos po ni las su rung ba nyid do //🔽sems kyi las su rung ba nyid ni sems las su rung ba nyid de /
analyzed: las su rung ba'i dngos po ni las su rung ba nyid do // sems kyi las su rung ba nyid ni sems las su rung ba nyid de /
translated: The state of being serviceable is serviceability.🔽The serviceability of mind is the serviceability of mind.

original: sems 'os su gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: sems 'os su gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is the ability of mind to act.

original: gser dul ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gser dul ma bzhin no //
translated: It is like refined gold.

original: dper na gser dul ma ni ci dang cir brdung ba de dang der las su rung ba yin no //
analyzed: dper na gser dul ma ni ci dang cir brdung ba de dang der las su rung ba yin no //
translated: For example, refined gold can be made into any ornament.

original: de bzhin du shin tu sbyangs pa'i dbang gis ma tho ris dang thar pa la sogs pa gang dang gang du sems sbyor ba de dang der dgos pa sgrub par nus pa'i phyir las su rung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shin tu sbyangs pa'i dbang gis ma tho ris dang thar pa la sogs pa gang dang gang du sems sbyor ba de dang der dgos pa sgrub par nus pa'i phyir las su rung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: In the same way, by the power of pliancy, the mind is able to act in any way whatsoever, such as in the realms of desire and form, and in liberation, etc. Therefore, it is called serviceability.

original: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa la mngon par dga' ba dang mi mthun pa sems bzang po nyid de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam par mi 'tshe ba ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa la mngon par dga' ba dang mi mthun pa sems bzang po nyid de zhes bya ba la /
translated: Nonviolence is the goodness of mind that is incompatible with delighting in harming others.

original: gzhan dag la gnod par byed pa ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la gnod par byed pa ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: Causing harm to others means harming others.

original: gzhan la gnod par byed pa dag la mngon par dga' ba ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa la mngon par dga' ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod par byed pa dag la mngon par dga' ba ni gzhan la gnod par byed pa la mngon par dga' ba ste /
translated: Taking delight in causing harm to others means taking delight in harming others.

original: de dang mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa'o //
translated: That is incompatible with it.

original: gang gi dbang gis gzhan la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnod par mi byed mi mthun par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis gzhan la rnam par tho mi 'tshams pa'o zhes bya ba ni gnod par mi byed mi mthun par mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By the power of which one does not harm others means one does not harm, one does not act contrary to.

original: de las 'byung bar gnyen po tshol ba can ni de dang mi mthun pa'i sems bzang po nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de las 'byung bar gnyen po tshol ba can ni de dang mi mthun pa'i sems bzang po nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The one who seeks the antidote to that is called the one with a good mind that is incompatible with that.

original: rigs pa la gzhol ba ni rigs pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa la gzhol ba ni rigs pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Inclined toward reason means in accordance with reason.

original: rigs pa ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: rigs pa ni 'phags pa'i lam mo //
translated: Reason is the noble path.

original: de la gzhol ba ni der gzhol ba ste /
analyzed: de la gzhol ba ni der gzhol ba ste /
translated: Inclined toward that is inclined toward that.

original: der phyogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: der phyogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is the meaning of directed toward that.

original: de ni bdag gi dbang du byas pa dang / chos kyi dbang du byas pa las byung bas bdag dang chos kyi dbang du byas pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bdag gi dbang du byas pa dang / chos kyi dbang du byas pa las byung bas bdag dang chos kyi dbang du byas pa las byung ba'o //
translated: It is from the perspective of the self and from the perspective of the Dharma, so it is from the perspective of the self and the Dharma.

original: de la bdag ces bya ba ni rang gi rgyud yongs su bzung ba'o //
analyzed: de la bdag ces bya ba ni rang gi rgyud yongs su bzung ba'o //
translated: Here, the self is the complete grasping of one’s own continuum.

original: bdag gi chos rnams ni bdag gi yon tan rnams te tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi chos rnams ni bdag gi yon tan rnams te tshul khrims la sogs pa'o //
translated: One’s dharmas are one’s qualities, such as morality and so on.

original: de dag gi dbang du byas pa ni bdag gi chos kyi dbang du byas pa ste @256a * //
analyzed: de dag gi dbang du byas pa ni bdag gi chos kyi dbang du byas pa ste @256a * //
translated: From the perspective of those, it is from the perspective of the self and the Dharma.

original: dbang du byas pa ni nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang du byas pa ni nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: From the perspective means from the power.

original: de las byung ba ni bdag dang chos kyi dbang du byas pa las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de las byung ba ni bdag dang chos kyi dbang du byas pa las byung ba ste /
translated: It arises from that, so it is from the perspective of the self and the Dharma.

original: mdo sde las ji skad du bstan pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: mdo sde las ji skad du bstan pa lta bu ste /
translated: It is as stated in the sūtras:

original: bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas nas mi dge ba spong zhing dge ba sgom pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dbang du byas nas mi dge ba spong zhing dge ba sgom pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: From the perspective of the self, one abandons nonvirtue and cultivates virtue.

original: yang na bdag gi chos ni rigs kyi bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag gi chos ni rigs kyi bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or else, one’s Dharma is a son of noble family and so on.

original: ji ltar bdag gi chos las byung ba smras pa /🔽gang gi phyir bdag ni rigs kyi bur 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi chos las byung ba smras pa / gang gi phyir bdag ni rigs kyi bur 'gyur te /
translated: As for the statement that it arises from the Dharma,🔽it is because of the Dharma that one becomes a son of the Victorious One.

original: 'phags pa'i chos kyis de sgrub pa la mi phyogs pa ni bdag gi cha ma yin no snyam mo //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i chos kyis de sgrub pa la mi phyogs pa ni bdag gi cha ma yin no snyam mo //
translated: It is not right for me to turn away from the practice of the Dharma.

original: sred pa ni mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa ni mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: Craving is attachment.

original: sred pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni rgyu mthun pa ste /
analyzed: sred pa'i rgyu las byung ba ni rgyu mthun pa ste /
translated: What arises from the cause of craving is concordant with craving.

original: sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: It is concordant with craving.

original: sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa de ni ngo tsha mi shes pa zhes bya /
analyzed: sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa de ni ngo tsha mi shes pa zhes bya /
translated: That which is concordant with craving is called shamelessness.

original: de dang mi mthun pa ni de kun du 'byung ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mi mthun pa ni de kun du 'byung ba dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is incompatible with that, because it is incompatible with the arising of that.

original: sems kyi dbang ste zhes bya ba ni sems la dbang byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi dbang ste zhes bya ba ni sems la dbang byed pa'o //
translated: It is the power of the mind, because it controls the mind.

original: de'i byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach its activity, which is its own nature,

original: gang gi dbang gis yon tan rnams dang yon tan can rnams la gus pa dang bcas par gnas pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis yon tan rnams dang yon tan can rnams la gus pa dang bcas par gnas pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “It is the respect with which one abides toward virtues and those who possess virtues.”

original: yon tan can rnams ni rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa tshul khrims la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: yon tan can rnams ni rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa tshul khrims la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Those who have good qualities are those who are related to their causes, such as morality.

original: yon tan can rnams ni slob dpon dang mkhan po la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: yon tan can rnams ni slob dpon dang mkhan po la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Those who have good qualities are teachers, preceptors, etc.

original: khrel yod pa ni yon tan la goms par byed pa sngon du gtong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la goms par byed pas goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: khrel yod pa ni yon tan la goms par byed pa sngon du gtong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la goms par byed pas goms par byed pa'o //
translated: Shame is the prior practice of cultivating good qualities.

original: yon tan can rnams goms par gang byed pa ni /
analyzed: yon tan can rnams goms par gang byed pa ni /
translated: Those who have good qualities are those who cultivate.

original: yon tan goms par byed pa sngon du gtong ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan goms par byed pa sngon du gtong ba'o //
translated: The prior practice of cultivating good qualities is shame.

original: gti mug ni mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug ni mi shes pa'o //
translated: Delusion is ignorance.

original: de'i rgyu mthun pa ni khrel med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa ni khrel med pa ste /
translated: Its outflow is shamelessness.

original: rmongs par gyur na srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba dag la 'jug pas khrel med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmongs par gyur na srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i bya ba dag la 'jug pas khrel med par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is deluded, one engages in killing, etc., and becomes shameless.

original: de'i dgrar gyur pas chos ngan pa la smod de /
analyzed: de'i dgrar gyur pas chos ngan pa la smod de /
translated: Since it is the enemy of that, it reproaches bad dharmas.

original: chos ngan pa dag ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos ngan pa dag ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Bad dharmas are killing, etc.

original: de dag la spyod pa ni bshung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag la spyod pa ni bshung ba'o //
translated: Conduct in those is blameworthy.

original: gang yod na zhes bya ba ni chos gang skyes na kha na ma tho ba ste sdig pa la 'jigs par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: gang yod na zhes bya ba ni chos gang skyes na kha na ma tho ba ste sdig pa la 'jigs par lta ba yin no //
translated: When it exists, one sees danger in even the slightest fault.

original: btang snyoms ni mi rigs pa yang mi sel bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi rigs pa sel ba dang rigs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir de mi rigs pa sel ba ni brtson 'grus kyi byed pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni mi rigs pa yang mi sel bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mi rigs pa sel ba dang rigs pa la 'jug pa'i phyir de mi rigs pa sel ba ni brtson 'grus kyi byed pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is the absence of the removal of what is improper, etc. The function of vigor is the removal of what is improper and the engagement in what is proper.

original: rigs pa la 'jug pa yang brtson 'grus kyi byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: rigs pa la 'jug pa yang brtson 'grus kyi byed pa nyid do //
translated: The engagement in what is proper is also the function of vigor.

original: de la @256b btang snyoms su byed pa ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: de la @256b btang snyoms su byed pa ni btang snyoms so //
translated: The state of equanimity with regard to those is equanimity.

original: btang snyoms zhes bya ba'i chos de yod pas sems de btang snyoms dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms zhes bya ba'i chos de yod pas sems de btang snyoms dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the dharma called equanimity exists, the mind is said to be accompanied by equanimity.

original: btang snyoms ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Equanimity is threefold:

original: tshad med pa'i btang snyoms ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa'i btang snyoms ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The equanimity of the immeasurables is as follows:

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: loving-kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: de la byams pa ni bde ba nye bar sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la byams pa ni bde ba nye bar sgrub pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Among them, loving-kindness has the characteristic of establishing happiness.

original: snying rje ni sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje ni sdug bsngal ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Compassion is the aspect of suffering.

original: dga' ba ni dga' bar gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni dga' bar gyur cig pa'o //
translated: Sympathetic joy is the aspect of joy.

original: btang snyoms ni sems can gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms ni sems can gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: Equanimity is the aspect of sentient beings.

original: tshor ba'i btang snyoms ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: tshor ba'i btang snyoms ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: The equanimity of feeling is the feeling that is neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: 'di ni 'du byed kyi btang snyoms te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'du byed kyi btang snyoms te /
translated: This is the equanimity of volition.

original: de nyid 'du byed kyi btang snyoms nyid du ston to //
analyzed: de nyid 'du byed kyi btang snyoms nyid du ston to //
translated: It is taught to be the equanimity of volition.

original: de yod pas mi rigs pa yang mi sel rigs pa la yang mi 'jug ces bya ba 'dis ni btang snyoms kyi las ston to //
analyzed: de yod pas mi rigs pa yang mi sel rigs pa la yang mi 'jug ces bya ba 'dis ni btang snyoms kyi las ston to //
translated: Because of its existence, one does not remove what is improper and one does not engage in what is proper. This shows the activity of equanimity.🔽It is the state of equilibrium through the principle of the balance.

original: srang 'dzin pa'i rigs pas mnyam pa nyid du gnas pa'o zhes bya bas srang 'dzin pas srang 'dzin pa'i skyes bu ste /
analyzed: srang 'dzin pa'i rigs pas mnyam pa nyid du gnas pa'o zhes bya bas srang 'dzin pas srang 'dzin pa'i skyes bu ste /
translated: The person who holds the balance is the one who holds the balance.

original: srang drang por gyur pa ni rdzas snon pa dang 'bri ba mi byed kyi /
analyzed: srang drang por gyur pa ni rdzas snon pa dang 'bri ba mi byed kyi /
translated: The straight balance does not add or subtract any substance.

original: btang snyoms 'ba' zhig tu byed pa de bzhin du btang snyoms su byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: btang snyoms 'ba' zhig tu byed pa de bzhin du btang snyoms su byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is only equanimous. In the same way, equanimity is made. This is the meaning.

original: dper na ba lang rdzis ba langs nar mi bde ba las blan te sa nar bde bar rgyu zhing dong ba la yal bar 'jog pa ltar btang snyoms kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na ba lang rdzis ba langs nar mi bde ba las blan te sa nar bde bar rgyu zhing dong ba la yal bar 'jog pa ltar btang snyoms kyang de bzhin te /
translated: For example, when a cowherd has led his cows to pasture in a safe place, he relaxes and lets them graze.

original: brtson 'grus kyis sdig pa las sems blan nas rigs pa la rgyu ba na btang snyoms su 'jog ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis sdig pa las sems blan nas rigs pa la rgyu ba na btang snyoms su 'jog ste /
translated: Similarly, equanimity is when the mind has been led away from evil by effort and is set to move in a wholesome direction.

original: mthun pa la gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthun pa la gnas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said to be “settled in a wholesome state,”🔽The three roots of wholesomeness are nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum ste zhes bya ba la ku sha zhes bya ba ni shes rab bo //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum ste zhes bya ba la ku sha zhes bya ba ni shes rab bo //
translated: The word kuśa means wisdom.

original: la ni de 'dzin pa ste shes rab 'dzin pa ni dge ba'o //
analyzed: la ni de 'dzin pa ste shes rab 'dzin pa ni dge ba'o //
translated: The root kuśa means to grasp, and the grasping of wisdom is wholesome.

original: de la ma chags pa ni yo byad dang lus dang skye ba la mngon par ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma chags pa ni yo byad dang lus dang skye ba la mngon par ma chags pa'o //
translated: Nonattachment is the nonattachment to possessions, the body, and rebirth.

original: ma rig pa dang mi mdza' ba la sogs pa lta bu'i dngos po yin gyi chags pa med pa tsam ni ma chags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang mi mdza' ba la sogs pa lta bu'i dngos po yin gyi chags pa med pa tsam ni ma chags pa ma yin no //
translated: Nonattachment is a thing that is like nondelusion, nonhatred, and nonattachment, and not just the mere absence of attachment.

original: dge ba gzhan rnams te dad pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu'i dngos po yin pas rtsa bar gyur ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba gzhan rnams te dad pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'i rgyu'i dngos po yin pas rtsa bar gyur ces bya ba'o //
translated: The other virtues, such as faith, are the things that are the causes of its arising. Therefore, it is called the root.

original: bde ba'i don ni dge ba'i don te /
analyzed: bde ba'i don ni dge ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning of “good” is the meaning of “virtue.”

original: dper na dge bar 'ongs pa la bde bar 'ongs par shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dge bar 'ongs pa la bde bar 'ongs par shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like knowing that someone who has come in a good way has come well.

original: bde ba de yang srid pa'i yid du 'ong ba dang / thar pa'i myu gu mngon par 'grub par byed pas zhes bya bar ston to//
analyzed: bde ba de yang srid pa'i yid du 'ong ba dang / thar pa'i myu gu mngon par 'grub par byed pas zhes bya bar ston to//
translated: That good is also shown to be the cause of the arising of the sprout of liberation.

original: @257a * // srid pa yid du 'ong ba ni lha dang mir skye ba'o //
analyzed: @257a * // srid pa yid du 'ong ba ni lha dang mir skye ba'o //
translated: The good of existence is being born as a god or human.

original: thar pa'i myu gu zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'phangs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i myu gu zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa 'phangs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The sprout of liberation is that which is projected by the causes that are conducive to liberation.

original: 'phangs pa de'i rtags brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'phangs pa de'i rtags brjod par bya ste /
translated: The sign of that which is projected should be stated.

original: gang dam pa'i chos thos nas mchi ma 'byung ba dang spu zing zhes byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang dam pa'i chos thos nas mchi ma 'byung ba dang spu zing zhes byed pa'o //
translated: When one hears the true Dharma, tears come forth and one’s body hair stands on end.🔽Or else, the good is called the pure.

original: yang na byang ba la dge ba zhes bya'o //🔽'grub pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang na byang ba la dge ba zhes bya'o // 'grub pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is also the cause of the arising of the sprout of liberation.

original: gzugs bzang po ni mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs bzang po ni mdzes pa ste /
translated: The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of existence.🔽The good of existence is the cause of the arising of the sprout of

original: ji skad du bzod pas mdzes par 'gyur zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bzod pas mdzes par 'gyur zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is said, “One becomes beautiful through patience.”

original: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i srid pa rnam pa lnga ni /
analyzed: de la 'dod par gtogs pa'i srid pa rnam pa lnga ni /
translated: Among them, the five types of existence belonging to the desire realm are

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams so //
translated: those to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, path, and by cultivation.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Those belonging to the desire realm are associated with the desire realm.

original: khong khro ba lnga ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang bsgom pas spong bar bya ba'i zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: khong khro ba lnga ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba dang bsgom pas spong bar bya ba'i zhe sdang ngo //
translated: The five types of anger are the hatred to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, etc., and by cultivation.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa sum cu rtsa drug 'og nas 'byung ba de dag dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa las 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i gti mug ma gtogs pa gzhan ma rig pa sum cu rtsa bzhi po gang yin pa de
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa sum cu rtsa drug 'og nas 'byung ba de dag dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa las 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i gti mug ma gtogs pa gzhan ma rig pa sum cu rtsa bzhi po gang yin pa de
translated: The thirty-four ignorances other than the delusion of the afflicted views of the aggregates and the extremes, which are associated with the thirty-six afflictions of the desire realm mentioned above,

original: ni gti mug go //
analyzed: ni gti mug go //
translated: are delusion.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i sred pa rnam pa bcu ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa'i sred pa rnam pa bcu ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba'i bye brag gis so //
translated: The ten types of craving belonging to the realms of form and the formless are due to the specific distinctions of the vision of suffering, etc.

original: de na 'byung ba ni de na yod pa ste /
analyzed: de na 'byung ba ni de na yod pa ste /
translated: The arising of these is their existence there.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of belonging to the realms of form and the formless.

original: de dag ni 'og nas 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'og nas 'chad pa'o //
translated: These will be explained later.

original: der gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: der gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa nyid de /
translated: The phrase belonging to these refers to belonging to the realms of form and the formless.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba'i bye brag gis nga rgyal rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong ba'i bye brag gis nga rgyal rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: The ten types of pride are due to the specific distinctions of the vision of suffering, etc.

original: 'dir 'byung ba ni 'di na yod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir 'byung ba ni 'di na yod pa ste /
translated: The arising of these is their existence here.

original: 'dod par gtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of belonging to the desire realm.

original: de la kha cig na re khengs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir mtho bar 'gro ba ni nga rgyal yin la /
analyzed: de la kha cig na re khengs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phyir mtho bar 'gro ba ni nga rgyal yin la /
translated: In this regard, some believe that the going of the elevated is pride because it has the characteristic of haughtiness.

original: rtsa ba ni brtan pa dang thur du zug pa yin na rtsa ba dang mi mthun pa'i chos kyi phyir nga rgyal ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba yin no zhes zer ba de'i phyir nga rgyal yang lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba nyid du bsgrub🔽par 'dod nas /
analyzed: rtsa ba ni brtan pa dang thur du zug pa yin na rtsa ba dang mi mthun pa'i chos kyi phyir nga rgyal ni lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba yin no zhes zer ba de'i phyir nga rgyal yang lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba nyid du bsgrub par 'dod nas /
translated: In order to prove that pride is the root of the neutral,

original: bsam gtan pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: he says, because there are three contemplatives.

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan pa gsum ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan pa gsum ni /
translated: Thus, there are three contemplatives:🔽those who are contemplatives with a predominance of craving,

original: sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa @257b ste zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sred pa dang / lta ba dang / nga rgyal gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa @257b ste zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: those who are contemplatives with a predominance of view, and those who are contemplatives with a predominance of pride.

original: sred pa'i shas che ba'i bsam gtan la bsam gtan du byed pa'i ngang tshul can de dag ni sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ste /
analyzed: sred pa'i shas che ba'i bsam gtan la bsam gtan du byed pa'i ngang tshul can de dag ni sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa ste /
translated: Those who are of the nature of contemplatives who are contemplatives with a predominance of craving are contemplatives with a predominance of craving.

original: sred pa la gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sred pa la gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the same as saying they abide in craving.

original: lta ba dang nga rgyal gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: lta ba dang nga rgyal gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: Those who are contemplatives with a predominance of view and those who are contemplatives with a predominance of pride should be explained in the same way.

original: kun du sbyor ba ni rnam pa dgu ste zhes bya ba ni de dag gis sems can rnams khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas rnams su kun du sbyor bas kun du sbyor ba rnams so //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba ni rnam pa dgu ste zhes bya ba ni de dag gis sems can rnams khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas rnams su kun du sbyor bas kun du sbyor ba rnams so //
translated: They are fetters because they fetter sentient beings to the realms, destinies, and birth processes.

original: yang na de dag yod na sdug bsngal gyi bye brag de dang de dag dang kun du sbyor bas kun du sbyor ba rnams te /
analyzed: yang na de dag yod na sdug bsngal gyi bye brag de dang de dag dang kun du sbyor bas kun du sbyor ba rnams te /
translated: Or, they are fetters because one is fettered to the various kinds of suffering when they exist.

original: de dag sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'dis yul de la rjes su chags par byed pas rjes su chags pa ste /
analyzed: de dag sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro // rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'dis yul de la rjes su chags par byed pas rjes su chags pa ste /
translated: They are the basis of all suffering.🔽The fetter of attachment is so called because it causes attachment to an object.

original: kun du 'byar kun du chags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun du 'byar kun du chags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for “adherence” and “attachment.”

original: khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i 'dod chags te /
translated: It is the desire for the three realms.

original: gnas dang dmigs pas so //
analyzed: gnas dang dmigs pas so //
translated: It is so called because it is the basis and the object.

original: rgya skyegs zhu ba 'byar ba lta bu zhes bya ba ni rgya skyegs zhub ltar 'byar zhing kun du sbyor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgya skyegs zhu ba 'byar ba lta bu zhes bya ba ni rgya skyegs zhub ltar 'byar zhing kun du sbyor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is like the adherence of a stain, that is, it is a synonym for “adherence” and “attachment.”

original: sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa //
analyzed: sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems pa //
translated: It is the complete hostility toward sentient beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams dang mi mthun pa'i 'du shes can te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams dang mi mthun pa'i 'du shes can te /
translated: It is the perception of sentient beings as being disagreeable.

original: de dag dang bral bar 'dod pa dang ldan pa sems mi chog pa ni khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: de dag dang bral bar 'dod pa dang ldan pa sems mi chog pa ni khong khro ba'o //
translated: It is the desire to be free of them. It is the inflated mind that is not satisfied. It is hostility.

original: de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid de rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid de rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: It is the five types that occur in the realm of desire.

original: 'dis gnod par byed pa 'am //
analyzed: 'dis gnod par byed pa 'am //
translated: It is that which injures or

original: 'di yod pas na kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yod pas na kun nas mnar sems pa'o //
translated: it is that on account of which there is complete hostility.

original: tsha ba'i sa bon lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tsha ba'i sa bon lta bu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is like a hot seed.

original: de tsha ba yang yin la sa bon yang yin pas tsha ba'i sa bon te /
analyzed: de tsha ba yang yin la sa bon yang yin pas tsha ba'i sa bon te /
translated: It is a hot seed because it is both hot and a seed.

original: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pas de dang 'dra'o //🔽bdag dang gzhan la dmigs nas zhes bya ba ni kun du gti mug pas yod pa dang med pa la gnas pa sngon la btang te /
analyzed: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pas de dang 'dra'o // bdag dang gzhan la dmigs nas zhes bya ba ni kun du gti mug pas yod pa dang med pa la gnas pa sngon la btang te /
translated: It is like that because it is the nature of injury.🔽It is the inflation of the mind that occurs in relation to oneself and others.🔽It is the inflation of the mind that occurs in relation to oneself and others, having previously generated the view of existence or nonexistence through complete delusion.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi khyad par la ltos nas sems khengs pa ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi khyad par la ltos nas sems khengs pa ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: It is pride.

original: skyes bu rengs pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni dper na rlung la sogs pas rengs par 'gyur ba'i skyes bus sgu mi nus pa de bzhin du nga rgyal gyi dbang gis bla ma rnams la mi 'dud pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu rengs pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni dper na rlung la sogs pas rengs par 'gyur ba'i skyes bus sgu mi nus pa de bzhin du nga rgyal gyi dbang gis bla ma rnams la mi 'dud pa'o //
translated: The person who is paralyzed is like a person who is paralyzed by wind, etc. and is unable to move. Likewise, through the power of pride, one does not bow down to the gurus.

original: de yang phye na rnam pa du yod ce na /
analyzed: de yang phye na rnam pa du yod ce na /
translated: Moreover, if one asks, how many kinds of pride are there?

original: de'i grangs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i grangs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach their number, he says:

original: rnam pa bdun te zhes bya ba smos so //🔽bdag tu lta ba'i rjes las @258a * //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun te zhes bya ba smos so // bdag tu lta ba'i rjes las @258a * //
translated: There are seven kinds.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du btang ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du btang ba ste /
translated: Arisen from the view of self means preceded by the view of the transitory collection.

original: bdag yod pa nyid du sdug pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag yod pa nyid du sdug pa la sogs pa'i rnam par sems khengs pa'o //
translated: The mind is inflated with the thought that the self is beautiful, etc.

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal de yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang yul gcig ste /
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal de yang 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang yul gcig ste /
translated: Moreover, that pride which thinks I am has the same object as the view of the transitory collection.

original: gnyi ga'i yul yang bdag yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i yul yang bdag yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the object of both is the self.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa dang /
translated: The phrase “the fruit of stream-entry, etc.” includes the fruit of the once-returner, the fruit of the non-returner, and the fruit of the perfected being, the meditative absorptions, the formless meditative attainments,

original: 'phags pa'i lam dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dang / mya ngan las 'das pa bsdu ba'o //
translated: the noble path, and nirvāṇa.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa de nyid gong ma'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa de nyid gong ma'i bye brag ste /
translated: The phrase “the fruit of stream-entry, etc.” refers to the specific types of the higher fruits.

original: de 'thob pa ni rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: de 'thob pa ni rnyed pa'o //
translated: The attainment of these fruits is their acquisition.

original: rigs la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “the family, etc.”

original: rigs ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: rigs ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: The family is that of the householder and that of the monk.

original: sogs pa smos pas ni 'dir bzo dang khrims la sogs pa bsdu pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni 'dir bzo dang khrims la sogs pa bsdu pa'o //
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the family of the artist and the family of the one who is disciplined.

original: khyad par ches 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis chung bar zhes bya bar yang rigs la sogs pa de bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: khyad par ches 'phags pa bas bdag cung zad cig gis chung bar zhes bya bar yang rigs la sogs pa de bzhin du bstan to //
translated: The family is taught as being superior to the other families in that it is the most exalted and the most distinguished.

original: bye brag cher zhugs kyang bye brag cung zad cig gis chung bar lta'i ji ltar chung ba de ltar bdag la mi lta ste de bas cung zad cig gis chung bar lta'o //
analyzed: bye brag cher zhugs kyang bye brag cung zad cig gis chung bar lta'i ji ltar chung ba de ltar bdag la mi lta ste de bas cung zad cig gis chung bar lta'o //
translated: Even if he is superior in some respects, he looks down on those who are slightly inferior in some other respect, not on those who are as inferior as he is.

original: chung ba zhes bya ba 'dir ji ltar khengs pa'i gnas yin zhe na /
analyzed: chung ba zhes bya ba 'dir ji ltar khengs pa'i gnas yin zhe na /
translated: How can this be a ground for pride?

original: sems can gyi phung po 'dod pa mchog rnams pas rnam par chung yang ches mang du rlom sems byed pa ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi phung po 'dod pa mchog rnams pas rnam par chung yang ches mang du rlom sems byed pa ste /
translated: He is very much inferior to the mass of beings who are superior to him, and yet he is proud.

original: 'di ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: 'di ni cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: This is the pride of thinking oneself a little better than one is.

original: yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan yang zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan yang zhes bya ba de la /
translated: Even though he is endowed with what is not a virtue.

original: yon tan gyi dgrar gyur pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa rnams te /
analyzed: yon tan gyi dgrar gyur pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi nyes par spyod pa rnams te /
translated: Bad conduct of body, speech, and mind is the enemy of virtue.

original: yon tan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not a virtue.

original: de dag su la yod pa de ni yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de dag su la yod pa de ni yon tan ma yin pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: He who has it is endowed with what is not a virtue.

original: de ltar gyur kyang bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du rlom sems su byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur kyang bdag yon tan dang ldan no snyam du rlom sems su byed pa'o //
translated: And yet he is proud, thinking himself virtuous.

original: nyes par spyod pa des khengs pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa des khengs pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Arrogance of thinking oneself equal to an inferior.🔽What is the difference between the two, arrogance and false arrogance?

original: bdag la yon tan med bzhin du yod do snyam du sems khengs pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /🔽yon tan 'dra ba'i bag gis khengs pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: bdag la yon tan med bzhin du yod do snyam du sems khengs pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na / yon tan 'dra ba'i bag gis khengs pa ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: Arrogance is the inflation of the mind which thinks oneself equal to an inferior when one is not equal.

original: yon tan med par yon tan du yongs su brtags nas des khengs pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: yon tan med par yon tan du yongs su brtags nas des khengs pa ni log pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: False arrogance is the inflation of the mind which thinks oneself superior to an inferior when one is not.

original: khams gsum pa'i mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni khams @258b gsum la gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i mi shes pa zhes bya ba ni khams @258b gsum la gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: The expression ignorance of the three realms means that the ignorance is located in the three realms.

original: khams gsum la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the three realms are its cognitive object.

original: gzhan du na zag pa med pa'i 'gog pa dang / lam la sogs pa khams su ma lhung ba yin na /
analyzed: gzhan du na zag pa med pa'i 'gog pa dang / lam la sogs pa khams su ma lhung ba yin na /
translated: Otherwise, if the non-falling into the three realms were the cognitive object, then the non-falling into the three realms would be the cessation without remainder of the aggregates, etc.

original: yul de mi shes pa ni 'dir gzung bar mi 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul de mi shes pa ni 'dir gzung bar mi 'gyur ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: And the ignorance which does not have that as its cognitive object would not be ignorance of the non-falling into the three realms.

original: mi rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo mi rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: mi rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo mi rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of non-understanding is the characteristic of non-understanding of the intrinsic nature of entities.

original: de kho na'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa la ma phyogs pa yang dag pa'i don mthong ba'i gags byed pa'i chos so //
analyzed: de kho na'i mtshan nyid khong du chud pa la ma phyogs pa yang dag pa'i don mthong ba'i gags byed pa'i chos so //
translated: It is a phenomenon that obstructs the vision of the correct meaning, which is the penetration of the characteristic of reality.

original: long ba lta bu ste zhes bya ba la lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba la bya ste /
analyzed: long ba lta bu ste zhes bya ba la lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba la bya ste /
translated: Like a blind person. Like means similar.

original: dper na long ba la sa nar bde ba dang mi bde ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i mthu med pa ltar ma rig pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na long ba la sa nar bde ba dang mi bde ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i mthu med pa ltar ma rig pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as a blind person lacks the ability to see what is beautiful or ugly, so it is with ignorance.

original: dgag pa'i gnyen po la gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dgag pa'i gnyen po la gzhag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Because it is the basis for the antidote to cessation, etc.

original: rig pa med pa la ma rig ces bya na ni rdzas med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig pa med pa la ma rig ces bya na ni rdzas med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the absence of knowledge is called ignorance, it would be a non-substance.

original: smad pa'i rig pa la ma rig ces bya na ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: smad pa'i rig pa la ma rig ces bya na ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If contemptible knowledge is called ignorance, it would have the nature of view.

original: de bas na lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would not be concomitant with view.

original: rig pa ma yin pa la bya na ni mig la sogs pa yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rig pa ma yin pa la bya na ni mig la sogs pa yang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not consciousness, then it would follow that the eye, etc. are also consciousness.

original: de bas na mi mthun pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: de bas na mi mthun pa nyid du ston te /
translated: Therefore, it is shown to be contradictory.

original: rig pa la phyir 'jil ba ste /
analyzed: rig pa la phyir 'jil ba ste /
translated: Consciousness is turned away from what is not consciousness.

original: chos ma yin pa dang don ma yin pa dang / mi mdza' ba dang dgos pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang don ma yin pa dang / mi mdza' ba dang dgos pa ma yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like what is not Dharma, what is not meaning, what is not a friend, and what is not a purpose.

original: de bas na dgag pa 'di ni mi mthun pa la snyegs so //
analyzed: de bas na dgag pa 'di ni mi mthun pa la snyegs so //
translated: Therefore, this negation is directed at what is contradictory.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po zhes bya ba de la /
translated: The five appropriating aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: Appropriation is the afflictions.

original: de las byung ba'i phung po rnams ni nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams te de dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i phung po rnams ni nye bar len pa'i phung po rnams te de dag kyang gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The aggregates that arise from that are the appropriating aggregates, and they are form, etc.

original: 'dis ni zag pa med pa'i phung po sel to //🔽bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni zag pa med pa'i phung po sel to // bdag med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang bzhin ma yin pa'o //
translated: This excludes the uncontaminated aggregates.🔽Selfless means not having the nature of a self.

original: bdag gi med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gzhan gyi yo byad du ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi med pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gzhan gyi yo byad du ma gyur pa'o //
translated: Belonging to no-self means not being the property of either a self or another.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i tshogs la lta ba ste nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga yul yin pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i tshogs la lta ba ste nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga yul yin pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The view of the perishable constituents is the view of the perishable constituents, which means that the five appropriating aggregates are its object.

original: bdag yod pa nyid du zhugs su zin kyang de med pa'i phyir bdag tu lta ba zhes ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag yod pa nyid du zhugs su zin kyang de med pa'i phyir bdag tu lta ba zhes ni mi bya'o //
translated: Even though one has entered into the existence of a self, it is not called the view of a self because that does not exist.

original: yul med pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: yul med pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: In order to show that it is not without an object, he says the view of the perishable constituents.

original: de ni 'jig pa yang yin la tshogs kyang yin pas 'jig tshogs te /
analyzed: de ni 'jig pa yang yin la tshogs kyang yin pas 'jig tshogs te /
translated: That is the perishable constituents, because it is perishable and it is a constituent.

original: 'jig pa ni 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Perishable means having the nature of change.

original: tshogs ni 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i tha @259a * //
analyzed: tshogs ni 'dus pa zhes bya ba'i tha @259a * //
translated: Constituent means a collection, which is to say, a multitude.

original: tshig go // yang na yod pa ste du ma yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshig go // yang na yod pa ste du ma yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Alternatively, it means existing, which is to say, existing in many ways.

original: de ni bdag yod pa nyid du zhugs la de ni med pas de'i dmigs pa med par 'gyur du 'ong zhes te de'i don du yod pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni bdag yod pa nyid du zhugs la de ni med pas de'i dmigs pa med par 'gyur du 'ong zhes te de'i don du yod pa smos so //
translated: Since that is the existence of a self and that does not exist, its object would not exist. In order to prevent that, he says the existence of the perishable constituents.

original: de yul yod par gyur na bdag yod par grub po snyam pa de bsal pa'i phyir tshogs zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de yul yod par gyur na bdag yod par grub po snyam pa de bsal pa'i phyir tshogs zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If you think that the self exists because the aggregates exist, then to refute that, he says, “The collection.”

original: bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis lus so so la bdag re re yod par brtags pa dang / lus thams cad la gcig yod par rtogs pas de ni tshogs ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba rnams kyis lus so so la bdag re re yod par brtags pa dang / lus thams cad la gcig yod par rtogs pas de ni tshogs ma yin no //
translated: The self is not the collection because the proponents of a self imagine that each body has a self, and they think that one self exists in all bodies.

original: chad pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ma thob kyi bar du rgyud kyi rgyun rnam par 'jig pas chad pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: chad pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ma thob kyi bar du rgyud kyi rgyun rnam par 'jig pas chad pa ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: “ It is not annihilated” means that it is not annihilated by the destruction of the continuum until the attainment of nirvana without remainder.

original: rtag pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ther zug ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rtag pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni ther zug ma yin pa ste /
translated: “ It is not permanent” means that it is not eternal.

original: skad cig so so la rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig so so la rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is destroyed in each moment.

original: de dag nyid la zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po bdag ces bya bar 'dod pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag nyid la zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po bdag ces bya bar 'dod pa rnams so //
translated: “ In those very things” refers to the five appropriated aggregates, which are accepted as the self.

original: chad pa zhes bya ba ni shi phan chad bdag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes mngon par zhen pa de chad pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: chad pa zhes bya ba ni shi phan chad bdag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes mngon par zhen pa de chad pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.

original: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni ther zug ste /🔽bdag de 'chi ba med kyi de'i phung po rnams ni sbrul gyi pags pa dang 'dra bas des yongs su 'dor ro snyam du sems pas mthar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa zhes bya ba ni ther zug ste / bdag de 'chi ba med kyi de'i phung po rnams ni sbrul gyi pags pa dang 'dra bas des yongs su 'dor ro snyam du sems pas mthar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.

original: de ltar gyur pa la chad pa dang rtag pa'i rnam pa'i blo'i khyad par gang yin pa ni shes rab kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa la chad pa dang rtag pa'i rnam pa'i blo'i khyad par gang yin pa ni shes rab kyi khyad par ro //
translated: ” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.

original: 'di ni thar pa dang mthun pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa ste /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni thar pa dang mthun pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa ste / bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: ” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.

original: 'byung bar ma gyur cig /'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa 'di ni /
analyzed: 'byung bar ma gyur cig /'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa 'di ni /
translated: ” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.

original: phyi rol pa'i lta bar gyur pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol pa'i lta bar gyur pa rnams kyi nang na mchog go zhes gsungs so //
translated: ” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.🔽” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal.

original: mtha' gnyis ni chad pa dang rtag pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis ni chad pa dang rtag pa'i mtha'o //
translated: ” The extreme of eternalism is the belief that “I am eternal

original: las med do zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
