analyzed: las med do zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: The statement “there is no karma” is a denial of the truth of the origin of suffering.

original: las kyi 'bras bu med do zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu med do zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: The statement “there is no result of karma” is a denial of the truth of suffering.

original: thar pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la skur ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la skur ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: The statement “there is no liberation” is a denial of the truth of cessation.

original: de thob par byed pa'i lam yang med do zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i lam yang med do zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: The statement “there is no path that causes its attainment” is a denial of the truth of the path.

original: dngos po yod pa yang dag pa chud gzon pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par yod pa'i bden pa bzhi po yod yang dag pa'i dngos po zhes brjod pa de la skur pa 'debs pa yod yang dag par chud gzon pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa yang dag pa chud gzon pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par yod pa'i bden pa bzhi po yod yang dag pa'i dngos po zhes brjod pa de la skur pa 'debs pa yod yang dag par chud gzon pa'o //
translated: The statement “there is the destruction of what truly exists” is a denial of the four truths that truly exist ultimately, which are called “what truly exists.”

original: lta ba lnga po de dag @259b thams cad kyang log pa nyid yin mod kyi 'di ni yod pa yang dag pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba lnga po de dag @259b thams cad kyang log pa nyid yin mod kyi 'di ni yod pa yang dag pa'i dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: All five views are mistaken, but this is a denial of what truly exists.

original: gzhan ni sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The others are superimpositions.

original: de bas na 'di nyid la log par lta ba zhes brjod de shin tu log par zhugs pas gdol pa sdig can bzhin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di nyid la log par lta ba zhes brjod de shin tu log par zhugs pas gdol pa sdig can bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, it is called a false view, because it is a very false engagement, like a sinful outcast.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la sogs pa la lta ba de dag ni don dam par ni mchog ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la sogs pa la lta ba de dag ni don dam par ni mchog ma yin te /
translated: Among those views, the view of the perishable composite, etc., are not supreme in the ultimate sense,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are contaminated.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni dngos po ngan pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni dngos po ngan pa ste /
translated: The contaminated is a bad thing,

original: spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be abandoned.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni lta ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga ni lta ba'i gnas so //
translated: The five appropriative aggregates are the basis of the view.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra zhig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra zhig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase “grasping at views as supreme” is a contraction, because the word “etc.” is not explicitly stated.

original: lta ba la sogs pa mchog tu 'dzin pa bsdu bar blta'o //
analyzed: lta ba la sogs pa mchog tu 'dzin pa bsdu bar blta'o //
translated: One should understand that it includes grasping at views, etc., as supreme.

original: de bas na lta ba mchog ma yin pa de dag dang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po mchog ma yin pa de dag la mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de bas na lta ba mchog ma yin pa de dag dang nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po mchog ma yin pa de dag la mchog tu 'dzin pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that “grasping at those views that are not supreme as supreme, and at those five appropriative aggregates that are not supreme as supreme.”

original: 'di rnams ji ltar mchog ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di rnams ji ltar mchog ma yin zhe na /
translated: How are they not supreme?

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are to be abandoned by the noble ones.

original: ci'i phyir spang bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir spang bar bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they to be abandoned?

original: sdug bsngal gsum yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽blo'i bye brag gang yin pa ni /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum yod pa'i phyir ro // blo'i bye brag gang yin pa ni /
translated: Because they are the basis of the three kinds of suffering.🔽The difference in their understanding

original: shes rab kyi bye brag gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi bye brag gang yin pa ste /
translated: is the difference in their wisdom.

original: de ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: This is the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices.

original: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni dpyod pa'o //
translated: Reflection is investigation.

original: tshul khrims ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni rgyu'o //
translated: Morality is the cause.

original: brtul zhugs ni lam mo //🔽des na rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur lta /
analyzed: brtul zhugs ni lam mo // des na rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur lta /
translated: Spiritual practices are the path.

original: lam ma yin pa la lam du lta ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lam ma yin pa la lam du lta ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices is the view that what is not a cause is a cause and the view that what is not a path is a path.

original: 'di lta ste dper na dbang phyug dang skyes bu dang / gtso bo dang dus la sogs pa 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin pa de dag la yang rgyu nyid du mthong bas rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur lta ba'o //🔽lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na dbang phyug dang skyes bu dang / gtso bo dang dus la sogs pa 'gro ba'i rgyu ma yin pa de dag la yang rgyu nyid du mthong bas rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur lta ba'o // lam ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: For example, it is like seeing Ishvara, Purusha, Prakriti, time, etc., which are not the cause of the world, as the cause.🔽The path is twofold:

original: mngon par mtho ba'i dang / nges par legs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i dang / nges par legs pa'o //
translated: the path of distinction and the path of definite release.

original: de la me dang chu'i nang du 'jug pa la sogs pa mtho ris kyi lam ma yin pa de dag la yang lam du mthong ba ste /🔽tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de la me dang chu'i nang du 'jug pa la sogs pa mtho ris kyi lam ma yin pa de dag la yang lam du mthong ba ste / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam du zad do //

original: rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i bye brag gis shes pa la sogs pa'i thar pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de dag la yang lam du mthong bas lam ma yin pa la lam du lta'o //🔽tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa bram ze cho ga can gtsang sbra 'dod pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni dper na bram ze cho ga can gtsang sbra 'dod pa la sogs pas gtsang sbra byed pa dag ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyis dag par🔽sems pa @260a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang skyes bu'i bye brag gis shes pa la sogs pa'i thar pa'i rgyu ma yin pa de dag la yang lam du mthong bas lam ma yin pa la lam du lta'o // tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa bram ze cho ga can gtsang sbra 'dod pa lta bu zhes bya ba ni dper na bram ze cho ga can gtsang sbra 'dod pa la sogs pas gtsang sbra byed pa dag ma yin pa'i bdag nyid kyis dag par sems pa @260a * //
translated: They see as the path what is not the path, for they see as the path what is not the path, such as the path of the gods, which is not the path of fire, water, etc.

original: ltar chos de yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ltar chos de yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o //
translated: They see as the path what is not the path, for they see as the path what is not the path, such as the path of the gods, which is not

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bye brag gis lta ba gsum gcig tu bsdus te lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i bye brag gis lta ba gsum gcig tu bsdus te lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba zhes bshad do //
translated: The three views are combined into one, by the distinction of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject, and are called the fetter of views.

original: gzhan mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba zhes bshad do //
translated: The two, clinging to other and clinging to morality and ascetic-practice, are called the fetter of clinging.

original: de la gzung ba ni lta ba gsum mo //
analyzed: de la gzung ba ni lta ba gsum mo //
translated: Among them, the three views are the apprehended object.

original: 'dzin pa ni mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis te /
translated: The two, clinging to other and clinging to morality and ascetic-practice, are the apprehending subject.

original: gcig ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: One is clinging to the supreme.

original: cig shos ni dag par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: cig shos ni dag par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The other is clinging to purification.

original: 'bras bu rnam pa de gsum spangs na nges par legs par rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam pa de gsum spangs na nges par legs par rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If one abandons these three kinds of results, one will understand definite release.

original: shes rab med par ni thar pa med de /
analyzed: shes rab med par ni thar pa med de /
translated: But without wisdom, there is no liberation.

original: de ni mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de ni mdo las kyang /
translated: And it is said in the sutra:

original: dge slong dag de ltar na sems ni glog lta bu'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag de ltar na sems ni glog lta bu'o //
translated: “Bhikshus, the mind is like a flash of lightning.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni rdo rje lta bu'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni rdo rje lta bu'o //
translated: Samadhi is like a diamond.

original: ye shes ni nyon mongs pa rnams 'jig pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ye shes ni nyon mongs pa rnams 'jig pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Wisdom destroys the afflictions.”

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bya ba bden pa rnams la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bya ba bden pa rnams la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni re re dang sbyar ro //
translated: The words “with regard to the truths” are to be construed with each of the four: suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: yid gnyis za ba ni blo gros rnam pa gnyis 'byung bas yid gnyis za ba'o //
analyzed: yid gnyis za ba ni blo gros rnam pa gnyis 'byung bas yid gnyis za ba'o //
translated: Doubt is a two-pointedness of mind.

original: bden pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni 'di bden pa'i yul la ni yin gyi yul gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni 'di bden pa'i yul la ni yin gyi yul gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: “With regard to the truths” means that doubt is about the truths, not about other things.

original: de bas na sdong dum la mi la sogs par som nyi za bas the tshom zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sdong dum la mi la sogs par som nyi za bas the tshom zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, doubt is called a “thorn” because it causes hesitation, as when one hesitates about whether a stump in the road is a man or not.

original: nyon mongs pa'i nad gso ba ni shes rab nyid de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i nad gso ba ni shes rab nyid de /
translated: Wisdom is the medicine for the disease of the afflictions.

original: gso ba zhes bya ba ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos ni the tshom mo //
analyzed: gso ba zhes bya ba ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos ni the tshom mo //
translated: The “cure” is the opposite of the disease, which is doubt.

original: lam kha brag dang rtsva mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni dper na lam kha brag tu phyin pa'i mi lam 'dir 'gro 'am /
analyzed: lam kha brag dang rtsva mi 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni dper na lam kha brag tu phyin pa'i mi lam 'dir 'gro 'am /
translated: The “fork in the road” is like a person who comes to a fork in the road and hesitates, thinking, “Which way should I go?”

original: 'on te lam 'dir 'gro snyam du som nyi za ba ltar the tshom yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te lam 'dir 'gro snyam du som nyi za ba ltar the tshom yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Doubt should be understood in the same way.

original: rtsva mi rgyang ring ba dang mun pa'i nang na mthong ba la gzhag ste /
analyzed: rtsva mi rgyang ring ba dang mun pa'i nang na mthong ba la gzhag ste /
translated: It is like the seeing of grass in the distance or in the dark.

original: 'di ni the tshom mo //
analyzed: 'di ni the tshom mo //
translated: This is doubt.

original: khong nas 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba'i khro ba las chos gzhan du ston to //
analyzed: khong nas 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba'i khro ba las chos gzhan du ston to //
translated: It is taught as a separate element from anger, as “internal disturbance.”

original: gzhan la mi gtong ngo snyam du zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la mi gtong ngo snyam du zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshig gi rigs pa'o //
translated: The phrase “it does not give itself to others” is an example of the reasoning of verbal convention.

original: sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni kun du 'dzin pas kun du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi kun du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni kun du 'dzin pas kun du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The phrase “the grasping of the mind” means that it is grasping because it grasps.

original: chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa la mngon par chags pas sngon du 'gro ba chos la sogs pa dang mi 'bral bar 'dod la /
analyzed: chos dang zang zing dang mkhas pa la mngon par chags pas sngon du 'gro ba chos la sogs pa dang mi 'bral bar 'dod la /
translated: It is preceded by attachment to the Dharma, material things, and knowledge, and it is the desire not to be separated from the Dharma, etc.

original: sbyin pa dang mi mthun pa sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i chos ni ser sna'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang mi mthun pa sred pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i chos ni ser sna'o //
translated: Greed is the cause of stinginess, which is the cause of not giving.

original: kun du sbyor ba'i don ni 'ching ba'i don te zhes bya ba ni kun du 'dre bar byed pas kun du sbyor ba rnams so //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba'i don ni 'ching ba'i don te zhes bya ba ni kun du 'dre bar byed pas kun du sbyor ba rnams so //
translated: The meaning of “fetter” is the meaning of “bondage.” The fetters are so called because they bind.

original: mig gzugs rnams la kun du mi sbyor la zhes bya ba ni 'ching zhes bya @260b ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig gzugs rnams la kun du mi sbyor la zhes bya ba ni 'ching zhes bya @260b ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Sūtra says: “The eye does not unite with visible forms. ” “ Unites” means “binds. ”

original: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba la 'dun pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba la 'dun pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “ Attachment through desire” means: desire is the wish for something.

original: 'dod chags ni mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment is the strong desire for something.

original: mngon par 'dod pa sngon du song ba'i mngon par chags pa ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa sngon du song ba'i mngon par chags pa ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: Attachment through desire is the strong desire that precedes the wish for something.

original: dkar po yang nag po la ma yin mod kyi gang de na 'breng ba la sogs pa yod pa de kun du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dkar po yang nag po la ma yin mod kyi gang de na 'breng ba la sogs pa yod pa de kun du sbyor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: “ White” does not mean “black. ” “ Bond” means that which exists in the form of a rope, etc.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir mdo las 'ching ba rnam pa gsum gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'dul ba'i dbang gi phyir mdo las 'ching ba rnam pa gsum gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One, for the sake of those to be trained, has taught three bonds in the Sūtra.

original: de la 'di dag gis srid pa'i btson rar bcings pas 'ching ba rnams te /
analyzed: de la 'di dag gis srid pa'i btson rar bcings pas 'ching ba rnams te /
translated: They are bonds because one is bound by them in the prison of existence.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyud kyi gags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rgyud kyi gags zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They are called “obstructions” because they obstruct the mindstream of one who is free from attachment.

original: de la 'ching ba gsum bstan pas ni dga' ba dang dma' ba'i rnam pa dang / gnyi ga las bzlog par zhugs pa nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: de la 'ching ba gsum bstan pas ni dga' ba dang dma' ba'i rnam pa dang / gnyi ga las bzlog par zhugs pa nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu bstan to //
translated: The three bonds are taught in order to demonstrate the aspects of joy, depression, and both of these in reverse, and all the defilements.

original: de la dga' ba'i rnam par zhugs pa ni nga rgyal la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la dga' ba'i rnam par zhugs pa ni nga rgyal la sogs pa ste /
translated: Among them, the bonds of joy are pride, etc.

original: 'dod chags kyis ston to //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis ston to //
translated: They are taught by attachment.

original: dma' ba'i rnam par zhugs pa ni the tshom la sogs pa ste ;
analyzed: dma' ba'i rnam par zhugs pa ni the tshom la sogs pa ste ;
translated: The bonds of depression are doubt, etc.

original: zhe sdang gis ston to //
analyzed: zhe sdang gis ston to //
translated: They are taught by hatred.

original: gnyi ga las bzlog pa ni rmugs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga las bzlog pa ni rmugs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The bonds of both of these in reverse are torpor, etc.

original: gti mug gis ston to //
analyzed: gti mug gis ston to //
translated: They are taught by delusion.

original: 'dod pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la 'dod chags pas 'dod chags pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa la 'dod chags pas 'dod chags pa'o //
translated: With regard to sense-objects means with regard to the sense-objects of form, etc.

original: sdug bsngal mthong ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi yul lam sdug bsngal gyi rnam par mthong bas sdug bsngal mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi yul lam sdug bsngal gyi rnam par mthong bas sdug bsngal mthong ba'o //
translated: The expression seeing suffering means seeing the object of suffering or seeing the aspect of suffering.

original: de dag ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: These are the receptivities of the cognition of the dharma with regard to suffering and of the subsequent cognition.

original: de gnyis kyis spong ba ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis spong ba ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
translated: The two are abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: spong ba zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyud las sel ba ste /
analyzed: spong ba zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyud las sel ba ste /
translated: Abandonment means the removal of the cause from the continuum.

original: rnyed pa'i rgyun gcod pa dang / de la bral ba'i rnyed pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa'i rgyun gcod pa dang / de la bral ba'i rnyed pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is the cutting off of the continuity of acquisition and the production of the acquisition of separation from that.

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ji lta bar lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bar yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba ji lta bar lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bar yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as the objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, so too are those to be abandoned by seeing the truths of origin, path and cessation.

original: bsgom pa ni dmigs pa ma nges shing 'bras bu khyad par can la ltos nas shes pa goms par byed pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa ni dmigs pa ma nges shing 'bras bu khyad par can la ltos nas shes pa goms par byed pa ste /
translated: Cultivation is the repeated practice of knowledge in dependence on a specific object and a special result.

original: des spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags ni bsgom pas spang bar bya'o//
analyzed: des spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags ni bsgom pas spang bar bya'o//
translated: Attachment abandoned by that is abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: nang du bltas par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags ni phal cher yul la mngon du phyogs par gyur pas phyir bltas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nang du bltas par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags ni phal cher yul la mngon du phyogs par gyur pas phyir bltas par gyur pa'o //
translated: Attachment of the desire realm is called turned outward because it is mostly directed to objects.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yul yin pas nang du bltas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi snyoms par 'jug pa yul yin pas nang du bltas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The meditative attainment of the form and formless realms are internal since they are objects that are turned inward.🔽

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang @261a * //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang @261a * //
translated: The meditative attainment of the form and formless realms are its object, and thus it is called “looking inward.”

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis la sdug bsngal mthong ba ma smos pa ni bden pa gzhan mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis la sdug bsngal mthong ba ma smos pa ni bden pa gzhan mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two views of the perishable composite and extreme views are not mentioned as objects abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they are not objects abandoned by seeing the other two truths.

original: thar par 'du shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar par 'du shes pa dor ba'i phyir khams gnyis nas skyes pa'i 'dod chags ni srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya'o //🔽rnam pas tha dad pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phyir rnam pas so //
analyzed: thar par 'du shes pa bzlog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par thar par 'du shes pa dor ba'i phyir khams gnyis nas skyes pa'i 'dod chags ni srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya'o // rnam pas tha dad pa nyid de zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i phyir rnam pas so //
translated: The attachment of the two realms is called attachment to existence because it is to be abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The two attachments are different in aspect.

original: khams dang rnam pa ste zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams dang rnam pa ste zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two attachments are different in realm and aspect.

original: tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la 'dod chags ni chags par tshul gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la 'dod chags ni chags par tshul gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But not by mode, because attachment and the one who is attached are the same mode.

original: phra rgyas kyi don gang zhe na /
analyzed: phra rgyas kyi don gang zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the word anusaya?

original: phra ba'i don yin na tshor ba la sogs pa la yang thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phra ba'i don yin na tshor ba la sogs pa la yang thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it means subtle, then feeling, etc., would also be anusaya.

original: de la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de la nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: yod pa dang / 'khrul pa yod pas bye brag dang bye brag gi gzhi'i dngos po yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang / 'khrul pa yod pas bye brag dang bye brag gi gzhi'i dngos po yin no //
translated: Because it exists and because error exists, it is the thing that is the basis of the distinction.

original: de dag ni 'bras bus che bar mngon par yang yod de /
analyzed: de dag ni 'bras bus che bar mngon par yang yod de /
translated: They are also called great because of their result.

original: dper na mi zhig chags par gyur na mig rgod pa dang / skad kyi gdangs shva shva por 'gyur ba dang / mi zhig khros par gyur na /
analyzed: dper na mi zhig chags par gyur na mig rgod pa dang / skad kyi gdangs shva shva por 'gyur ba dang / mi zhig khros par gyur na /
translated: For example, when a person is attached, his eyes are lustful, his voice is soft, and when a person is angry,

original: mig tshugs med pa dang / sgra grag pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mig tshugs med pa dang / sgra grag pa lta bu'o //
translated: his eyes are fierce and his voice is loud.

original: de skad du 'phags pa kun dga' bos kyang /
analyzed: de skad du 'phags pa kun dga' bos kyang /
translated: Thus, the noble Ananda said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis ni rab tu byung nas lo nyi shu lhag cig lon gyi bar du sngon 'dod pa'i 'du shes byung bar ma dran no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gis ni rab tu byung nas lo nyi shu lhag cig lon gyi bar du sngon 'dod pa'i 'du shes byung bar ma dran no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Venerable Ones, since I went forth, I do not recall having had a thought of desire for more than twenty years.

original: de ltar sems can 'dod chags kyi bsam pa can la zhe sdang la sbyor ba dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: de ltar sems can 'dod chags kyi bsam pa can la zhe sdang la sbyor ba dag kyang yod do //
translated: Thus, there are those who are attached to the idea of desire and who are attached to the idea of hatred.

original: de bzhin du gcig la sbyar bas nyon mongs pa drug car la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig la sbyar bas nyon mongs pa drug car la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should apply the six afflictions to each of the six objects.

original: 'dod chags bcos ma can la tshar gcad pa zhe sdang yin pa dag kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags bcos ma can la tshar gcad pa zhe sdang yin pa dag kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to those who are attached to the idea of hatred and who are attached to the idea of desire.

original: rnam pa 'dis nyon mongs pa drug car la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis nyon mongs pa drug car la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: By this method, one should apply the six afflictions to each of the six objects.

original: des na phra ba'i don zhes bshad do //
analyzed: des na phra ba'i don zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is explained as having the meaning of subtle.

original: yang na lus dang sems kyi rgyun rjes su snyegs pa ste zhes bya ba lus kyi rgyun du 'byung ba ni dbang po gzhan rnam par bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: yang na lus dang sems kyi rgyun rjes su snyegs pa ste zhes bya ba lus kyi rgyun du 'byung ba ni dbang po gzhan rnam par bzlog pa'o //
translated: Or, it is following the continuity of body and mind. The arising in the continuity of body is the reversal of other faculties.

original: sems kyi rgyun gyi rjes su snyegs pa ni /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun gyi rjes su snyegs pa ni /
translated: Following the continuity of mind is

original: 'di lta ste 'dod chags shas che ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'dod chags shas che ba'o //
translated: For example, one who is dominated by attachment.

original: zhe sdang gis ni lus rnam par sgyur ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang gis ni lus rnam par sgyur ro //
translated: One who is dominated by hatred contorts the body.

original: sems kyi rgyud ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The continuum of the mind is for example,

original: zhe sdang shas che ba'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang shas che ba'o //
translated: one who is dominated by hatred.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib par gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib par gsungs so //
translated: This is what the Lord has declared to be the obscuration that consists in moral defilement.

original: chu na rgyu bas nam mkha' la rgyu ba'i grib ma la snyegs pa @261b lta bu'i phyir bag la nyal lo zhes bya bas ni don de nyid dpes ston to //
analyzed: chu na rgyu bas nam mkha' la rgyu ba'i grib ma la snyegs pa @261b lta bu'i phyir bag la nyal lo zhes bya bas ni don de nyid dpes ston to //
translated: The meaning of the term 'latent tendency' is revealed by the simile: just as those who move in the water pursue the shadow of those who move in the sky.

original: mkha' la rgyu bas na mkha' la rgyu ba ste 'dab chags so //
analyzed: mkha' la rgyu bas na mkha' la rgyu ba ste 'dab chags so //
translated: Those who move in the sky are those who move in the sky, i.e. birds.

original: ji ltar de dag zas la chags pas chu na rgyu zhing grib ma la snyegs te /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag zas la chags pas chu na rgyu zhing grib ma la snyegs te /
translated: Just as those who move in the water pursue the shadow of those who move in the sky, because of their attachment to food,

original: 'di lhung ma thag tu bza'o snyam nas rtag tu rjes su 'brang ba ltar bag la nyal ba 'di rnams kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di lhung ma thag tu bza'o snyam nas rtag tu rjes su 'brang ba ltar bag la nyal ba 'di rnams kyang de bzhin te /
translated: thinking: 'As soon as it falls, I will eat it', and constantly follow it, so too these latent tendencies.

original: thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba na rnyed pa'i rgyun mi 'chad par rjes snyegs pa ste mi gtong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba na rnyed pa'i rgyun mi 'chad par rjes snyegs pa ste mi gtong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They pursue without interruption the stream of the latent impressions of the view of self that has been acquired since beginningless samsara; the meaning is: they do not relinquish it.

original: sems can gyi rgyud la khyab pa'i phyir til rnams la til mar lta bur gnas te de'i phyir bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: sems can gyi rgyud la khyab pa'i phyir til rnams la til mar lta bur gnas te de'i phyir bag la nyal lo //
translated: Because they pervade the mindstreams of sentient beings, they exist like oil permeating a sesame seed, and for that reason they are latent.

original: dmigs pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis zhes bya ba de la ;
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis zhes bya ba de la ;
translated: The root text states, “two that possess objects.”

original: bag la nyal rnams kyi dmigs pa ni yul bud med la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal rnams kyi dmigs pa ni yul bud med la sogs pa'o //
translated: The objects of the latent afflictions are objects such as women.

original: ldan pa ni sems gang dang lhan cig skye ba'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ni sems gang dang lhan cig skye ba'o //
translated: Possession is the mind with which they are simultaneously generated.🔽The root text states, “ten that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering in the desire realm.”🔽The afflicted view of the self and the extreme view are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they wrongly conceive the nature of suffering to be a self.🔽The afflicted view of the self and the extreme view are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they wrongly conceive the nature of suffering to be a self.

original: 'dod pa na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu ste zhes bya ba de la 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: 'dod pa na sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu ste zhes bya ba de la 'jig tshogs dang mthar 'dzin par lta ba ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid de /
translated: The afflicted view of the self and the extreme view are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they wrongly conceive the nature of suffering to be a self.🔽The afflicted view of the self and the extreme view are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they wrongly conceive the nature of suffering to be a self.🔽The afflicted view of the self and the extreme view are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they wrongly conceive the nature of suffering to be a self.🔽The afflicted view of the self and the extreme view are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they wrongly conceive the nature of suffering to be a self.🔽The afflicted view of the self and the extreme view are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they wrongly conceive the nature of suffering to be a self.🔽The afflicted view of the self and the extreme view are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they wrongly conceive the nature of suffering to be a self.🔽The afflicted view of the self and the extreme view are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they wrongly conceive the nature of suffering to be a self.🔽The afflicted view of the self and the extreme view are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they wrongly conceive the nature of suffering to be a self.🔽The afflicted view of the self and the extreme view are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they wrongly conceive the nature of suffering to be a self.

original: sdug bsngal nyid la bdag tu log par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽sdug bsngal la gzhan dag gis bdag tu brtags pa de nyid la chad pa dang rtag pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid la bdag tu log par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽sdug bsngal la gzhan dag gis bdag tu brtags pa de nyid la chad pa dang rtag pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The afflicted view of the self and the extreme view are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering because they wrongly conceive the nature of suffering to be a self.🔽The afflicted view of the self and the extreme view are

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
translated: The overesteeming of morality and asceticism is to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and the path.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur lta bar bshad pa snyam na /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa ni rgyu ma yin pa la rgyur lta bar bshad pa snyam na /
translated: If you think that the overesteeming of morality and asceticism is the view that a cause is not a cause,

original: ci'i phyir kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin /
translated: why is it not to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here they say:

original: gang rgyur mngon par zhen pa de ni rang bzhin dang skyes bu la sogs pa la rtag pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang rgyur mngon par zhen pa de ni rang bzhin dang skyes bu la sogs pa la rtag pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: The overesteeming of morality and asceticism arises from the view that holds the intrinsic nature, purusha, and so on to be permanent and a self.

original: rang bzhin la sogs pa de dag la rtag pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin la sogs pa de dag la rtag pa dang bdag tu 'dzin pa ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: The view that holds the intrinsic nature, and so on, to be permanent and a self is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: de bas na des byas par rgyur mngon par zhen pa yang de nyid kyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na des byas par rgyur mngon par zhen pa yang de nyid kyis spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore the overesteeming of morality and asceticism that is created by that view is also abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: de'i phyir bden pa gzhan mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no ;
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa gzhan mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin no ;
translated: Therefore it is not to be abandoned by seeing the other truths.

original: / lam la log par rtogs pa'i phyir lam mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: / lam la log par rtogs pa'i phyir lam mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
translated: Because of wrong understanding of the path, they are to be abandoned by seeing the path.🔽Four are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: bsgom pas sdang bar bya ba bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu bstan pa dag las lta ba rnams dang the tshom ston na bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgom pas sdang bar bya ba bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba bcu bstan pa dag las lta ba rnams dang the tshom ston na bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: From among the ten taught as to be abandoned by seeing suffering, four are taught as to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin, because they are views and doubt.🔽Eighty-eight are to be abandoned by seeing.

original: brgyad cu rtsa brgyad ni mthong bas spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i @262a * //🔽lam gyis spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brgyad cu rtsa brgyad ni mthong bas spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i @262a * // lam gyis spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.🔽Ten are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: bcu ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bcu ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang bar bya'o //
translated: This means that they are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: khams khams kyi zhes bya ba ni so so'i 'o //
analyzed: khams khams kyi zhes bya ba ni so so'i 'o //
translated: In each realm means in each of the three realms.

original: sdug bsngal dang rgyu mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang rgyu mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: Those to be abandoned by seeing suffering and origin are to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origin.

original: de la sdug bsngal mthong bas sdang bar bya ba ni lta ba lnga dang the tshom mo //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal mthong bas sdang bar bya ba ni lta ba lnga dang the tshom mo //
translated: The five views and doubt are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni lta ba gnyis dang the tshom mo //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni lta ba gnyis dang the tshom mo //
translated: Two views and doubt are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origination.🔽The ignorance associated with those views and doubt is to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origination.

original: de dag nyid dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa gang yin pa dang ma 'dres pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o //🔽ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa gang yin pa dang ma 'dres pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba'o // ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: The ignorance that is not associated with those views and doubt is to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and origination.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “unmixed” means that it is not associated with other afflictions.

original: kun du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dngos po rnam pa lnga la dmigs nas 'gro zhing 'byung ba kun du 'gro ba'o ;
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i dngos po rnam pa lnga la dmigs nas 'gro zhing 'byung ba kun du 'gro ba'o ;
translated: The term “pervading” means that it pervades the five categories of objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering, origination, cessation, and the path, and by the path of cultivation.

original: / de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni khams khams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni khams khams zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “similar” means that it is of the same realm as the objects to which it is related.

original: de la gang dag zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la zag pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la gang dag zag pa dang bcas pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la zag pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: Contaminants are the afflictions.

original: de 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i dngos po ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i dngos po ni zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The things that are compatible with their occurrence are contaminated.

original: de la dmigs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those that focus on them are attachment and so on.🔽Those that possess the object field are the two that increase through possession.

original: dmigs pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis zhes bya ba de la dmigs pa ni yul gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang ldan pa gnyis kyis zhes bya ba de la dmigs pa ni yul gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object field is form and so on.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa gang dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba de ldan bas 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa gang dag dang lhan cig 'byung ba de ldan bas 'phel bar byed do //
translated: Those that arise simultaneously with feeling and so on increase through possession.

original: de dag ni ldan pa ste zhes bya ba ni dmigs pas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni ldan pa ste zhes bya ba ni dmigs pas ma yin pa'o //
translated: Those that possess them are not through the focal object.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is this? Because they are antidotes to attachment and so on.

original: zag pa med pa'i dngos po la ni nyon mongs pa bdag gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dngos po la ni nyon mongs pa bdag gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Contaminants do not abide in uncontaminated things,

original: rdo bsregs pa la rkang mthil bzhag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rdo bsregs pa la rkang mthil bzhag pa bzhin no //
translated: like placing the sole of one’s foot on a heated stone.

original: de rnams sdug bsngal nas lam gyi bar dag mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni dper na mi kha zas ngan pas spos nas kha zas zhim po la yang mi 'dod pa de bzhin byis pa ma rig pas spos pa yang bden pa bzhi po dag yod bzhin
analyzed: de rnams sdug bsngal nas lam gyi bar dag mi 'dod do zhes bya ba ni dper na mi kha zas ngan pas spos nas kha zas zhim po la yang mi 'dod pa de bzhin byis pa ma rig pas spos pa yang bden pa bzhi po dag yod bzhin
translated: Just as a person who is disgusted with bad food does not want even good food, so the fool who is disgusted with ignorance does not want to know the four noble truths.

original: du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa mi 'dod de /
analyzed: du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa mi 'dod de /
translated: They do not want to know the aspects of impermanence, etc.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam par mi 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam par mi 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they do not grasp the aspects of suffering, etc.🔽If the latent dispositions have not been eliminated,

original: gal te bag la nyal ma spangs pa dang zhes bya ba ni de'i rnyed pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te bag la nyal ma spangs pa dang zhes bya ba ni de'i rnyed pa dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: means that one has not been freed from the possession of those dispositions.

original: @262b tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni yid la byed pa nyon mongs pa can mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: @262b tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni yid la byed pa nyon mongs pa can mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: Improper mental attention is the actualization of defiled mental attention.

original: rgyu dang yul dang sbyor ba'i stobs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu dang yul dang sbyor ba'i stobs zhes bya ba la /
translated: The power of cause, object, and application.

original: rgyu'i stobs ni bag la nyal ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i stobs ni bag la nyal ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The power of cause is the non-elimination of the latent dispositions.

original: yul gyi stobs ni yul mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi stobs ni yul mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: The power of object is the actualization of the object.

original: sbyor ba'i stobs ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i stobs ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The power of application is incorrect mental attention.

original: de la tshor ba gang nyon mongs pa gang ldan pa de dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la tshor ba gang nyon mongs pa gang ldan pa de dpyad par bya ste /
translated: One should examine which feeling is associated with which affliction.

original: de la 'dod pa la 'dod chags ni bde ba dang yid bde ba gnyis dang ldan no //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa la 'dod chags ni bde ba dang yid bde ba gnyis dang ldan no //
translated: Desire realm attachment is associated with pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: zhe sdang ni sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba gnyis dang ldan no //
analyzed: zhe sdang ni sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba gnyis dang ldan no //
translated: Aversion is associated with pain and mental dissatisfaction.

original: nga rgyal ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan gnyis dang sa gsum po dag na ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: nga rgyal ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan gnyis dang sa gsum po dag na ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: Pride is associated with mental dissatisfaction in the desire realm and in the first two absorptions, on three levels.

original: bsam gtan gsum par ni bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum par ni bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: It is associated with the faculty of pleasure in the third absorption.

original: gong ma rnams su ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang ldan no //🔽'jig tshogs la lta ba'i sa gsum po dag na ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: gong ma rnams su ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang ldan no // 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i sa gsum po dag na ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: It is associated with the faculty of equanimity in the higher levels.🔽The afflicted view of the self is associated with mental dissatisfaction on the three levels.

original: bsam gtan gsum par ni bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum par ni bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: It is associated with the faculty of pleasure in the third absorption.

original: gong ma rnams su ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: gong ma rnams su ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: Those in the higher realms possess the faculty of equanimity.

original: log par lta ba ni yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba gnyis dang ldan no //
analyzed: log par lta ba ni yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba gnyis dang ldan no //
translated: Those who have wrong views possess both the faculty of mental pleasure and the faculty of mental pain.

original: bsod nams byed pa rnams kyi ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: bsod nams byed pa rnams kyi ni yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: Those who perform meritorious actions possess the faculty of mental pain.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa byed pa rnams kyi ni yid bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa byed pa rnams kyi ni yid bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: Those who perform nonmeritorious actions possess the faculty of mental pleasure.

original: mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i ni yid bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin par lta ba'i ni yid bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: Those who have the view of grasping extremes possess the faculty of mental pleasure.

original: sa lhag ma rnams na ni tshor ba'i rdzas gang yod pa dang ldan par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: sa lhag ma rnams na ni tshor ba'i rdzas gang yod pa dang ldan par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that those in the remaining stages possess whatever substances of feeling they possess.

original: thams cad kyang rgyun chad pa'i tshe btang snyoms dang ldan te /
analyzed: thams cad kyang rgyun chad pa'i tshe btang snyoms dang ldan te /
translated: All possess equanimity when their continuum is severed.

original: rgyun chad pa na btang snyoms yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun chad pa na btang snyoms yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because equanimity exists when the continuum is severed.

original: nyon mongs pa gang rnams yin pa zhes bya ba ni bgal  nyal zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang rnams yin pa zhes bya ba ni bgal  nyal zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: Which afflictions?

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang de rnams yin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes kyang bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang de rnams yin mod kyi zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhes kyang bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The secondary defilements are also these, but they are also called secondary defilements.

original: gang dag de rnams las gzhan bzhes  bya ba ni bgal  nyal ba rnams las so //
analyzed: gang dag de rnams las gzhan bzhes  bya ba ni bgal  nyal ba rnams las so //
translated: Those that are other than these are the subsidiary defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa can kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called subsidiary defilements because they are not of the nature of defilement.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi phung por bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi phung por bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi phung po'i bdag nyid do //
translated: They are included in the aggregate of formations.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang mthun par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa 'byung ba dang mthun par 'jug pa'o //
translated: They are subsidiary defilements because they function in conformity with the arising of defilements.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni @263a * //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni @263a * //
translated: The subsidiary defilements are not defilements

original: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid ma rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have the characteristics of defilements in their entirety.

original: pha rol la slu ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa dang bkur sti la chags pas gzhan la 'drid pa ste sgyu'o //
analyzed: pha rol la slu ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa dang bkur sti la chags pas gzhan la 'drid pa ste sgyu'o //
translated: Deceit is the deceiving of others through attachment to gain and honor.

original: gzhan la mi ltos pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni nga rgyal las khyad par du ston to //
analyzed: gzhan la mi ltos pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni nga rgyal las khyad par du ston to //
translated: The phrase not dependent on others indicates the difference between pride and conceit.

original: sems yongs su mi 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems khengs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: sems yongs su mi 'dzin pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems khengs par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The phrase not holding the mind in check means not controlling the mind.

original: de'i dbang gis sems khengs pa bzhin du dge ba'i bya ba thams cad dang mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis sems khengs pa bzhin du dge ba'i bya ba thams cad dang mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: Because of that, like a mind that is inflated, it is not in accord with all virtuous activities.

original: pha rol la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol la gnod pa ste yongs su btang ba'i bsam pa med pa ni rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol la rnam par tho 'tshams pa'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol la gnod pa ste yongs su btang ba'i bsam pa med pa ni rnam par 'tshe ba'o //
translated: The phrase harming others means injuring others.

original: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ni log par lta ba la sogs pas 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par dam du 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa ni log par lta ba la sogs pas 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni brdzun pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par dam du 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The phrase grasping firmly means grasping firmly as true the view that 'this alone is the truth, all else is false.'🔽The phrase not accepting advice means not accepting the advice of others.

original: bsgo ba ni bsnyad pa ste rigs pa brjod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽khon du 'dzin pa ni kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po mang du byed pa'o zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: bsgo ba ni bsnyad pa ste rigs pa brjod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽khon du 'dzin pa ni kun nas mnar sems kyi dngos po mang du byed pa'o zhes bya ba de la /
translated: The phrase not giving up resentment means not giving up the basis for malice.

original: kun nas mnar sems ni khong khro ba ste /
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems ni khong khro ba ste /
translated: Resentment is anger.

original: de'i dngos po ni mi mdza' ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni mi mdza' ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Its object is a hostile person, etc.

original: 'di bdag la gnod pa byed pa'o zhes rkyen gyis gnod pa byed pa'i bsam pa mi 'dor ba ni mang du byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di bdag la gnod pa byed pa'o zhes rkyen gyis gnod pa byed pa'i bsam pa mi 'dor ba ni mang du byed pa ste /
translated: The many times one does not give up the thought of harming someone who has harmed one, thinking, “This person has harmed me,” is the cultivation of resentment.

original: 'dis 'dud par 'dzin pas khon du 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'dis 'dud par 'dzin pas khon du 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The holding of grudges is the non-abandonment of resentment.

original: des de dkris pa lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: des de dkris pa lta bur snang ngo //
translated: It appears as if one is bound by it.

original: sems gya gyu ba zhes bya ba ni sems mi drang ba ste /
analyzed: sems gya gyu ba zhes bya ba ni sems mi drang ba ste /
translated: The crookedness of mind is the dishonesty of mind.

original: rang gi rgyud sbas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud sbas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for the concealment of one’s own faults.

original: des yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi brjod do //
analyzed: des yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi brjod do //
translated: One does not speak of them as they really are.🔽What is crookedness?

original: gya gyu ba ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: gya gyu ba ji lta bu zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The verse says:

original: rtag pa gang yin pa mya ngan 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa gang yin pa mya ngan 'das pa'o //
translated: That which is straight is nirvana.

original: mi rtag gang yin 'dus byas chos kun no //
analyzed: mi rtag gang yin 'dus byas chos kun no //
translated: That which is crooked is all conditioned things.

original: drang po gang yin 'phags pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: drang po gang yin 'phags pa'i lam yin no //
translated: That which is straight is the noble path.

original: gya gyu gang yin sdig can lta ba'o //
analyzed: gya gyu gang yin sdig can lta ba'o //
translated: That which is crooked is the view of the sinful.

original: zhes tshigs su bcad pa las 'byung ba'o /
analyzed: zhes tshigs su bcad pa las 'byung ba'o /
translated: This is from a verse.

original: // / chos mngon pa la 'jug pa rgya cher 'grel pa snying po kun las btus pa zhes bya ba //
analyzed: // / chos mngon pa la 'jug pa rgya cher 'grel pa snying po kun las btus pa zhes bya ba //
translated: The Commentary on the Verses of the Abhidharmakośa called the Essence of the Excellent Teaching

original: bam po gsum pa /🔽kun nas dkris te 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gis kun nas dkris te /
analyzed: bam po gsum pa / kun nas dkris te 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gis kun nas dkris te /
translated: The third chapter

original: sems can rnams srid pa'i btson ra na 'dug pas kun nas dkris te 'dug ba rnams so //
analyzed: sems can rnams srid pa'i btson ra na 'dug pas kun nas dkris te 'dug ba rnams so //
translated: Entangled means that they entangle sentient beings in the prison of cyclic existence.

original: rmugs pa zhes bya ba 'dis dge ba'i bya ba rnams la rmugs par byed pas rmugs pa ste /
analyzed: rmugs pa zhes bya ba 'dis dge ba'i bya ba rnams la rmugs par byed pas rmugs pa ste /
translated: Dullness means that it makes one dull with regard to virtuous activities.

original: zhum zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhum zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for depression.

original: yur ba dang mi dga' ba la sogs pa las byung ba lus dang sems lci bar gyur pa ni rmugs pa ste /
analyzed: yur ba dang mi dga' ba la sogs pa las byung ba lus dang sems lci bar gyur pa ni rmugs pa ste /
translated: Depression is the heaviness of body and mind that arises from such things as laziness and lack of delight.

original: des non na lus dang sems @263b zhum zhing blun po'i dngos po'i tshul gyis las su mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des non na lus dang sems @263b zhum zhing blun po'i dngos po'i tshul gyis las su mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When it overpowers the mind, it causes the body and mind to become sluggish and dull, and one becomes unfit for action.

original: gnyid ni lus dang sems 'dzin par mi nus pa dang sdud pa ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnyid ni lus dang sems 'dzin par mi nus pa dang sdud pa ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Sleep is the inability and withdrawal of body and mind.

original: lus 'dzin mi nus pa ni rang bzhin du mi gnas ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus 'dzin mi nus pa ni rang bzhin du mi gnas ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The inability to hold the body is due to the lack of stability.

original: sems 'dzin mi nus pa ni brtson 'grus nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems 'dzin mi nus pa ni brtson 'grus nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inability to hold the mind is due to the loss of effort.

original: sems sdud pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga sdud pa'o //
analyzed: sems sdud pa ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga sdud pa'o //
translated: The contraction of the mind is the contraction of the five collections of consciousness.

original: de ni dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de ni dge ba dang nyon mongs pa can dang lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: It is threefold by way of the distinctions of virtue, affliction, and neutral.

original: de la nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de ni kun nas dkris te 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa can gang yin pa de ni kun nas dkris te 'dug pa'o //
translated: Among them, that which is afflicted is the one that is entangled.

original: sems ma zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang stobs dang rigs dang lang tsho dang phyug pa la sogs pa'i rgyags pas bskyed pa ni sems ma zhi ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: sems ma zhi ba'o zhes bya ba ni gzugs dang stobs dang rigs dang lang tsho dang phyug pa la sogs pa'i rgyags pas bskyed pa ni sems ma zhi ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The agitated mind is that which is generated by the intoxication of form, strength, lineage, youth, wealth, and so on. It is the cause of the agitation of the mind.

original: gang dang ldan na sems zhi ba dang mi mthun par gyur pa'i chos de ni rgod pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang ldan na sems zhi ba dang mi mthun par gyur pa'i chos de ni rgod pa'o //
translated: That dharma which, when possessed, is contrary to the pacification of the mind is agitation.

original: ngan pa byas pa'i dngos po ni 'gyod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngan pa byas pa'i dngos po ni 'gyod pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The thing that is done badly is regret.

original: smad pa byas pa ni ngan pa byas pa ste bya ba ngan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'dir ni de la dmigs pa sems las byung ba'i chos la 'gyod pa zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa nyes par spyod pa byas la /
analyzed: smad pa byas pa ni ngan pa byas pa ste bya ba ngan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'dir ni de la dmigs pa sems las byung ba'i chos la 'gyod pa zhes bya ste zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa nyes par spyod pa byas la /
translated: The term blame means bad action, that is, a bad deed.🔽Here, regret is a mental factor that focuses on that, that is, on the blame.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa legs par spyod pa ma byas pas gang yid la gcags pa de ni 'gyod pa dge ba'o //🔽gang sbyin ba la sogs pa legs par spyod pa byas la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa legs par spyod pa ma byas pas gang yid la gcags pa de ni 'gyod pa dge ba'o // gang sbyin ba la sogs pa legs par spyod pa byas la /
translated: When one has done evil deeds such as killing and so on, and not done good deeds such as giving and so on, whatever is a mental anguish is virtuous regret.

original: dgra gsad pa la sogs pa legs pa spyod pa ma byas pas yid la gcags pa gang yin pa de ni 'gyod pa nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dgra gsad pa la sogs pa legs pa spyod pa ma byas pas yid la gcags pa gang yin pa de ni 'gyod pa nyon mongs pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: When one has done good deeds such as giving and so on, and not done evil deeds such as killing and so on, whatever is a mental anguish is called afflicted regret.

original: ji ltar na 'gyod pa yid la gcags pa'i sgrar brjod pa ni de'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu btags te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'gyod pa yid la gcags pa'i sgrar brjod pa ni de'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu btags te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Since it is said, Regret is mental anguish, one might ask, How is regret called the word 'mental anguish'? Therefore, he says, The result is figuratively designated as the cause.

original: 'bras bu ni yid la gcags pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni yid la gcags pa'o //
translated: The result is mental anguish.

original: rgyu ni 'gyod pa'o ;
analyzed: rgyu ni 'gyod pa'o ;
translated: The cause is regret.

original: /'jig rten na yang gnas kyis gnas pa ston te zhes bya ba yid la gcags pa'i gnas lta bu ni 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: /'jig rten na yang gnas kyis gnas pa ston te zhes bya ba yid la gcags pa'i gnas lta bu ni 'gyod pa'o //
translated: He also shows the abode of the world by the abode. Remorse is like the abode of regret.

original: kha na ma tho ba la 'jigs par mi lta ba'o zhes bya ba ni nyes par spyod pa kun du 'byung ba la yid 'phrig med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽zhe sdang dang rnam par 'tshe ba ma gtogs te zhes bya ba de la ;
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba la 'jigs par mi lta ba'o zhes bya ba ni nyes par spyod pa kun du 'byung ba la yid 'phrig med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // zhe sdang dang rnam par 'tshe ba ma gtogs te zhes bya ba de la ;
translated: He does not see danger in what is blameworthy. This means that he is not afraid of the occurrence of evil conduct.

original: zhe sdang ni khong khro ba'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang ni khong khro ba'o //
translated: Except for hatred and violence. Hatred is anger.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba ni pha rol la gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba ni pha rol la gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: Violence is the desire to harm others.

original: de dag la gzhan du gyur pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i yul la kun nas mnar sems pa ste /🔽'dis bdag la 'di byas so //
analyzed: de dag la gzhan du gyur pa sems can dang sems can ma yin pa'i yul la kun nas mnar sems pa ste / 'dis bdag la 'di byas so //
translated: They are the transformation of those two. Hostility is the mental disturbance of one who is not forgiving, who thinks, “This person has done me harm,

original: mi phan pa byas so zhes rtog cing yongs su gtong ba dang ldan pa can ma @264a * //
analyzed: mi phan pa byas so zhes rtog cing yongs su gtong ba dang ldan pa can ma @264a * //
translated: has done me an injury,” and who is not disposed to let the matter drop.

original: yin pa'i sems 'khrugs pa de ni khro ba'o //
analyzed: yin pa'i sems 'khrugs pa de ni khro ba'o //
translated: It is a mental disturbance that is not forgiving.

original: kha na ma tho ba ma khyud pa'o zhes bya ba la kha na ma tho ba brjod par bya ba dge ba ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba ma khyud pa'o zhes bya ba la kha na ma tho ba brjod par bya ba dge ba ste /
translated: He does not conceal his faults.🔽The term “fault” refers to that which should be confessed, i.e., virtue.

original: brjod par bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni kha na ma tho ba ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i phyir ro // brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni kha na ma tho ba ste /
translated: It is called “fault” because it should be confessed.

original: tshul khrims dang cho ga dang 'tsho ba dang lta ba log par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang cho ga dang 'tsho ba dang lta ba log par zhugs pa'o //
translated: That which should not be confessed is a fault, i.e., a transgression of morality, ritual, livelihood, and view.

original: de sbed cing mkhyud pa'i rgyu ni 'chab pa ste /
analyzed: de sbed cing mkhyud pa'i rgyu ni 'chab pa ste /
translated: The cause of concealing and hiding that is shamelessness.

original: sdig pa nang du sbed cing phyi rol la gtsang ba ltar ston ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdig pa nang du sbed cing phyi rol la gtsang ba ltar ston ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that one conceals one’s sin and shows oneself to be pure externally.🔽The course of the mental factors is subtle.

original: sems las byung ba rnams kyi rgyu ba phra ste zhes bya ba la phra ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sems las byung ba rnams kyi rgyu ba phra ste zhes bya ba la phra ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is meant by “subtle”?

original: bye brag phyed par dka' ste rang gi ngo bo nges par byed mi nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bye brag phyed par dka' ste rang gi ngo bo nges par byed mi nus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is difficult to distinguish, i.e., one is unable to ascertain their individual natures.

original: rgyu ba ni rgyun du 'bab pa ste rab tu 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba ni rgyun du 'bab pa ste rab tu 'gro ba'o //
translated: “Course” means flowing, i.e., proceeding.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rgyu ba'o //
translated: “That” refers to the course.

original: rgyun du 'bab pa rgyun kyang bye brag phyed par mi nus te rtogs par mi nus na skad cig rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: rgyun du 'bab pa rgyun kyang bye brag phyed par mi nus te rtogs par mi nus na skad cig rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba de la /
translated: It is not possible to distinguish the continuum of a flowing river, and if it is not possible to understand the moments, what need is there to speak of the instants?

original: skad cig gi tshad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: skad cig gi tshad brjod par bya ste /
translated: The measure of an instant will now be explained.

original: padma'i rtsa ba'i rtsa bran drug cu rtsa lnga gshibs pa rnams kyi dang po chad pa la skad cig ces bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i rtsa ba'i rtsa bran drug cu rtsa lnga gshibs pa rnams kyi dang po chad pa la skad cig ces bya'o //
translated: The time it takes for the tip of a finger to snap is called one instant.

original: de bas na skyes bu stobs dang ldan pas se gol gtogs pa tsam la skad cig drug cu rtsa lnga 'da'o //
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu stobs dang ldan pas se gol gtogs pa tsam la skad cig drug cu rtsa lnga 'da'o //
translated: Therefore, in the time it takes for a strong man to snap his fingers, sixty-five instants pass.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la mi mkhas pa'i blo can dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la mi mkhas pa'i blo can dag gis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Those who are not skilled in the characteristics of the Dharma taught by the Blessed One, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don drug la snyegs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don drug la snyegs te /
translated: The word Blessed One is used for six meanings.

original: dbang dang rab tu ldan pa dang // gzugs bzang ba dang grags pa dang // dpal dang ye shes nan tan dang // drug po rnams la legs zhes bya ba de la mnga' bas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: dbang dang rab tu ldan pa dang // gzugs bzang ba dang grags pa dang // dpal dang ye shes nan tan dang // drug po rnams la legs zhes bya ba de la mnga' bas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Blessed One is so called because he is the master of the six: power, complete nobility, good lineage, glory, knowledge, and practice.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa de ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa de ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is the teaching of the Blessed One?

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristics of the dharmas.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i blo can gang yin pa de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i blo can dag go //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i blo can gang yin pa de dag bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i blo can dag go //
translated: Those who are wise in the characteristics of the dharmas are the wise ones in the characteristics of the dharmas taught by the Blessed One.

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word eva has the meaning of just.

original: chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i blo can nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi mtshan nyid la mkhas pa'i blo can nyid do //
translated: They are just wise in the characteristics of the dharmas.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba de dag gi 'bras bu ni de'i 'bras bu'o //🔽de'i 'bras bu'i khyad par ni bye brag go //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba de dag gi 'bras bu ni de'i 'bras bu'o // de'i 'bras bu'i khyad par ni bye brag go //
translated: The result of those minds and mental factors is their result.🔽The distinction in that result is the distinction in the result.

original: de'i 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong ba ni de'i 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong ba ni de'i 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong ba ste /
translated: Seeing that distinction in the result is seeing the distinction in the result.

original: de'i bye brag mthong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i bye brag mthong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The specific is called “seeing.”

original: dper na g-yengs pa ni glu len /
analyzed: dper na g-yengs pa ni glu len /
translated: For example, a distracted person sings a song.

original: khros pa ni tshig rtsub mi sgra /
analyzed: khros pa ni tshig rtsub mi sgra /
translated: An angry person speaks harsh words.

original: sgyu dang @264b ldan pa ni gzhan la 'drid pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgyu dang @264b ldan pa ni gzhan la 'drid pa lta bu'o //
translated: A deceitful person deceives others.

original: rnam pa 'dis ni rigs gzhan zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba de rdzas gzhan yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis ni rigs gzhan zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba de rdzas gzhan yod pa nyid do //
translated: By this method, “another type” means that mind and mental factors are substantially different.

original: skyon med pa zhes bya ba ni nyes pa med pa ste /
analyzed: skyon med pa zhes bya ba ni nyes pa med pa ste /
translated: “Faultless” means without fault.

original: the tshom med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: the tshom med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Without doubt” is the meaning.

original: rtogs zhes bya ba ni khong du chud ngo zhes so //
analyzed: rtogs zhes bya ba ni khong du chud ngo zhes so //
translated: “Realization” means understanding.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “The scriptures of the Well-Gone One” and so on.

original: legs par gshegs pas ni bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: legs par gshegs pas ni bde bar gshegs pa ste /
translated: “Well-gone” means “gone well.”

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab 'chad pa'i slob dpon de dag la gang dag gis bsnyen bkur ma byas pa de dag 'khrul pa'i blo gros can dag ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i gsung rab 'chad pa'i slob dpon de dag la gang dag gis bsnyen bkur ma byas pa de dag 'khrul pa'i blo gros can dag ste /
translated: Those who do not respect those masters who explain the scriptures of the Well-Gone One are confused.

original: rigs gzhan khong du mi chud mi rtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs gzhan khong du mi chud mi rtogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the term is that one does not understand or comprehend other types of dharmas.🔽The Sūtra states that there are three contaminants, because there are different intentions in the Vinaya.

original: zag pa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa 'di dag zag pa la sogs pas ming tha dad par mdo las gsungs pa de yongs su bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zag pa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa 'di dag zag pa la sogs pas ming tha dad par mdo las gsungs pa de yongs su bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it says:

original: zag pa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba 'di brjod do //
analyzed: zag pa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba 'di brjod do //
translated: The contaminants are three.

original: rdzas lnga bcu rtsa bzhi ni srid pa'i zag pa zhes bya ba 'di la gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i rmugs pa dang rgod pa ci'i phyir ma smos she na /
analyzed: rdzas lnga bcu rtsa bzhi ni srid pa'i zag pa zhes bya ba 'di la gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i rmugs pa dang rgod pa ci'i phyir ma smos she na /
translated: Why are lethargy and excitedness not mentioned in the formless realm in the statement: “The forty-four substances are the contaminant of existence”?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: rang dbang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang dbang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not independent.

original: rang dbang ni rang gtso bo'o //
analyzed: rang dbang ni rang gtso bo'o //
translated: Independence is the state of being the principal factor.

original: de gnyis ni der nyon mongs pa gzhan dag gis zil gyis non pa'i phyir rang dbang med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni der nyon mongs pa gzhan dag gis zil gyis non pa'i phyir rang dbang med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those two are called “not independent” because they are overwhelmed by other afflictions there.

original: zag pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba ma rig pa yin pas /
analyzed: zag pa thams cad kyi rtsa ba ma rig pa yin pas /
translated: Since ignorance is the root of all contaminants,

original: ma rig pa'i zag pa logs shig tu smos so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i zag pa logs shig tu smos so //
translated: the contaminant of ignorance is mentioned separately.

original: 'jog ces bya ba ni gzhog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jog ces bya ba ni gzhog pa'o //
translated: “To settle” means to place.

original: zag pa ni de'i sgo nas 'byung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa ni de'i sgo nas 'byung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “To flow” means to flow forth through that.

original: de dag ma yin pa nyon mongs pa gzhan dang ldan pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag ma yin pa nyon mongs pa gzhan dang ldan pa rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those who are not like that are those who are associated with other defilements.

original: de zhes bya ba 'dis ni lta ba dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba 'dis ni lta ba dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa gzung ngo //
translated: Here, “that” refers to the ignorance associated with the afflicted view of self.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnams so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnams so //
translated: “Other defilements” refers to attachment and so on.

original: rdzas brgya rtsa brgyad po de ni ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa bco lnga dang bral ba bag la nyal ba brgyad cu rtsa gsum dang / kun nas dkris te 'dug pa bcu po de dag dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang ma 'dres pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga ni rdzas brgya rtsa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: rdzas brgya rtsa brgyad po de ni ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa bco lnga dang bral ba bag la nyal ba brgyad cu rtsa gsum dang / kun nas dkris te 'dug pa bcu po de dag dang ldan pa'i ma rig pa dang ma 'dres pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga ni rdzas brgya rtsa brgyad yin no //
translated: The one hundred and eight substances are the fifteen types of unmixed ignorance, the eighty-three latent states, and the ten envelopers. The ignorance that is not mixed with those is associated with them. That is the one hundred and eight substances.
