original: sbyor ba rnams kyang tshul 'di dang 'dra ste zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang / srid pa'i sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba rnams so //
analyzed: sbyor ba rnams kyang tshul 'di dang 'dra ste zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i sbyor ba dang / srid pa'i sbyor ba dang / lta ba'i sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa'i sbyor ba rnams so //
translated: The fetters are the fetter of desire, the fetter of existence, the fetter of views, and the fetter of ignorance.

original: yang na 'khri ba'i don te zhes bya ba ni dper na dar gyi srin bus bdag gis bdag dkris nas 'chi bar gtod pa de @265a * //
analyzed: yang na 'khri ba'i don te zhes bya ba ni dper na dar gyi srin bus bdag gis bdag dkris nas 'chi bar gtod pa de @265a * //
translated: Or, they are called fetters because they bind, just as a silkworm is bound by its own making.

original: bzhin du sems can 'di dag kyang rang gi las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bdag dkris nas ngan song rnams su gtod par byed do //
analyzed: bzhin du sems can 'di dag kyang rang gi las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis bdag dkris nas ngan song rnams su gtod par byed do //
translated: In the same way, these sentient beings are bound by their own actions and afflictions and are led to the miserable realms.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rdzas drug ni zhes bya ba ni khams kyi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa rdzas drug ni zhes bya ba ni khams kyi bye brag gis so //
translated: The overesteeming of morality and asceticism is six real entities, due to the distinction of realms.

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa rdzas bcu gnyis kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa rdzas bcu gnyis kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The overesteeming of views is twelve real entities.

original: sgrib pa ni lnga ste zhes bya ba la 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa dang / gnod sems kyi sgrib pa dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sgrib pa dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa ni lnga ste zhes bya ba la 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa dang / gnod sems kyi sgrib pa dang / rmugs pa dang gnyid kyi sgrib pa dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa'i sgrib pa dang / the tshom gyi sgrib pa'o //
translated: the hindrance of sensual desire, the hindrance of ill will, the hindrance of lethargy-sleep, the hindrance of excitation-regret, and the hindrance of doubt.

original: de la kha cig khams gsum pa'i rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang / the tshom rnams gzung ngam /
analyzed: de la kha cig khams gsum pa'i rmugs pa dang rgod pa dang / the tshom rnams gzung ngam /
translated: Some say that the hindrances are lethargy-excitation and doubt belonging to the three realms.

original: 'on te 'dod pa dang ldan pa nyid ce na /🔽smras pa dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'on te 'dod pa dang ldan pa nyid ce na / smras pa dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Others say that they belong to the realm of desire.🔽The sutras say:

original: sgrib pa lnga po 'di 'ba' zhig gis mi dge ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs so zhes mdo las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga po 'di 'ba' zhig gis mi dge ba'i phung po yongs su rdzogs so zhes mdo las 'byung ngo //
translated: “Monks, the five hindrances are the complete set of the aggregates of nonvirtue.”

original: mi dge ba'i sgra bstan pas ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid gzung ngo //🔽ci'i phyir rmugs pa dang gnyid ces gcig tu bsdus /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i sgra bstan pas ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid gzung ngo // ci'i phyir rmugs pa dang gnyid ces gcig tu bsdus /
translated: The word “nonvirtue” indicates that the hindrances belong to the realm of desire.🔽Why are lethargy and sleep combined into one hindrance?

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa gnyis la sgrib pa gcig tu bshad /
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pa gnyis la sgrib pa gcig tu bshad /
translated: Why are excitation and regret explained as one hindrance?

original: smras pa / bya ba gcig pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / bya ba gcig pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are combined because they have the same function.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid de gnyis kyis ni sems zhum par byed do //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid de gnyis kyis ni sems zhum par byed do //
translated: Torpor and sleep cause the mind to be depressed.

original: rgod pa dang 'gyod pas ni sems ma zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: rgod pa dang 'gyod pas ni sems ma zhi bar byed do //
translated: Excitement and regret cause the mind to be agitated.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i the tshom rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i the tshom rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Doubt in the realm of desire is of four types:

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang ; lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang ; lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag go //
translated: to be abandoned by insight into suffering, into the origin of suffering, into the cessation of suffering, and into the path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam dang gnas zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang de'i gnas bsam gtan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dang gnas zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang de'i gnas bsam gtan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The noble path and its basis are the noble path of the eight factors and its basis, the meditative development of the absorptions, etc.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spong ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spong ba ste /
translated: Freedom from attachment is the relinquishment of the defilements.

original: mi rtogs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyi bden pa bzhi rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtogs pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyi bden pa bzhi rtogs pa'o //
translated: The four truths are realized through the aspects of non-imagination, etc.

original: de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: bzod pa rnams so //
analyzed: bzod pa rnams so //
translated: They are the receptivities.

original: de la sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam la sbyor ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam la sbyor ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The application to the noble path is that of those who are endowed with the receptivities.

original: de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: dge ba'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams te /
translated: They are the wholesome factors.

original: dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa rnams dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams so //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mo dang / bzod pa rnams dang / 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams so //
translated: heat, summit, patience, and the supreme mundane factors.

original: de la dro bar gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de la dro bar gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The roots of good of heat are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: rnam pa drug go //
translated: They are of six aspects.

original: dro bar gyur pa dang 'dra bas dro bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa dang 'dra bas dro bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: They are called heat because they are similar to heat.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi me'i snga ltas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi me'i snga ltas so //
translated: They are the sign of the fire of the noble path.

original: de dag che ba'i dus na ni rtse mo'o //
analyzed: de dag che ba'i dus na ni rtse mo'o //
translated: When they are strong, they are called summit.

original: yang na thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba skyes nas thob pa'i dge ba'i rtsa @265b ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: yang na thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba skyes nas thob pa'i dge ba'i rtsa @265b ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: Or else, they are the roots of good arisen from hearing, from reflection, from cultivation, and innate.

original: de dang de nas khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / sa'i bye brag bshad pa'i khams de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dang de nas khams dang / 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / sa'i bye brag bshad pa'i khams de gang zhe na /
translated: The realms, destinies, wombs, and stages have been mentioned. What is the meaning of realm?

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa khams gsum mo //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa khams gsum mo //
translated: The three realms are desire, etc.

original: gnas gzhan dag bstan pa la 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur bas de dag go rims bzhin du khams gsum mo //
analyzed: gnas gzhan dag bstan pa la 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags rgyas par 'gyur bas de dag go rims bzhin du khams gsum mo //
translated: The other realms are the three realms of desire, form, and formlessness.

original: de la 'dod pa gtso bor byed pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa gtso bor byed pa rnams ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The realm of desire is so called because desire is predominant there.

original: 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag ste /
translated: Desire is the five objects of sense desire,

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya rnams so //
translated: namely, visible form, sound, smell, taste, and the tangible.

original: de bzhin du gzugs gtso bor byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs gtso bor byed pa'o //
translated: The realm of form is so called because form is predominant there.

original: gzugs med pa dag ni gzugs yod pa ma yin pas gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag ni gzugs yod pa ma yin pas gzugs med pa'o //
translated: The formless realm is so called because there is no form there.🔽The realm of desire is divided into twenty places.

original: de la 'dod pa'i khams na gnas rnam pa nyi shu la sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad ces bya ba la /🔽de dag na chags su rung ba cung zad kyang med pas sems can dmyal ba dag go //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i khams na gnas rnam pa nyi shu la sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad ces bya ba la / de dag na chags su rung ba cung zad kyang med pas sems can dmyal ba dag go //
translated: The eight hot hells are called hot because they are places of torment.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /🔽yang 'tshol sogs pa'o//
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /🔽yang 'tshol sogs pa'o//
translated: What are they?🔽They are the Reviving Hell, the Black Line Hell, the Crushing Hell, the Hell of Screaming, the Hell of Great Screaming, the Hell of Heat, the Hell of Intense Heat, and the Reviving Hell.

original: sems can gang dag der skyes pa de dag phan tshun du gnod pa byas nas brgyal te 'khod pa dang de dag la bsil ba'i rlung langs shing kva'i sems can dag yang sos shig ces sgra 'byung ste /
analyzed: sems can gang dag der skyes pa de dag phan tshun du gnod pa byas nas brgyal te 'khod pa dang de dag la bsil ba'i rlung langs shing kva'i sems can dag yang sos shig ces sgra 'byung ste /
translated: Those sentient beings who are born there are mutually hostile and, having killed each other, they lie there unconscious. Then a cool wind blows on them and the sound “Come, sentient being, come!” is heard.

original: de dag der bsad cing der yang 'tsho bas yang 'tsho'o //
analyzed: de dag der bsad cing der yang 'tsho bas yang 'tsho'o //
translated: They are killed there and they live there, thus it is called “reviving”.

original: thig nag ces bya ba ni thig skud nag pos btab te /
analyzed: thig nag ces bya ba ni thig skud nag pos btab te /
translated: “Black line” is so called because they are marked with black lines and

original: shing bzhin du gshegs pas thig nag go //
analyzed: shing bzhin du gshegs pas thig nag go //
translated: are led about like cattle.

original: bsdus 'joms zhes bya ba ni sems can mang du bsdus nas khang pa la sogs par 'joms pas bsdus 'joms so //
analyzed: bsdus 'joms zhes bya ba ni sems can mang du bsdus nas khang pa la sogs par 'joms pas bsdus 'joms so //
translated: “Crushing” is so called because many sentient beings are crushed together and crushed in houses, etc.

original: ngu 'bod ni sems can dag las kyi 'bras bu ma rungs pas gtses pa'i sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag nas ku co 'don pas ngu 'bod do //
analyzed: ngu 'bod ni sems can dag las kyi 'bras bu ma rungs pas gtses pa'i sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag nas ku co 'don pas ngu 'bod do //
translated: “Weeping” is so called because sentient beings there are tormented by the suffering of the fruition of evil karma and they cry out.

original: ngu 'bod chen po ni gang na de 'dra ba'i shas che ba'i phyir ngu 'bod chen po'o //
analyzed: ngu 'bod chen po ni gang na de 'dra ba'i shas che ba'i phyir ngu 'bod chen po'o //
translated: “Great weeping” is so called because that is so in a greater degree.

original: tsha ba ni me lce mang pos bskor te lus kun du gdungs pa'i phyir tsha ba'o //
analyzed: tsha ba ni me lce mang pos bskor te lus kun du gdungs pa'i phyir tsha ba'o //
translated: The Hot Hell is so called because the bodies of the beings there are burned by the many tongues of flame that surround them.

original: rab tu tsha ba ni lus chen por mngon par grub la sdug bsngal chen pos lus dang sems kun du gdung ba chen po myong bas rab tu tsha ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu tsha ba ni lus chen por mngon par grub la sdug bsngal chen pos lus dang sems kun du gdung ba chen po myong bas rab tu tsha ba'o //
translated: The Extremely Hot Hell is so called because the bodies of the beings there are huge and they experience great suffering, with their bodies and minds burning intensely.

original: rab ces bya ba'i sgra ni yun ring ba dang mi bzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab ces bya ba'i sgra ni yun ring ba dang mi bzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “extremely” is used because the suffering there is long-lasting and unbearable.

original: bdun po de dag na rnam par smin pa'i bde ba ni med mod kyi bsil ba'i rlung la sogs pas reg pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i bde ba ni yod do //
analyzed: bdun po de dag na rnam par smin pa'i bde ba ni med mod kyi bsil ba'i rlung la sogs pas reg pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i bde ba ni yod do //
translated: Although there is no happiness as a karmic maturation in these seven hells, there is happiness as a natural outcome, because the beings there are touched by cool breezes and so forth.

original: gang na de'i skabs kyang med pa de bde ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir mnar med pa'o //
analyzed: gang na de'i skabs kyang med pa de bde ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir mnar med pa'o //
translated: The Hell Without Respite is so called because there is no opportunity for happiness there.

original: @266a * // yang na de na sdug bsngal la bar skabs med pas mnar med pa ste /
analyzed: @266a * // yang na de na sdug bsngal la bar skabs med pas mnar med pa ste /
translated: Or, it is called the Hell Without Respite because there is no respite from suffering there.

original: bar chad med cing skabs med par de na sdug bsngal mong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bar chad med cing skabs med par de na sdug bsngal mong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that the suffering there is uninterrupted and without respite.

original: 'di ltar de na phyogs bcu nas me lce byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de na phyogs bcu nas me lce byung ste /
translated: Thus, in this hell, flames from the ten directions

original: sems can gyi lus la rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu 'bar zhing shi bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi lus la rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu 'bar zhing shi bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: burn the bodies of the sentient beings continuously, but they do not die.

original: bkres pa dang skom pa'i me yang rtag par yod do //🔽de'i ngos re re la ni dpag tshad nyi khri nyi khri yod do //
analyzed: bkres pa dang skom pa'i me yang rtag par yod do // de'i ngos re re la ni dpag tshad nyi khri nyi khri yod do //
translated: The fire of hunger and thirst is also always present.🔽Each side of this hell is 20,000 yojanas.

original: 'di'i 'og na yod de 'dzam bu'i gling nas 'og tu dpag tshad nyi khri na de'i steng gi ngos la thug go //
analyzed: 'di'i 'og na yod de 'dzam bu'i gling nas 'og tu dpag tshad nyi khri na de'i steng gi ngos la thug go //
translated: It is located below Jambudvīpa, 20,000 yojanas below Jambudvīpa, and its upper surface touches the bottom of Avīci.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling ni 'og yangs te 'bru'i phung po ltar gnas so ;
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling ni 'og yangs te 'bru'i phung po ltar gnas so ;
translated: Jambudvīpa is located below this hell, like a pile of grain.

original: / de bas na rgya mtsho chen po ni bags kyis gzhol lo //
analyzed: / de bas na rgya mtsho chen po ni bags kyis gzhol lo //
translated: Therefore the great ocean gradually slopes downward.

original: dud 'gro ni dud de 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: dud 'gro ni dud de 'gro ba ste /
translated: Animals are called animals because they move about on their bellies.

original: 'dong zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dong zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the term is that.

original: de dag gi nang nas klu rnams ni bskal par gnas shing kha cig sa la brten to //
analyzed: de dag gi nang nas klu rnams ni bskal par gnas shing kha cig sa la brten to //
translated: Among them, nāgas live for an eon and some live on the earth.

original: yi dags ni skom pa dang ldan pas yi dags te kha cig ni mthu che 'o //
analyzed: yi dags ni skom pa dang ldan pas yi dags te kha cig ni mthu che 'o //
translated: Pretas are called pretas because they are tormented by thirst. Some have great power.

original: kha cig ni mthu chung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig ni mthu chung ngo //
translated: Some say: The northern side is shorter.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling ni sog kha ste byang phyogs kha tshon che'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling ni sog kha ste byang phyogs kha tshon che'o //
translated: Jambudvīpa is like a chariot.🔽Each of its three long sides is 2,000 yojanas.

original: de'i ngos ring po gsum gyi ngos re re la ni dpag tshad nyis stong nyis stong yod do //🔽ngos thung ngu la ni dpag tshad phyed dang bzhi yod do //
analyzed: de'i ngos ring po gsum gyi ngos re re la ni dpag tshad nyis stong nyis stong yod do // ngos thung ngu la ni dpag tshad phyed dang bzhi yod do //
translated: The short side is 1,250 yojanas.

original: de bas na bye brag tu bshad pa las /
analyzed: de bas na bye brag tu bshad pa las /
translated: Therefore the great treatise states:

original: rdzu 'phrul dang mi ldan pas nyi ma gcig gcig gis ngos gcig tu 'gro ba yod dam zhes dris pa de la de'i tshad kyis lan btab po //🔽shar gyi lus 'phags ni zla ba kham pa 'dra'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang mi ldan pas nyi ma gcig gcig gis ngos gcig tu 'gro ba yod dam zhes dris pa de la de'i tshad kyis lan btab po // shar gyi lus 'phags ni zla ba kham pa 'dra'o //
translated: If one asks, is it possible for someone who does not possess supernormal knowledge to travel to one side in one day?🔽The answer is that it is possible to travel to one side in one day.🔽Videha in the east is like a half moon.

original: nub kyi ba lang spyod ni zla ba nya ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nub kyi ba lang spyod ni zla ba nya ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: Godānīya in the west is like a full moon.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan ni rdzing bu 'dra'o //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan ni rdzing bu 'dra'o //
translated: Kurava in the north is like a pond.

original: de la gling gi dbyibs ci 'dra bar mi rnams kyi bzhin gyi dbyibs kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de la gling gi dbyibs ci 'dra bar mi rnams kyi bzhin gyi dbyibs kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The shape of the faces of humans there is similar to the shape of the continents.

original: de la 'dzam bu'i gling na ni tshe la nges pa med de dpag tu med pa nas lo bcu la thug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'dzam bu'i gling na ni tshe la nges pa med de dpag tu med pa nas lo bcu la thug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: In Jambudvīpa, the life expectancy is not determined: it is infinite at the beginning, diminishes until it is ten years in length, and then increases again until it is eighty thousand years.

original: shar gyi lus 'phags na ni lo nyis brgya lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: shar gyi lus 'phags na ni lo nyis brgya lnga bcu'o //
translated: In Pūrvavideha, it is two hundred and fifty years;

original: nub kyi ba lang sbyong na ni lnga brgya'o //
analyzed: nub kyi ba lang sbyong na ni lnga brgya'o //
translated: in Godānīya, it is five hundred years;

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan na ni lo stong ste /
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan na ni lo stong ste /
translated: in Kuru, it is one thousand years.

original: bar ma dor 'chi ba med do //
analyzed: bar ma dor 'chi ba med do //
translated: Death does not occur before its time.

original: gzhan na ni bar ma dor 'chi ba yod do zhes bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan na ni bar ma dor 'chi ba yod do zhes bshad pa yin te /
translated: In the other continents, death does occur before its time.

original: de dag kyang nga'i ba med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med do //
analyzed: de dag kyang nga'i ba med cing yongs su 'dzin pa med do //
translated: These life spans are the normal life span, the natural life span.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha drug ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha drug ste /
translated: There are six gods of the realm of desire.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris zhes bya ba ni de dag rgyal chen bzhi'i gnas su skyes pa'i phyir rgyal chen bzhi'i ris @266b so ;
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris zhes bya ba ni de dag rgyal chen bzhi'i gnas su skyes pa'i phyir rgyal chen bzhi'i ris @266b so ;
translated: The Caturmaharajakayikas are called this because they are born in the abodes of the Four Great Kings.

original: / yang na rgyal chen bzhi pa ste rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag de dag gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / yang na rgyal chen bzhi pa ste rgyal po chen po bzhi po dag de dag gi dbang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the Four Great Kings are the lords of these gods.

original: sum cu rtsa gsum zhes bya ba ni nya ba'i dbang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang sum cu rtsa gsum pa brgya byin yod pas sum cu rtsa gsum mo //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum zhes bya ba ni nya ba'i dbang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang sum cu rtsa gsum pa brgya byin yod pas sum cu rtsa gsum mo //
translated: The Thirty-three is so called because there are thirty-two gods who are lords of the Yaksas, and the thirty-third is Sakra.

original: 'thab bral zhes bya ba ni lha ma yin dang / 'thab pa'i sdug bsngal las 'das te med pa'i phyir 'thab bral lo //
analyzed: 'thab bral zhes bya ba ni lha ma yin dang / 'thab pa'i sdug bsngal las 'das te med pa'i phyir 'thab bral lo //
translated: The Yamas are so called because they have passed beyond the suffering of conflict with the titans.

original: dga' ldan zhes bya ba ni dga' ba thob pa dang ldan par gnas pas dga' ldan no //🔽'phrul dga' zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dag rang gis sprul te /
analyzed: dga' ldan zhes bya ba ni dga' ba thob pa dang ldan par gnas pas dga' ldan no // 'phrul dga' zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dag rang gis sprul te /
translated: Tushita is so called because the gods there are satisfied with the joy of Dharma.

original: spyod pas 'phrul dga'o //
analyzed: spyod pas 'phrul dga'o //
translated: The Nirmanaratis are so called because they enjoy the play of creating their own enjoyments.

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ces bya ba ni gzhan gyis sprul pa'i 'dod pa rnams la dbang byed cing dbang sgyur bas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed do //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed ces bya ba ni gzhan gyis sprul pa'i 'dod pa rnams la dbang byed cing dbang sgyur bas gzhan 'phrul dbang byed do //
translated: The Paranirmitavasavartins are so called because they enjoy the play of creating the enjoyments of others.

original: de la grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba ma smos pa ni tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba dag gi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba ma smos pa ni tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba dag gi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cold hells are not mentioned because they are located in one part of the hot hells.

original: tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba la shas che ba bcu drug ste ;
analyzed: tsha ba'i sems can dmyal ba la shas che ba bcu drug ste ;
translated: The hells of heat have sixteen additional hells:

original: me ma mur dang / rtug sa dang / sbu gri'i sos gang ba'i lam po che dang / ral gri'i so'i lo ma can gyi nags tshal dang lcags kyi shal ma ri'i nags tshal rnams ni spyir na mtshon char 'dra bas gcig tu bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: me ma mur dang / rtug sa dang / sbu gri'i sos gang ba'i lam po che dang / ral gri'i so'i lo ma can gyi nags tshal dang lcags kyi shal ma ri'i nags tshal rnams ni spyir na mtshon char 'dra bas gcig tu bsdus pa dang /
translated: the Hell of Fiery Embers, the Hell of Rotting Corpses, the Hell of the Road of Razor Blades, the Hell of the Forest with Leaves of Swords, and the Hell of the Iron Grater.

original: chu klung rgal dka' ba sta rdzas su ni bzhi sgo'i bye brag gis ni bcu drug go //
analyzed: chu klung rgal dka' ba sta rdzas su ni bzhi sgo'i bye brag gis ni bcu drug go //
translated: The River with Waves of Swords is the fourth.

original: gnod pa lhag par che ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir shas che ba zhes bya'o //🔽gling de dag gi gling phran la g-yag rnga dang g-yag rnga gzhan ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi 'khor to //🔽lus dang lus 'phags ni shar gyi lus 'phags kyi 'khor to //
analyzed: gnod pa lhag par che ba'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir shas che ba zhes bya'o // gling de dag gi gling phran la g-yag rnga dang g-yag rnga gzhan ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi 'khor to // lus dang lus 'phags ni shar gyi lus 'phags kyi 'khor to //
translated: They are called “additional” because they are places of special harm.🔽The subcontinents of these continents are: Godānīya and Uttaramantrin, which are the subcontinents of Jambudvīpa;🔽Videha and Kuru, which are the subcontinents of Videha;

original: g-yo ldan dang lam mchog 'gro ni nub gyi ba lang spyod kyi 'khor to //
analyzed: g-yo ldan dang lam mchog 'gro ni nub gyi ba lang spyod kyi 'khor to //
translated: Cāmara and Avara, which are the subcontinents of Godānīya;🔽and Sathas and Uttaramantrin, which are the subcontinents of Kuru.

original: sgra ngan dang sgra ngan can ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi 'khor to //
analyzed: sgra ngan dang sgra ngan can ni byang gi sgra mi snyan gyi 'khor to //
translated: Kuru and Kuru-tora are the continents of Uttarakuru.

original: g-yag rnga dang g-yag rnga gzhan de gcig na srin po dag gnas so //
analyzed: g-yag rnga dang g-yag rnga gzhan de gcig na srin po dag gnas so //
translated: Ruru and Kuru are the continents of the west and the north.

original: de la ri rab ni rin po che sna bzhi'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de la ri rab ni rin po che sna bzhi'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Meru is made of four kinds of jewels, gold, silver, lapis lazuli, crystal.

original: gser dang dngul dang bee d'urya dang shel gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gser dang dngul dang bee d'urya dang shel gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: The side which is gold faces Jambudvipa; the side which is silver faces Godaniya; the side which is lapis lazuli faces Videha; the side which is crystal faces Kuru.

original: ngos gang rin po che gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de'i nam mkha' yang de'i rnam par snang ngo //🔽de ni rim pas mtho ste /
analyzed: ngos gang rin po che gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de'i nam mkha' yang de'i rnam par snang ngo // de ni rim pas mtho ste /
translated: The sky above each of these continents appears colored accordingly.

original: gru bzhi lham pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gru bzhi lham pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Meru is not flat on the top; it is higher in the center.

original: de skad bshad pa'i 'thad pa ni 'dul ba'i gzhung las 'byung ste /
analyzed: de skad bshad pa'i 'thad pa ni 'dul ba'i gzhung las 'byung ste /
translated: The Sūtra on the Explication of the Thought says:🔽In the question of Upāli, it says:

original: nye sbyor gyis zhus pa las btsun pa mchod rten ji ltar bgyi zhes gsol na /🔽ri rab kyi tshul @267a * //
analyzed: nye sbyor gyis zhus pa las btsun pa mchod rten ji ltar bgyi zhes gsol na / ri rab kyi tshul @267a * //
translated: “Venerable One, how should one make a stūpa?”

original: du bya'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: du bya'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: “One should make it like Meru.”

original: de'i 'khor ri bo bdun te /
analyzed: de'i 'khor ri bo bdun te /
translated: The seven mountain chains which surround Meru are made of gold.

original: gnya' shing 'dzin dang / gshol mda' 'dzin dang / seng ldeng can dang / lta na sdug dang / rta rna dang / rnam par 'dud dang / mu khyud 'dzin to //
analyzed: gnya' shing 'dzin dang / gshol mda' 'dzin dang / seng ldeng can dang / lta na sdug dang / rta rna dang / rnam par 'dud dang / mu khyud 'dzin to //
translated: Yugandhara, Īṣādhara, Khadiraka, Sudarśana, Aśvakarṇa, Vinataka, and Nimindhara.

original: de dag ni gser gyi ri ste phyed phyed kyis dma' bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni gser gyi ri ste phyed phyed kyis dma' bar rig par bya'o //
translated: These are the golden mountains, which are to be known as half as high as the one preceding it.

original: de la 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi gang lus che ba de'i lus kyi tshad ni khru bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi gang lus che ba de'i lus kyi tshad ni khru bzhi ste /
translated: The human beings of Jambudvīpa are at most four elbows in height.

original: shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa'o //🔽shar gyi lus 'phags po dag ni de las nyis 'gyur nyis 'gyur gyis che'o //
analyzed: shing n+ya gro dha ltar chu zheng gab pa'o // shar gyi lus 'phags po dag ni de las nyis 'gyur nyis 'gyur gyis che'o //
translated: They are like a nyagrodha tree, which is as wide as it is tall.🔽The human beings of Videha in the east are twice that,

original: nub kyi ba lang spyod pa dag kyang de las nyis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nub kyi ba lang spyod pa dag kyang de las nyis 'gyur ro //
translated: and the human beings of Godānīya in the west are twice that.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dag kyang de las nyis 'gyur ro //🔽rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams ni khru lnga brgya'o //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan pa dag kyang de las nyis 'gyur ro // rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams ni khru lnga brgya'o //
translated: The human beings of Kuru in the north are twice that.🔽The gods of the Caturmahārājika realm are five hundred cubits in height.

original: khru'i tshul gyis lo grangs kyang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: khru'i tshul gyis lo grangs kyang rig par bya ste /
translated: The life span of the gods of the Caturmahārājika realm is five hundred years.

original: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi tshe tshad ni mi'i lo lnga bcu la zhag tu brtsis pa'i lo lnga brgya thub po //
analyzed: rgyal chen bzhi'i ris kyi lha rnams kyi tshe tshad ni mi'i lo lnga bcu la zhag tu brtsis pa'i lo lnga brgya thub po //
translated: The life expectancy of the gods of Kamadhatu is calculated in years of mortals;🔽but multiplied by a certain number of thousands.🔽The life expectancy of the Caturmaharajakayikas is five hundred years, calculated as one day;

original: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi lus kyi tshad ni khru stong ngo //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams kyi lus kyi tshad ni khru stong ngo //
translated: the life expectancy of the Trayastrimsas is one thousand years, calculated as one day;🔽and so on up to the Paranirmitavasavartins whose life expectancy is sixteen thousand years, calculated as one day.🔽The life expectancy of the gods of Kamadhatu is calculated in years of mortals;

original: tshe'i tshad ni mi'i lo brgya la zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i lo stong thub bo //
analyzed: tshe'i tshad ni mi'i lo brgya la zhag gcig tu brtsis pa'i lo stong thub bo //
translated: but multiplied by a certain number of thousands.🔽The life expectancy of the Caturmaharajakayikas is five hundred years, calculated as one day;🔽the life expectancy of the Trayastrimsas is one thousand years, calculated as one day;🔽and so on up to the Paranirmitavasavartins whose life expectancy is sixteen thousand years, calculated as one day.

original: de bzhin du nyis 'gyur nyis 'gyur gyis zhag gcig tu brtsis te tshe'i tshad ni lo drug stong gi bar du sbyar ro //🔽lus kyi tshad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nyis 'gyur nyis 'gyur gyis zhag gcig tu brtsis te tshe'i tshad ni lo drug stong gi bar du sbyar ro // lus kyi tshad brjod par bya ste /
translated: The life expectancy of the gods of Kamadhatu is calculated in years of mortals;🔽but multiplied by a certain number of thousands.🔽The life expectancy of the Caturmaharajakayikas is five hundred years, calculated as one day;

original: lus kyi tshad ni rgyang grags phyed dang gnyis so //
analyzed: lus kyi tshad ni rgyang grags phyed dang gnyis so //
translated: the life expectancy of the Trayastrimsas is one thousand years, calculated as one day;

original: 'di dag ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnas nyi shu ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnas nyi shu ste /
translated: and so on up to the Paranirmitavasavartins whose life expectancy is sixteen thousand years, calculated as one day.🔽The life expectancy of the gods of Kamadhatu is calculated in years of mortals;🔽but multiplied by a certain number of thousands.🔽The life expectancy of the Caturmaharajakayikas is five hundred years, calculated as one day;🔽the life expectancy of the Trayastrimsas is one thousand years, calculated as one day;

original: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed nas mnar med pa la thug gi bar du snod dang bcas pa smos pas rlung gi dkyil 'khor la thug gi bar du'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'phrul dbang byed nas mnar med pa la thug gi bar du snod dang bcas pa smos pas rlung gi dkyil 'khor la thug gi bar du'o //
translated: and so on up to the Paranirmitavasavartins whose life expectancy is sixteen thousand years, calculated as one day.

original: 'dod pa'i khams bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams bshad zin to //
translated: The life expectancy of the gods of Kamadhatu is calculated in years of mortals;🔽but multiplied by a certain number of thousands.🔽The life expectancy of the Catur

original: 'di yan chad gnas bcu bdun ni gzugs kyi khams te /
analyzed: 'di yan chad gnas bcu bdun ni gzugs kyi khams te /
translated: Up to this point, the seventeen stages are the form realm.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: smras pa / de la bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang gsum pa ni so sor sa gsum gsum pa dag go //
analyzed: smras pa / de la bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang gsum pa ni so sor sa gsum gsum pa dag go //
translated: It is said: The first, second, and third absorptions each have three stages.

original: bzhi pa ni sa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni sa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The fourth has eight stages.

original: de la tshangs ris zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i ris na yod pas tshangs ris so //🔽gzhan ni tshangs 'khor te /
analyzed: de la tshangs ris zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i ris na yod pas tshangs ris so // gzhan ni tshangs 'khor te /
translated: Brahma's group is called Brahma's group because it exists in Brahma's group.🔽Brahma's ministers are Brahma's ministers.

original: tshangs pa'i yongs su spyod pa byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i yongs su spyod pa byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they act as Brahma's attendants.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir tshangs chen no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir tshangs chen no //
translated: Great Brahma is so called because it arises from great roots of virtue.

original: 'di ni chen po yang yin la tshangs pa yang yin pas tshangs chen no //
analyzed: 'di ni chen po yang yin la tshangs pa yang yin pas tshangs chen no //
translated: It is great and it is Brahma, thus it is Great Brahma.

original: de'i che ba nyid ni bsam gtan khyad par can thob pa dang / sngar skyes la phyis 'chi 'pho ba dang / mthu'i khyad par la sogs @267b pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: de'i che ba nyid ni bsam gtan khyad par can thob pa dang / sngar skyes la phyis 'chi 'pho ba dang / mthu'i khyad par la sogs @267b pas kyang ngo //
translated: Its greatness is due to attaining special absorption, being born first and dying later, and due to special powers and so on.

original: de nyid kyi ris bshad pa de dag gi gnas kyang yin pas tshangs ris rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi ris bshad pa de dag gi gnas kyang yin pas tshangs ris rnams so //
translated: They are also the abode of the Brahmakayikas.

original: ris zhes bya ba ni 'dir gnas nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: ris zhes bya ba ni 'dir gnas nyid du 'dod do //
translated: The word “class” is used here in the sense of abode.

original: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'dug ces bya ba ni tshangs pa'i mdun na gnas pas tshangs pa'i mdun na 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'dug ces bya ba ni tshangs pa'i mdun na gnas pas tshangs pa'i mdun na 'dug pa ste /
translated: The Brahmapurohitas are those who stand before Brahma.

original: bsam gtan khyad par can las langs pa na de nyid kyi mdun na 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan khyad par can las langs pa na de nyid kyi mdun na 'dug pa'o //
translated: They stand before Brahma when they rise from the special meditative state of the fourth absorption.

original: yang na tshangs pa chen po lnga la de'i 'og tu smos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na tshangs pa chen po lnga la de'i 'og tu smos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or, they are called Brahmapurohitas because they are mentioned immediately after the Mahabrahmans.

original: 'od chung zhes bya ba ni sa gong ma dag la ltos na de dag gi 'od chung bas 'od chung ngo //
analyzed: 'od chung zhes bya ba ni sa gong ma dag la ltos na de dag gi 'od chung bas 'od chung ngo //
translated: The Parittubhahas are so called because their light is small in comparison to the higher realms.

original: tshad med 'od ces bya ba ni de dag gi 'od tshad gzung bar mi nus pas tshad med 'od do //🔽'od gsal zhes bya ba ni gnas ma lus par snang ba'i phyir 'od gsal lo //
analyzed: tshad med 'od ces bya ba ni de dag gi 'od tshad gzung bar mi nus pas tshad med 'od do //🔽'od gsal zhes bya ba ni gnas ma lus par snang ba'i phyir 'od gsal lo //
translated: The Apramanabhas are so called because their light cannot be measured.🔽The Abhasvaras are so called because they illuminate all the abodes.

original: dge chung zhes bya ba ni yid kyi sa pa'i dge ba la bde ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: dge chung zhes bya ba ni yid kyi sa pa'i dge ba la bde ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The stage called Lesser Virtue is called Lesser Bliss because it is virtuous and on the level of the mental faculty.

original: de dag gi des gong ma la ltos na chung bas dge chung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi des gong ma la ltos na chung bas dge chung ngo //
translated: It is called Lesser Virtue because its virtue is lesser compared to higher stages.

original: tshad med dge zhes bya ba ni de dag gi dge ba tshad med pas tshad med dge'o //
analyzed: tshad med dge zhes bya ba ni de dag gi dge ba tshad med pas tshad med dge'o //
translated: The stage called Immeasurable Virtue is called Immeasurable Virtue because its virtue is immeasurable.

original: dge rgyas zhes bya ba ni de dag gi dge ba rgyas pas dge rgyas te /
analyzed: dge rgyas zhes bya ba ni de dag gi dge ba rgyas pas dge rgyas te /
translated: The stage called Vast Virtue is called Vast Virtue because its virtue is vast.

original: de bas gzhan bde ba mchog tu gyur pa med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //🔽sprin med ces bya ba ni de dag gi gong nas gzhan gyis chod pa med pas sprin med do //
analyzed: de bas gzhan bde ba mchog tu gyur pa med do zhes bya bar dgongs so // sprin med ces bya ba ni de dag gi gong nas gzhan gyis chod pa med pas sprin med do //
translated: It is the highest bliss because there is no bliss higher than it.🔽The stage called Cloudless is called Cloudless because it is not obscured by other higher stages.

original: sa gong ma gong ma dang 'brel pa'i ni sprin lta bu zhes zer te /🔽de nas de dang 'brel pa'i bar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa gong ma gong ma dang 'brel pa'i ni sprin lta bu zhes zer te / de nas de dang 'brel pa'i bar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The higher stages are connected to it like clouds because there is no interruption between them.

original: bsod nams 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni de dag las so so'i bsod nams bye brag can gyis 'gro ba'i gnas yod pas bsod nams 'phel te /
analyzed: bsod nams 'phel ba zhes bya ba ni de dag las so so'i bsod nams bye brag can gyis 'gro ba'i gnas yod pas bsod nams 'phel te /
translated: The stage called Increasing Merit is called Increasing Merit because it is the abode of beings who have special merit.

original: de dag la bsod nams 'phel bas kun 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag la bsod nams 'phel bas kun 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: Because their merit increases, they are like the origin of suffering.

original: 'bras bu che zhes bya ba ni de dag gi 'bras bu gnas gzhan dang 'brel pa'i so so'i skye bo thams cad pas mchog tu gyur pa 'byung bas 'bras bu che'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu che zhes bya ba ni de dag gi 'bras bu gnas gzhan dang 'brel pa'i so so'i skye bo thams cad pas mchog tu gyur pa 'byung bas 'bras bu che'o //
translated: Great fruit means that their fruit is the greatest of all ordinary beings who are connected to other abodes, because it arises.

original: gnas gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni lam gyi chus nyon mongs pa'i dri ma bkrus pa'i phyir rgyud dag pa rnams gnas pas gnas gtsang ma'o //
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni lam gyi chus nyon mongs pa'i dri ma bkrus pa'i phyir rgyud dag pa rnams gnas pas gnas gtsang ma'o //
translated: Pure abodes means that they are pure abodes because their continuums are pure, since the water of the path washes away the stains of affliction.

original: yang na de dag gi 'khor ba na gnas pa dag pas bu lon 'khor ba bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na de dag gi 'khor ba na gnas pa dag pas bu lon 'khor ba bzhin no //
translated: Or, since their abodes in samsara are pure, they are like those who repay debts.

original: yang na dag pa she dag gnas pas gnas gtsang ma ste /
analyzed: yang na dag pa she dag gnas pas gnas gtsang ma ste /
translated: Or, since pure beings abide there, they are pure abodes.

original: de na so so'i skye bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na so so'i skye bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there are no ordinary beings there.

original: mi che ba zhes bya ba ni gnas gtsang ma bas mchog tu ma gyur ba'i phyir mi che bas mi che ba'o //
analyzed: mi che ba zhes bya ba ni gnas gtsang ma bas mchog tu ma gyur ba'i phyir mi che bas mi che ba'o //
translated: Not great means that they are not great because they are not the greatest of the pure abodes.

original: yang na gzugs med par 'jug pa la 'dod pa med pa'i phyir mi 'dod @268a * //
analyzed: yang na gzugs med par 'jug pa la 'dod pa med pa'i phyir mi 'dod @268a * //
translated: Or, they are not great because they do not desire to enter the formless realm.

original: pa'o ; / mi gdung ba zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dge ba'i phyir 'og mar skyes pa rnams kyi mthu'i khyad par dag gis zil gyis mi non pas mi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / mi gdung ba zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dge ba'i phyir 'og mar skyes pa rnams kyi mthu'i khyad par dag gis zil gyis mi non pas mi gdung ba'o //
translated: The first three are called heavens of the contemplations because they are the fruits of the first three contemplations.

original: yang na bsam gtan mchog gi 'bras bu'i tshe ma thob kyang gdung ba med pas mi gdung ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bsam gtan mchog gi 'bras bu'i tshe ma thob kyang gdung ba med pas mi gdung ba'o //
translated: The fourth is called heaven of the Highest of the High because it is the fruit of the fourth contemplation.

original: gya nom snang zhes bya ba ni rab tu zhi ba'i khyad par dang ldan te bde bar snang bas gya nom snang ngo //
analyzed: gya nom snang zhes bya ba ni rab tu zhi ba'i khyad par dang ldan te bde bar snang bas gya nom snang ngo //
translated: The first three are called heavens of the contemplations because they are the fruits of the first three contemplations.🔽The fourth is called heaven of the Highest of the High because it is the fruit of the fourth contemplation.🔽The first three are called heavens of the contemplations because they are the fruits of the first three contemplations.🔽The fourth is called heaven of the Highest of the High because it is the fruit of the fourth contemplation.🔽The first three are called heavens of the contemplations because they are the fruits of the first three contemplations.🔽The fourth is called heaven of the Highest of the High because it is the fruit of the fourth contemplation.🔽The first three are called heavens of the contemplations because they are the fruits of the first three contemplations.

original: shin tu mthong zhes bya ba ni spel mar bsgom pa la sgrib pa'i lhag ma cung zad cig las su zad de /
analyzed: shin tu mthong zhes bya ba ni spel mar bsgom pa la sgrib pa'i lhag ma cung zad cig las su zad de /
translated: The fourth is called heaven of the Highest of the High because it is the fruit of the fourth contemplation.🔽The first three are called heavens of the contemplations because they are the fruits of the first three contemplations.🔽The fourth is called heaven of the Highest of the High because it is the fruit of the fourth contemplation.

original: de dag shin tu rnam par dag pa mthong bas shin tu mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dag shin tu rnam par dag pa mthong bas shin tu mthong ngo //
translated: The first three are called heavens of the contemplations because they are the fruits of the first three contemplations.🔽The fourth is called heaven of the Highest of the High because it is the fruit of the fourth contemplation.🔽The first three are called heavens of the contemplations because they are the fruits of the first three contemplations.🔽The fourth is called heaven of the Highest of the High because it is the fruit of the fourth contemplation.

original: 'og min zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gong na rang gi khams las mchog tu gyur pa'i gnas gzhan med pas 'og min no //
analyzed: 'og min zhes bya ba ni de dag gi gong na rang gi khams las mchog tu gyur pa'i gnas gzhan med pas 'og min no //
translated: The first three are called heavens of the contemplations because they are the fruits of the first three contemplations.🔽The fourth is called heaven of the Highest of the High because it is the fruit of the fourth contemplation.🔽The first three are called heavens of the contemplations because they are the fruits of the first three contemplations.

original: gzhan dag na re bsags par gnas pa ni gzugs te phung po'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bsags par gnas pa ni gzugs te phung po'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The fourth is called heaven of the Highest of the High because

original: de'i mthar phyin pas phung po'i mtha' zhes bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i mthar phyin pas phung po'i mtha' zhes bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Since it is the limit of the aggregates, it is called the limit of the aggregates.

original: yang na aa gha zhes bya ba ni sdig pa ste de'i mthar phyin pas sdig med mtha'o //
analyzed: yang na aa gha zhes bya ba ni sdig pa ste de'i mthar phyin pas sdig med mtha'o //
translated: Or, agha means sin, and since it is the limit of sin, it is the limit of sin.

original: gnas bcu bdun po de na gnas pa'i sems can dang bcas pa de dag ni gzugs kyi khams so //
analyzed: gnas bcu bdun po de na gnas pa'i sems can dang bcas pa de dag ni gzugs kyi khams so //
translated: Those seventeen abodes together with the sentient beings who abide there constitute the form realm.

original: gzhan dag ni bsam gtan dang po la ni gnyis /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni bsam gtan dang po la ni gnyis /
translated: Others say: The first absorption has two abodes.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can lhag par byas te gnas bcu bdun po gzhan du smra'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la ni 'du shes med pa'i sems can lhag par byas te gnas bcu bdun po gzhan du smra'o //
translated: The fourth absorption has seventeen abodes, with the addition of the sentient beings of the base of nothingness.

original: de gnyi ga yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang mi rigs te /
translated: Both of those are illogical.

original: tshangs pa chen po ni gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa chen po ni gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the great Brahma is one.

original: de la tshe la sogs pa'i bye brag yod du zin kyang de lha'i ris su mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de la tshe la sogs pa'i bye brag yod du zin kyang de lha'i ris su mi 'thad de /
translated: Even if there were distinctions of lifespan and so on, that is untenable as a class of gods.

original: gcig pu ni ris su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gcig pu ni ris su mi rung ngo //
translated: Because it is illogical for a single being to be a class.

original: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don gyi sems can rnams dang de skal ba mnyam pa'i phyir gnas tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i mdun na 'don gyi sems can rnams dang de skal ba mnyam pa'i phyir gnas tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Because sentient beings in the Abode of Brahma and those of equal status to it are not different abodes.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyang 'bras bu che ba dag dang tshe la sogs pa khyad par med pas de'i rgyu'i khyad par med pa'i phyir de dag bzhi pa'i gsum pa las gnas gzhan du mi 'thad pas gzugs kyi khams ni rnam pa bcu drug go
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams kyang 'bras bu che ba dag dang tshe la sogs pa khyad par med pas de'i rgyu'i khyad par med pa'i phyir de dag bzhi pa'i gsum pa las gnas gzhan du mi 'thad pas gzugs kyi khams ni rnam pa bcu drug go
translated: Thus the form realm has sixteen types.

original: zhes kha che ba'i bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
analyzed: zhes kha che ba'i bye brag tu smra ba rnams so //
translated: Thus the Kasmiri Vaibhasikas say.

original: de bas na tshangs pa chen po yang 'du shes med pa'i sems can bzhin dus gzhan med do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na tshangs pa chen po yang 'du shes med pa'i sems can bzhin dus gzhan med do zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, just as beings devoid of discernment, beings of Mahabrahma also do not exist at other times.

original: skye gnas rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams 'dren par gyur te 'byung ba thun mong du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye gnas rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams 'dren par gyur te 'byung ba thun mong du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There are four types of birth because they are the common means by which sentient beings are led to emerge.🔽Birth from a womb is the birth of humans, cattle, horses, camels and so on.

original: de la skye gnas mngal nas skye ba ni mi dang / ba lang dang / rta dang / rnga mo rnams phal cher ro //🔽mi @268b rnams kyi nang na sgo nga las skyes pa yang yod de /
analyzed: de la skye gnas mngal nas skye ba ni mi dang / ba lang dang / rta dang / rnga mo rnams phal cher ro //🔽mi @268b rnams kyi nang na sgo nga las skyes pa yang yod de /
translated: Birth from an egg is the birth of birds.🔽Birth from heat and moisture is the birth of worms, insects, moths and so on.🔽Birth by spontaneous generation is the birth of gods, hell beings and beings of the intermediate state.

original: dper na dud 'gro dag gi nang nas khrung khrung mo las byung ba /
analyzed: dper na dud 'gro dag gi nang nas khrung khrung mo las byung ba /
translated: For example, among animals, the swan came from a female swan;

original: ri dang / nya ri lta bu dang / lnga len gyi rgyal po'i bu lnga brgya lta bu'o //
analyzed: ri dang / nya ri lta bu dang / lnga len gyi rgyal po'i bu lnga brgya lta bu'o //
translated: the fish-mountain and the five hundred sons of the king of Pañcāla.

original: drod gsher las skye ba ni nga las nu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: drod gsher las skye ba ni nga las nu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Born from heat and moisture are Manu and so on.

original: rdzus te byung ba ni bskal pa dang po pa rnams so //
analyzed: rdzus te byung ba ni bskal pa dang po pa rnams so //
translated: Apparitional birth is the first eon.

original: klu rnams la yang skye ba rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: klu rnams la yang skye ba rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: Nāgas also have four types of birth.

original: 'jig rten gdags pa las ji skad du /
analyzed: 'jig rten gdags pa las ji skad du /
translated: As the Lokaprajñāpti says:

original: sgo nga las skyes pa'i nam mkha' lding gis sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu bza' ba'i phyir 'byin to //
analyzed: sgo nga las skyes pa'i nam mkha' lding gis sgo nga las skyes pa'i klu bza' ba'i phyir 'byin to //
translated: A garuḍa born from an egg lays waste to a nāga born from an egg.

original: de bzhin du rdzus te 'byung ba'i nam mkha' lding gis rdzus te byung ba'i klu 'byin ces bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzus te 'byung ba'i nam mkha' lding gis rdzus te byung ba'i klu 'byin ces bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: In the same way, a garuḍa born miraculously lays waste to a nāga born miraculously.

original: rdzus te byung ba rnams lus shin tu mi snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdzus te byung ba rnams lus shin tu mi snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those born miraculously become completely invisible.

original: til mar gyi mar me zad pa lta bu ma yin nam /
analyzed: til mar gyi mar me zad pa lta bu ma yin nam /
translated: Are they not like the extinction of a butter lamp?

original: mi shes pa'i phyir 'byin gyi bzar ni med do //
analyzed: mi shes pa'i phyir 'byin gyi bzar ni med do //
translated: One gives because of ignorance, not because of desire to eat.🔽

original: yi dags rnams ni mngal nas skyes pa dang rdzus te byung ba dag ste /🔽ji skad du yi dags nyid kyis bdag cag ni las kyis skyes pa yin gyi ;
analyzed: yi dags rnams ni mngal nas skyes pa dang rdzus te byung ba dag ste / ji skad du yi dags nyid kyis bdag cag ni las kyis skyes pa yin gyi ;
translated: They are born from a womb and by transformation.🔽As the hungry ghosts themselves say:

original: skye gnas las skyes pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: skye gnas las skyes pa ni ma yin no zhes brjod pa lta bu'o //
translated: “We are born from action, not from a womb.”🔽Why then does the Bodhisattva, who has obtained the ten masteries,

original: 'o na ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dbang bcu brnyes pa mngal nas skyes pa'i skye gnas la brten ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dbang bcu brnyes pa mngal nas skyes pa'i skye gnas la brten ce na /
translated: take birth from a womb?

original: sh'akya'i rigs chen po gnyen gyi 'brel pas chos la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sh'akya'i rigs chen po gnyen gyi 'brel pas chos la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to establish in the Dharma his relatives of the great Śākya clan.

original: mir gyur kyang phun sum tshogs pa thob po zhes gdul ba spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mir gyur kyang phun sum tshogs pa thob po zhes gdul ba spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to encourage the faithful, he shows himself as a human being who has obtained perfection.

original: sa ni bcu gcig ste zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyis ston to //
analyzed: sa ni bcu gcig ste zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyis ston to //
translated: The eleven stages are the same as those of the bodhisattva.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni sa bon thams cad yin pa'i phyir sa zhes bya bar bshad de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni sa bon thams cad yin pa'i phyir sa zhes bya bar bshad de /
translated: The realm of desire is called the stage because it is the seed of all.

original: dbang po sbyangs pa la sogs pa yon tan rnams de dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //🔽mi lcogs pa med pa zhes bya ba la 'ong bar bya ba ni 'ong bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po sbyangs pa la sogs pa yon tan rnams de dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro // mi lcogs pa med pa zhes bya ba la 'ong bar bya ba ni 'ong bar bya ba'o //
translated: because the qualities of the faculties, etc. are connected with it.

original: 'ong bar bya ba med pa ni 'ong bar bya ba med pa ste /
analyzed: 'ong bar bya ba med pa ni 'ong bar bya ba med pa ste /
translated: The first meditation is called “without initial inquiry and without investigation” because it is without the two, initial inquiry and investigation.🔽The first meditation is called “without initial inquiry and without investigation” because it is without the two, initial inquiry and investigation.

original: skye bas thob par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: skye bas thob par bya ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is not to be attained by birth.

original: bsam gtan dang po la 'jug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la 'jug pa'i sems so //
translated: It is the mind that enters the first meditation.

original: de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is of three types:

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: defiled, pure, and uncontaminated.

original: bsam gtan dang po la yan lag lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la yan lag lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The first meditation should be known as having five members:

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: initial inquiry, investigation, joy, happiness, and one-pointedness of mind.

original: dper na yan lag lnga pa'i phyi ma ltar yan lag lnga pa'i bsam gtan yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na yan lag lnga pa'i phyi ma ltar yan lag lnga pa'i bsam gtan yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as the five-limbed hymn has five limbs, so the first meditation has five limbs.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa @269a * //🔽la ni rab tu dang ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa @269a * //🔽la ni rab tu dang ba'o //
translated: In the second meditation, there is faith.

original: de yang dad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos te /
analyzed: de yang dad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos te /
translated: Faith is the nature of the Dharma.🔽It is established as a branch because it is superior, since it is the cause of the arising of the Dharma in equipoise.

original: chos de mnyam par gzhag pa dag las kyang 'byung ba yod do zhes lhag par shas che ba'i phyir yan lag tu rnam par gzhag pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: chos de mnyam par gzhag pa dag las kyang 'byung ba yod do zhes lhag par shas che ba'i phyir yan lag tu rnam par gzhag pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: Joy, pleasure, and one-pointedness of mind are the branches of the first dhyana.

original: de ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that pleasure is the pleasure of pliancy.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa las yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa las yan lag lnga ste /
translated: The third dhyana has five branches:

original: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / bde ba dang / ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: equanimity, mindfulness, introspection, pleasure, and samadhi.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la yan lag bzhi ste /🔽sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la yan lag bzhi ste / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: The fourth dhyana has four branches:

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / btang snyoms yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang / btang snyoms yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain,🔽pure equanimity,

original: de ni 'du byed kyi btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de ni 'du byed kyi btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: pure mindfulness, and samadhi.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni nyes pa brgyad las rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni nyes pa brgyad las rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: The fourth dhyana is free from eight faults:

original: nyes pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are these faults?

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang ; 'byin pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang / dbugs rngub pa dang ; 'byin pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: They are discursiveness, investigation, inhalation, exhalation, pleasure, pain, joy, and sorrow.

original: bsam gtan de dag kyang nyon mongs pa can dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / phung po lnga dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan de dag kyang nyon mongs pa can dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / phung po lnga dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: These meditative absorptions should be understood as defiled, as having outflows, as being without outflows, and as being associated with the five aggregates.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa'i nyes pas ni mes 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa'i nyes pas ni mes 'jig pa'o //
translated: Among these, the fault of discursiveness and investigation is the conflagration that destroys the world.

original: dga' ba'i nyes pas ni chus 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i nyes pas ni chus 'jig pa'o //
translated: The fault of joy is the flood that destroys the world.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byin pa'i nyes pas ni rlung gis 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang 'byin pa'i nyes pas ni rlung gis 'jig pa'o //
translated: The fault of inhalation and exhalation is the wind that destroys the world.

original: de la mes 'jig pa lan bdun 'das pa dang chus 'jig go //
analyzed: de la mes 'jig pa lan bdun 'das pa dang chus 'jig go //
translated: After seven conflagrations, there is one conflagration of the flood.

original: de ltar byas na 'od gsal gyi lta rnams kyi tshe bskal pa brgyad thub bo zhes bya ba de 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas na 'od gsal gyi lta rnams kyi tshe bskal pa brgyad thub bo zhes bya ba de 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is established that the life span of the gods of Abhasvara increases up to eighty thousand eons.

original: de ltar mes 'jig pa ni lan bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'o //
analyzed: de ltar mes 'jig pa ni lan bzhi bcu rtsa dgu'o //
translated: Thus there are forty-nine destructions by fire.🔽There are seven destructions by water.

original: chus 'jig pa ni lan bdun te 'jig pa de dag ni lan lnga bcu rtsa drug yin no //
analyzed: chus 'jig pa ni lan bdun te 'jig pa de dag ni lan lnga bcu rtsa drug yin no //
translated: There are fifty-six destructions by fire and water.

original: de'i 'og tu mes lan bdun 'jig go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mes lan bdun 'jig go //
translated: After that, there are seven destructions by fire.

original: de'i 'og tu rlung gis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rlung gis 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, there is one destruction by wind.🔽Thus the explanation in the Compendium of Abhidharma is good:

original: de ltar byas na gdags pa bshad pa las dge rgyas kyi lha rnams kyi tshe bskal pa drug cu rtsa bzhi thub po zhes bya ba legs par bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: de ltar byas na gdags pa bshad pa las dge rgyas kyi lha rnams kyi tshe bskal pa drug cu rtsa bzhi thub po zhes bya ba legs par bshad pa yin no /
translated: The gods of Brhatphala have a lifespan of sixty-four eons.

original: gzugs med pa gsum ni nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa phung po bzhi'i ngo bo nyid dang sa 'og ma'i gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa gsum ni nyon mongs pa can dang / dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa phung po bzhi'i ngo bo nyid dang sa 'og ma'i gnyen po yin no //
translated: The three formless states are afflicted, virtuous contaminated states, and uncontaminated states that are the antidote to lower levels and are the essence of the four aggregates.

original: de @269b la 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de @269b la 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo ni gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The desire realm and the summit of existence are solely contaminated.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni mi dge ba'i rtsa bas dri ma can du byas pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas par rung na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni mi dge ba'i rtsa bas dri ma can du byas pa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas par rung na /
translated: The desire realm is suitable to be contaminated because it is made impure by the root of nonvirtue and it is the level of nonequipoise.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo ji ltar zag pa dang bcas pa kho nar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo ji ltar zag pa dang bcas pa kho nar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how is the summit of existence only contaminated?

original: 'du shes zhan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes zhan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a weak level of discernment.

original: lhag ma ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: lhag ma ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: The rest are established as contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: gal te srid pa'i rtse mo gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'i yin na ji ltar 'phags pa'i gang zag der skyes pa nyon mongs pa spong zhe na /
analyzed: gal te srid pa'i rtse mo gcig tu zag pa dang bcas pa'i yin na ji ltar 'phags pa'i gang zag der skyes pa nyon mongs pa spong zhe na /
translated: If the summit of existence is only contaminated, how do aryas born there abandon afflictions?

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa'i lam mngon du byas te nyon mongs pa spong ngo //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa'i lam mngon du byas te nyon mongs pa spong ngo //
translated: They abandon afflictions by manifesting the path of the base of nothingness.

original: sde pa gzhan gang dag na re /🔽mgo mnyam zhes bya ba'i dgra bcom pa ni /
analyzed: sde pa gzhan gang dag na re / mgo mnyam zhes bya ba'i dgra bcom pa ni /
translated: Other schools say:

original: ras kyi mtha' la me zhen nas tshig pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de dag ni /
analyzed: ras kyi mtha' la me zhen nas tshig pa bzhin no zhes zer ba de dag ni /
translated: The arhat called equal to the peak is like the end of a piece of cloth that is burning.

original: dge slong dag ji tsam du 'du shes la snyoms par zhugs pa de tsam du kun shes par rab tu rtogs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag ji tsam du 'du shes la snyoms par zhugs pa de tsam du kun shes par rab tu rtogs so //
translated: Monks, to the extent that one enters meditative attainment with respect to ideation, to that extent one fully understands all.

original: gang yang 'di 'du byed kyi lhag ma srid pa'i rtse mo de la ni dge slong bsam gtan pa rnams kyis snyoms par zhugs shing langs nas rab tu rtog par 'gyur ba smra'o zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal lo /
analyzed: gang yang 'di 'du byed kyi lhag ma srid pa'i rtse mo de la ni dge slong bsam gtan pa rnams kyis snyoms par zhugs shing langs nas rab tu rtog par 'gyur ba smra'o zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal lo /
translated: This contradicts the statement, “Monks, those who are absorbed in meditative concentration say that the remainder of formations, the summit of existence, is fully understood by those who rise from meditative attainment.”

original: skabs su bshad pa rdzogs zhes bya ba ni skabs nas byung ba la skabs su bshad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skabs su bshad pa rdzogs zhes bya ba ni skabs nas byung ba la skabs su bshad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “The explanation of the section is complete” means that what arises in a section is explained in the section.

original: rdzogs zhes bya ba ni mthar phyin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdzogs zhes bya ba ni mthar phyin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Complete” means “finished.”

original: 'khor du nye bar bsdogs gtogs pa thams cad la ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: 'khor du nye bar bsdogs gtogs pa thams cad la ni btang snyoms so //
translated: The faculty of equanimity exists on all levels of access concentration to the absorptions.

original: dngos gzhi bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa la ni yid bde ba'i dbang po'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa la ni yid bde ba'i dbang po'o //
translated: The faculty of mental satisfaction exists on the actual basis of the first and second absorptions.

original: gsum pa la ni bde ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni bde ba'o //
translated: The faculty of pleasure exists on the third absorption.

original: bzhi pa la ni btang snyoms so //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni btang snyoms so //
translated: The faculty of equanimity exists on the fourth absorption.

original: ci'i phyir bzod pa rnams pas shes pa rnams sngar bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bzod pa rnams pas shes pa rnams sngar bstan ce na /
translated: Why are the knowledges taught first and the patiences later?

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the patiences are the antidotes to all the defilements.

original: bzod pa rnams ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po nyid do //
analyzed: bzod pa rnams ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po nyid do //
translated: The patiences are the antidotes to the defilements to be abandoned by the path of vision.

original: de la rdzas su na shes pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rdzas su na shes pa gnyis te /
translated: In substance, there are two knowledges:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'o //
translated: impure and pure.

original: rnam pa bdun gyi na bcur rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun gyi na bcur rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: In seven aspects, they are established as ten.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni kun rdzob shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni kun rdzob shes pa'o //
translated: By nature, conventional knowledge.

original: gnyen pos ni chos dang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen pos ni chos dang rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: By antidote, knowledge of dharmas and subsequent knowledge.

original: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag gi gnyen po'o //🔽rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni @270a * //
analyzed: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams mtha' dag gi gnyen po'o // rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni @270a * //
translated: Knowledge of dharmas is the antidote to the entire realm of desire.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi gnyen po'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi gnyen po'o //
translated: Subsequent knowledge is the antidote to the realms of form and the formless.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba shes pa ni rnam pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba shes pa ni rnam pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: Knowledge of suffering and origin are distinguished by their aspects.

original: 'gog pa dang lam shes pa ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam shes pa ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: The cognition of cessation and the cognition of the path are distinguished by their aspects and their cognitive object.

original: gzhan gyi sems la sbyor bas pha rol gyi sems shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems la sbyor bas pha rol gyi sems shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts is so called because it is applied to another's thought.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i rgyud la skye bas bya ba byas pa'i phyir zad pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i rgyud la skye bas bya ba byas pa'i phyir zad pa shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of exhaustion is so called because it is produced in the stream of one who has abandoned the defilements and has thus accomplished what had to be done.

original: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus shes pa thams cad kyis bsags pa'i phyir mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyus shes pa thams cad kyis bsags pa'i phyir mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of non-arising is so called because it is produced in the stream of one who has acquired the certainty that the defilements will arise no more.

original: ci'i phyir chos shes pa sngar bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir chos shes pa sngar bshad ce na /
translated: Why is the cognition of the factors explained first?

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the antidote to the realm of desire.

original: ci'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams kyi sngar spong zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams kyi sngar spong zhe na /
translated: Why is the realm of desire abandoned first?

original: de ni mngon sum gnyis kyis mngon sum du gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni mngon sum gnyis kyis mngon sum du gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the object of two direct realizations:

original: zin pa mngon sum dang rdzas mngon sum gyis so //
analyzed: zin pa mngon sum dang rdzas mngon sum gyis so //
translated: direct realization of the appropriated aggregates and direct realization of the substance.

original: khams gzhan gyi ni rdzas mngon sum nyid kyis so //
analyzed: khams gzhan gyi ni rdzas mngon sum nyid kyis so //
translated: The other realms are abandoned by direct realization of the substance alone.

original: yang 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa ni khams gsum car gyi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: yang 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa ni khams gsum car gyi gnyen po yin no //
translated: Moreover, the cognition of the factors with regard to cessation and the cognition of the factors with regard to the path are antidotes to the three realms.

original: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa khams gsum car gyi gnyen po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa khams gsum car gyi gnyen po ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness and with regard to the origin of unsatisfactoriness not the counter-agents of the three realms?

original: gzhan du yid 'byung la gzhan du 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du yid 'byung la gzhan du 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur du 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one would then be disgusted with the other realms and one would then become detached from the other realms.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du 'bras bur gyur ba nye bar lan pa'i phung po lnga rnams zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa'i 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni 'di skad du 'bras bur gyur ba nye bar lan pa'i phung po lnga rnams zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: The formations associated with the realm of desire are the five aggregates which are the effect of the action of the realm of desire.

original: de la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the factors with regard to the realm of desire is the cognition of the impermanence, the unsatisfactoriness, the emptiness and the non-self of these formations.

original: de la rgyu zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //
translated: The cause is the truth of the origin of unsatisfactoriness.

original: de 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The cessation of this cause is the truth of cessation.

original: de spong ba zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de spong ba zhes bya ba ni lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: The abandoning of this cause is the truth of the path.

original: de ltar rnam pa bcu drug tu shes pa gang yin pa de chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bcu drug tu shes pa gang yin pa de chos shes pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the factors with regard to the realm of desire is the cognition of these four truths under these sixteen aspects.

original: de ltar chos shes pa ni phung po lnga zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar chos shes pa ni phung po lnga zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the teaching is the five aggregates.

original: chos shes pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni brjod pa rnams yongs su sdud de /
analyzed: chos shes pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni brjod pa rnams yongs su sdud de /
translated: By the expression “knowledge of the teaching,” the path of insight is included, because it is the principal factor.

original: gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir rgyal po gshegs so zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gtso bor bstan pa'i phyir rgyal po gshegs so zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as, when it is said that the king is coming, it is understood that his retinue is coming also.

original: sa zhes bya ba ni bden pa rnams so //🔽sngar ni bye brag tu phye ste bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba ni bden pa rnams so // sngar ni bye brag tu phye ste bshad pa'o //
translated: The “stages” are the truths.🔽They have already been explained in detail.

original: da ni bye brag tu ma phye ba'o //
analyzed: da ni bye brag tu ma phye ba'o //
translated: Now they are mentioned without being explained in detail.

original: yang na chos zhes bya ba ni don gzhan du bshad de /
analyzed: yang na chos zhes bya ba ni don gzhan du bshad de /
translated: Or else, the expression “knowledge of the teaching” is explained in another way.

original: sbyor ba dang rnam par grol ba dang khyad par gyi lam rnams yongs su sdud pa'o /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang rnam par grol ba dang khyad par gyi lam rnams yongs su sdud pa'o /
translated: It includes the path of application, the path of liberation, and the special path.

original: de la sbyor ba'i lam ni gang gi 'og tu spong ba'i lam mngon du byed @270b pa'o ;
analyzed: de la sbyor ba'i lam ni gang gi 'og tu spong ba'i lam mngon du byed @270b pa'o ;
translated: The path of application is the path by which one subsequently realizes the path of abandonment.

original: / rnam par grol ba'i lam ni gang gis bral ba'i rnyed pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: / rnam par grol ba'i lam ni gang gis bral ba'i rnyed pa skyed pa'o //
translated: The path of liberation is the path by which one obtains separation.

original: khyad par gyi lam ni khyad par thob par bya ba'i lam yin pas khyad par gyi lam mo //
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam ni khyad par thob par bya ba'i lam yin pas khyad par gyi lam mo //
