translated: The special path is the path by which one obtains a special separation.

original: de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The foundations of mindfulness, etc.

original: gang gis dbang po sbyor ba la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis dbang po sbyor ba la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: are the means by which one accomplishes the qualities of the applications of the faculties, etc.

original: chos shes pa'i sa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i sa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The stage of the knowledge of the teaching🔽is the six stages.

original: sa zhes bya ba ni sa drug tu ston te de ni chos shes pa'o //
analyzed: sa zhes bya ba ni sa drug tu ston te de ni chos shes pa'o //
translated: The stage of the knowledge of the teaching is the six stages of the path of vision, because the knowledge of the teaching is the first knowledge to be attained on the path of vision.

original: gang dag 'du byed smos pa ni 'dus ma byas brtsal bar 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na don 'di gnyen por 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag 'du byed smos pa ni 'dus ma byas brtsal bar 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na don 'di gnyen por 'gyur te /
translated: Those who assert that the unconditioned is sought as an object of abandonment should understand this meaning as follows:

original: zag pa med pa ni nyes pa med pa'i phyir spang bar 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni nyes pa med pa'i phyir spang bar 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: The uncontaminated is not suitable to be abandoned because it is free of error.

original: ci'i phyir de chos shes pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de chos shes pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the knowledge of the teaching?

original: de'i phyir don dang mthun pa'i ming du ston to //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dang mthun pa'i ming du ston to //
translated: Therefore it is taught to be a name that accords with its meaning.

original: thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor ba zhes bya ba ji ltar thog ma med pa dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor ba zhes bya ba ji ltar thog ma med pa dang ldan zhe na /
translated: How is it that samsara possesses beginninglessness?

original: dge slong dag 'khor ba ni thog ma med do zhes smra'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'khor ba ni thog ma med do zhes smra'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “Monks, samsara is beginningless.”

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: “Always” means at all times.

original: bdag gi chu srin gyi chu srin 'dzin khri zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi chu srin gyi chu srin 'dzin khri zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa ste /
translated: “The crocodile of the ‘I’ and ‘mine’” refers to the attachment to “I” and “mine.”

original: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i chu srin 'dzin khri des zin pa ni bzung ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa'i chu srin 'dzin khri des zin pa ni bzung ba'o //
translated: “Seized by that crocodile of the ‘I’ and ‘mine’” means grasped by that.

original: de thog ma kho nar zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid du'o //
analyzed: de thog ma kho nar zhes bya ba ni dang po nyid du'o //
translated: “At the very outset” means at the very beginning.

original: chos tsam du mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos tsam du mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Because one sees only the dharmas” means

original: tsam gyi sgra ni bdag dang bdag gi dgag par ston to //
analyzed: tsam gyi sgra ni bdag dang bdag gi dgag par ston to //
translated: that the word “only” indicates the negation of “I” and “mine.”

original: chos shes pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: chos shes pa bshad zin to //
translated: The knowledge of dharmas has been explained.

original: rjes su rtog pa'i shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su rtog pa'i shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is subsequent knowledge?

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par rtogs pa'i 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par rtogs pa'i 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase “the formative forces that are the objects of the knowledge of the path of the realm of desire” means that the formative forces that are the objects of the knowledge of the path of the realm of desire are the formative forces that are the objects of the knowledge of the path of the realm of desire.

original: rjes su zhes bya ba ni phyi nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su zhes bya ba ni phyi nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Subsequent” means “afterward.”

original: rjes las rtogs pa ni rjes su rtogs pa ste phyi nas shes zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rjes las rtogs pa ni rjes su rtogs pa ste phyi nas shes zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa'o //
translated: “Subsequent knowledge” means knowledge that occurs afterward. It is the knowledge that occurs after the knowledge of the path of the realm of desire.

original: ci'i phyir rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa sa 'og ma'i gnyen po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa sa 'og ma'i gnyen po ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the subsequent cognition not the counteragent of a lower stage?

original: 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu gong du yar lta ba thur du mi lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na skyes bu gong du yar lta ba thur du mi lta ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a person who looks up and not down.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cognition of another's thoughts?

original: shes pa gang bsgoms pa las byung ba ni bsgoms pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: shes pa gang bsgoms pa las byung ba ni bsgoms pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The cognition that arises from the practice of meditation is of the nature of meditation.

original: dper na sa'i snod lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sa'i snod lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a vessel of earth.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The result of meditation is included in the path of liberation.

original: bsgom pa la brten nas thob pa ni sngon thob kyang de bsgom pa mngon du byed pa las byung ngo //🔽yang na bsgom pa la brten nas zhes bya ba ni skye bas 'thob pa dang / rtog ge'i rigs pas @271a * //
analyzed: bsgom pa la brten nas thob pa ni sngon thob kyang de bsgom pa mngon du byed pa las byung ngo // yang na bsgom pa la brten nas zhes bya ba ni skye bas 'thob pa dang / rtog ge'i rigs pas @271a * //
translated: That which is obtained in dependence on meditation is that which arises from the manifestation of the meditation that was previously obtained.

original: bskyed pa dgag pa ste /
analyzed: bskyed pa dgag pa ste /
translated: Or else, that which is obtained in dependence on meditation is that which is obtained by birth and that which is generated by the reasoning of dialectics.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin las skyes ba zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin las skyes ba zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The words born of concentration are stated in order to refute that.

original: ting nge 'dzin las byung bas ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las byung bas ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa ste /
translated: That which arises from concentration is born of concentration.

original: bsam gtan las skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsam gtan las skyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the term “born of meditation” is the same as before.

original: shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa gnyis kyi bar du smos pa ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa gnyis kyi bar du smos pa ni gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The terms “with-outflows” and “without-outflows” are mentioned in order to show that the two kinds of knowledge are of the nature of both.

original: gzhan dag gis kun rdzob shes pa'i 'og tu smos pa de dag gis ni gsum po dag gi skabs kyis sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis kun rdzob shes pa'i 'og tu smos pa de dag gis ni gsum po dag gi skabs kyis sbyar ro //
translated: The other masters say that the three kinds of knowledge are mentioned after conventional knowledge, because they are connected with the three realms.

original: de ltar rang bzhin bsnyad nas las ston to //
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin bsnyad nas las ston to //
translated: Having thus explained the natures of the three kinds of knowledge, their functions are now explained.

original: gang gis gzhan zhes bya ba la /🔽gzhan smos pas ni rang gi sems ma gtogs par ston te /
analyzed: gang gis gzhan zhes bya ba la / gzhan smos pas ni rang gi sems ma gtogs par ston te /
translated: The line “By which one knows the other” means that

original: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the other refers to the knowledge of others’ minds, because it is impossible for it to know its own mind.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa zhes bya ba sa ni khams gnyis kyi las ston to //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs su gtogs pa zhes bya ba sa ni khams gnyis kyi las ston to //
translated: The line “Belonging to the realm of desire and the realm of form” shows that it has the two realms as its object.

original: zag pa med pa kha cig ces bya ba smos pas ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i zag pa med pa rnams mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa kha cig ces bya ba smos pas ni gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i zag pa med pa rnams mi shes pa'o //
translated: The line “Some without-outflows” shows that it does not know the without-outflows of the formless realm.

original: mi ldan pa nyid yin bzhin du yang ci'i phyir mig shes gzugs kyi 'bab stegs kyi sgo nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi ldan pa nyid yin bzhin du yang ci'i phyir mig shes gzugs kyi 'bab stegs kyi sgo nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it not the case that the eye consciousness arises from the eye faculty and form as its basis and support?

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni shin tu yang mi shes so zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni shin tu yang mi shes so zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: It is taught that it is not known to be contaminated because it is beyond the level of the desire realm.

original: sa las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is beyond the level of the desire realm because it is the result of the first absorption.

original: da ltar byung ba smos pas ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa sel to //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba smos pas ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa sel to //
translated: The term present excludes the past and future.

original: yang na bsgoms pa las byung ba bsgoms pa'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
analyzed: yang na bsgoms pa las byung ba bsgoms pa'i rgyu las byung ba ste /
translated: Or it is derived from meditation bhāvanā because it arises from the cause of meditation.

original: dper na zas las byung ba'i srog dang rtsa las gyur pa'i ba lang zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na zas las byung ba'i srog dang rtsa las gyur pa'i ba lang zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like life force derived from food and a cow derived from grass.

original: nyer bsdogs kyis dngos gzhi bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu thob pa ste /
analyzed: nyer bsdogs kyis dngos gzhi bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu thob pa ste /
translated: It is the result of the actual basis of absorption obtained from access concentration.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽The path of the ninth liberated stage arises from absorption or access concentration.

original: bsam gtan las sam nyer bsdogs las rnam par grol ba dgu pa'i lam skye'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin du zin kyang dbang po 'pho ba shin tu dka' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsam gtan las sam nyer bsdogs las rnam par grol ba dgu pa'i lam skye'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu yin du zin kyang dbang po 'pho ba shin tu dka' ba'i phyir te /
translated: Even though this is so, it is difficult to upgrade one's intellectual faculty.

original: pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni dngos gzhi bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems shes pa ni dngos gzhi bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another is the effect of the fundamental meditations.

original: shes pa dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang 'dra ba ste /🔽zag pa dang bcas pas zag pa dang bcas pa shes la /
analyzed: shes pa dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid dang 'dra ba ste / zag pa dang bcas pas zag pa dang bcas pa shes la /
translated: Like the knowledge, i.e., like the nature of the object of knowledge.🔽When the mind is impure, the knowledge of the mind of another is impure; when the mind is pure, the knowledge of the mind of another is pure.

original: zag pa med pas zag pa med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pas zag pa med pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba shes pa'o //
translated: When the mind is associated with attachment, the knowledge of the mind of another is associated with attachment; when the mind is not associated with attachment, the knowledge of the mind of another is not associated with attachment.

original: de lta mod kyi sems la sbyor ba'i phyir sems kyi bsgo nas de skad ston to //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi sems la sbyor ba'i phyir sems kyi bsgo nas de skad ston to //
translated: But, in order to indicate the mind, the knowledge of the mind of another is designated by the name of the mind.

original: gang gi tshe sems shes pa de'i tshe sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems shes pa de'i tshe sems las byung ba'i chos rnams ma yin te /
translated: When one knows the mind, one does not know the mental qualities.

original: rdzas re re spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdzas re re spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of the knowledge of the mind of another is a single real entity, i.e., the mind.

original: ji ltar na 'dod chags dang bcas @271b pa'i sems su shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dod chags dang bcas @271b pa'i sems su shes she na /
translated: How does one know that the mind is associated with attachment?

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The mind associated with attachment is of two types:

original: ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dres pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dres pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa'o //
translated: associated with attachment through possession; associated with attachment through manifestation.

original: de la 'dres pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni mngon du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dres pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni mngon du gyur pa'o //
translated: The attachment of association is manifest.

original: ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni rnyed pa'i 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa ni rnyed pa'i 'brel pa'o //
translated: The attachment of possession is related to acquisition.

original: 'di ni 'dres pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa bzung bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dres pa'i 'dod chags dang bcas pa bzung bar rig par bya ste /
translated: This is the attachment of association that is accepted.

original: gos dang dri ma cig car mi 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gos dang dri ma cig car mi 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the simultaneous apprehension of a cloth and its stain.

original: 'di ni dmigs pa la lta ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni dmigs pa la lta ba ma yin te /
translated: This is not the view of the object.

original: bstan bcos las kyang chags par shes kyi che ge mo zhes bya ba'i dmigs pa la chags par ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos las kyang chags par shes kyi che ge mo zhes bya ba'i dmigs pa la chags par ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The treatise declares: “One knows attachment, but not the object of such-and-such an attachment.”

original: zag pa med pa la ni lam gyi bden pa'i rnam par ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa la ni lam gyi bden pa'i rnam par ro //
translated: The object of the uncontaminated is the aspect of the truth of the path.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad ni ma gtogs te /
translated: All the uninterrupted paths are excluded,

original: mchog tu dga' ba yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are associated with the attention of supreme joy.

original: de bas na mthong ba'i lam la bsgom pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na mthong ba'i lam la bsgom pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, in the path of insight there is no cultivation of the path,

original: mthong ba'i lam ni yid 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni yid 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because the path of insight is associated with disgust.

original: / de la bsam gtan dang po'i sa pas ni sa gnyis kyi shes so //
analyzed: / de la bsam gtan dang po'i sa pas ni sa gnyis kyi shes so //
translated: The cognition of the first meditation level cognizes two levels.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pas ni sa lnga'i shes pa'i bar du'o //🔽zag pa med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pas ni sa lnga'i shes pa'i bar du'o // zag pa med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Similarly, the cognition of the fourth meditation level cognizes up to five levels.

original: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang / rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The uncontaminated is also twofold: the aspect of cognition of the doctrine and the aspect of subsequent cognition.

original: de la chos shes pa'i phyogs kyis ni chos shes pa'i phyogs kyi shes kyi rjes su rtogs pa'i phyogs kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la chos shes pa'i phyogs kyis ni chos shes pa'i phyogs kyi shes kyi rjes su rtogs pa'i phyogs kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: The aspect of cognition of the doctrine cognizes the aspect of cognition of the doctrine, but not the aspect of subsequent cognition,

original: chos shes pa sa 'og ma la gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni sa gong ma la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos shes pa sa 'og ma la gnas pa'i phyir ro // rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa ni sa gong ma la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition of the doctrine is based on a lower level.🔽The subsequent cognition does not cognize the aspect of cognition of the doctrine,

original: chos shes pa'i phyogs kyi ma yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs kyi ma yin no //
translated: because it takes the higher level as its object.

original: zag pa med pa ni mchog tu gyur pas zag pa dang bcas pas mi shes pa ni rigs na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni mchog tu gyur pas zag pa dang bcas pas mi shes pa ni rigs na /
translated: The uncontaminated is supreme, so it is reasonable that the contaminated does not cognize it.

original: zag pa med pa ci'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa ma shes she na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa ci'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa ma shes she na /
translated: But why does the uncontaminated not cognize the contaminated?

original: zag pa med pa mchog tu dga' ba yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa mchog tu dga' ba yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with the mental attention of supreme joy which is free from impurity.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa ni yid 'byung ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa ni yid 'byung ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: That which is associated with impurity is the basis of disgust.

original: gzugs dang mi ldan pa rnams dpa' dus ma byas mi shes te /
analyzed: gzugs dang mi ldan pa rnams dpa' dus ma byas mi shes te /
translated: Those who are not in the form realm do not know those who are in the form realm,

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not know the minds of others.

original: sa mchog tu gyur pa mi shes te /
analyzed: sa mchog tu gyur pa mi shes te /
translated: Those of a lower stage do not know those of a higher stage,

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pas bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa mi shes so //🔽dbang po mchog tu gyur ba ni sa mtshungs kyang dbang po rtul pos dbang po rnon @272a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pas bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa mi shes so // dbang po mchog tu gyur ba ni sa mtshungs kyang dbang po rtul pos dbang po rnon @272a * //
translated: because those of the stage of the first absorption do not know those of the stage of the second absorption.🔽Those with a lower faculty do not know those with a higher faculty, even if they are on the same stage,

original: po'i rgyud las byung ba mi shes so //
analyzed: po'i rgyud las byung ba mi shes so //
translated: because those with dull faculties do not know those with sharp faculties.

original: gang zag mchog gi mi shes te /
analyzed: gang zag mchog gi mi shes te /
translated: Those of a lower spiritual level do not know those of a higher spiritual level,

original: ji ltar nyan thos kyis rang sangs rgyas kyi rgyud mi shes pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud mi shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos kyis rang sangs rgyas kyi rgyud mi shes pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud mi shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as a śrāvaka does not know the mind of a pratyekabuddha, and a pratyekabuddha does not know the mind of a tathāgata.

original: de'i don ni dbang po mchog nyid kyis go bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de'i don ni dbang po mchog nyid kyis go bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The meaning of this is understood by those with the highest faculties.

original: 'di la nyes pa med de dbang po ni rang gi sar gtogs pa rnams dang slob pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'di la nyes pa med de dbang po ni rang gi sar gtogs pa rnams dang slob pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: There is no fault here, for the faculties are of those who are in their stage and of those in training.

original: gang zag smos pa ni sar ma gtogs pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang ston to //
analyzed: gang zag smos pa ni sar ma gtogs pa dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yang ston to //
translated: The person is mentioned in order to indicate those who are not in a stage and those who are past and future.

original: nyan thos kyis ni mthong ba'i lam las skad cig gnyis shes te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyis ni mthong ba'i lam las skad cig gnyis shes te /
translated: The śrāvaka knows two moments of the path of insight:

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang ; lam la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang ; lam la rjes su rtogs par shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness and the receptivity to the subsequent cognition with regard to the path.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: mthong ba'i lam shin du mgyogs par 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam shin du mgyogs par 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the path of insight is very rapid.

original: ji tsam du dus gzhan du sbyor ba rtsom pa de tsam du de'i skad cig de rnyed 'da'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du dus gzhan du sbyor ba rtsom pa de tsam du de'i skad cig de rnyed 'da'o //
translated: To the extent that one takes up the preparatory practice, to that extent one obtains that moment.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis ni skad cig gsum shes te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis ni skad cig gsum shes te /
translated: The pratyekabuddha knows three moments:

original: gsum pa ni kun 'byung ba la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i skad cig go //
analyzed: gsum pa ni kun 'byung ba la rjes su rtogs pa'i shes pa'i skad cig go //
translated: the third is the moment of the subsequent cognition with regard to the origin.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sbyor ba ma mdzad par yang skad cig thams cad mkhyen to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sbyor ba ma mdzad par yang skad cig thams cad mkhyen to //
translated: The Fortunate One, without any preparatory practice, knows all the moments.

original: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa 'di ni bstan bcos las mtshan ma med par gnas pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa 'di ni bstan bcos las mtshan ma med par gnas pa zhes bstan to //
translated: The treatise declares that this person who is on the path of insight is “one who is situated in the signless.”

original: yang na gang zag smos pa nyid kyis dbang po tha dad pa spros te bstan to //
analyzed: yang na gang zag smos pa nyid kyis dbang po tha dad pa spros te bstan to //
translated: Or else, by mentioning the person, the author of the treatise also implies that there are different intellectual capacities.

original: gal te de lta na lha rnams kyis dge slong 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs so zhes smras pa'i mdo'i tshig 'di ji ltar sbyar /
analyzed: gal te de lta na lha rnams kyis dge slong 'di ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs so zhes smras pa'i mdo'i tshig 'di ji ltar sbyar /
translated: If this is so, how can one interpret the scriptural passage: “The gods declare: ‘This bhikṣu is intent on realizing the fruit of the once-returner’?”

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re dga' bar bya ba'i phyir byas so zhe'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re dga' bar bya ba'i phyir byas so zhe'o //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that this passage should be interpreted as meaning that the gods declare this in order to encourage him.

original: 'o na gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la zas sbyin zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa la zas sbyin zhes bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But how can one interpret the passage: “One who is intent on realizing the fruit of the once-returner”?

original: de'i phyir kha zas byin pa la zas kyi sgrar bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir kha zas byin pa la zas kyi sgrar bstan to //
translated: The author of the treatise explains that the word “fruit” should be understood as referring to the act of giving food.

original: kun rdzob shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is conventional knowledge?

original: lan btab pa /
analyzed: lan btab pa /
translated: The answer is:

original: shes rab zag pa dang bcas pa ste zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: shes rab zag pa dang bcas pa ste zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is contaminated wisdom.

original: rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin bstan pa'o //
translated: This indicates its nature.

original: kun rdzob ni sgrib pa ste shes pa sgrib pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni sgrib pa ste shes pa sgrib pa'o //
translated: The conventional is an obscuration, i.e. it is an obscuration of knowledge.

original: ma rig pa ma spangs pa'i phyir te rang bzhin dang rgyud rnam par grol ba gnyis kyis rnam par ma grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa ma spangs pa'i phyir te rang bzhin dang rgyud rnam par grol ba gnyis kyis rnam par ma grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because nescience has not been abandoned, i.e. because of the absence of liberation through the twofold natural and progressive liberations.

original: yang na kun rdzob ni tha snyad de der ltung ba'i shes pa ni kun rdzob shes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na kun rdzob ni tha snyad de der ltung ba'i shes pa ni kun rdzob shes pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, the conventional is a designation and knowledge that falls into that is conventional knowledge.

original: gzhan na re rgyun gyi shes pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan na re rgyun gyi shes pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Others believe that it is knowledge of the stream.

original: kun rdzob ni phal cher bum @272b pa dang ; snam bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kun rdzob ni phal cher bum @272b pa dang ; snam bu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The conventional is for the most part, i.e. it is generally, in regard to such things as a pot, a cloth, etc.

original: phal cher zhes bya ba smos pas lhag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba smos pas lhag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word for the most part is mentioned in order to indicate the exception.

original: shes pa 'di res 'ga' ni don dam pa la'ang 'jug ste /
analyzed: shes pa 'di res 'ga' ni don dam pa la'ang 'jug ste /
translated: This knowledge sometimes penetrates the ultimate,

original: ji ltar chos thams cad bdag med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar chos thams cad bdag med pa lta bu'o //
translated: just as it does in regard to the selflessness of all dharmas.

original: shes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa ni zag pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Knowledge is impure, i.e. it is mundane.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir dmigs pa yongs su gcod pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir dmigs pa yongs su gcod pa nyid do //
translated: The supramundane is the complete discernment of the objective support because it is the counteragent.

original: rang bzhin dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma gtogs par chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyi dmigs pa yin no //🔽sems kyi skad cig de ni gzhan gyi'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma gtogs par chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyi dmigs pa yin no // sems kyi skad cig de ni gzhan gyi'o //
translated: All factors are the natural object of the mental faculty, with the exception of its intrinsic nature and its coexistent factors.

original: de la rang bzhin ni mi shes te bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //🔽gang dag mar me'i dpes rang myong ba brjod pa de dag gi ltar na mar me ni snang bar bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin ni mi shes te bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro // gang dag mar me'i dpes rang myong ba brjod pa de dag gi ltar na mar me ni snang bar bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The intrinsic nature of a factor is not the object of the mental faculty bearing on this factor, for the activity of a factor is exercised upon another factor.🔽The mental faculty does not bear on itself.🔽The mental faculty does not bear on the intrinsic nature of the mental faculty.🔽The mental faculty does not bear on the intrinsic nature of another factor.

original: snang bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snang bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mental faculty does not bear on the intrinsic nature of the visual faculty.🔽The mental faculty does not bear on the intrinsic nature of the mental faculty and the visual faculty.🔽The
